reviews.text: Great variety of restaurants, bakeries, ice cream shops, and candy stores.
The score is for the outdoor 2-story plaza mall here, not for the association. There's tons of shops and even more restaruants. Definately stop here if you're coming to Chinatown.

Amazing !! I love chinese culture and it’s food , the people !! In this area they have a lot of restaurants where you can try different kind of food ! : D nice place to take lots of selfies and get some souvenirs !! Yes they have lots of parking zone , I will post soon more pictures

Chinatown is a wonderful foodie haven to enjoy the Chinese culture and a variety of Chinese cuisines, ranging from dim sum, Mainland China cuisine, Hong Kong cuisine, Taiwan cuisine, or ABC cuisine (ABC = American Born Chinese), each with their own varieties, character and flavors. The intensity of the flavors decreases according to the above listed order. Best of all, your dollar goes a long way over here! 

Additionally, there are also Chinese supermarkets. So you can get your Chinese meal fix here and buy some groceries back home to spice up your culinary meals. After a meal and buying groceries, don't forget to  leave with a cup of boba tea!
Great place to explore different Asian cultures and cuisines...

A lovely dragon wall greeting vehicles entering Chinatown from the expressway. It’s reminiscent of similar walls that I’ve seen around Asia. Excellent ceramic work. There’s not a lot to DO here other than look at the wall, but it’s a cute stop on a walk around the neighborhood.
Very cool monument in Chicago Chinatown. Only 3 in the world.
Worth a quick stop while you're in Chinatown.

Black Gate was added during the design to prevent damage to the wall, too bad it was not located between CTA and pagoda, because of right issues if the state ever wanted to build extenion to Congress, but that was long ago, for now, enjoy the wall, I wished it was bigger.

This spot would be a great photo op if it was only not gated! The wall itself is beautiful, but it's impossible to get a picture without the black fencing around the wall, since it's so close to the sidewalk.

Meh, it's an OK school. I've been there for five years and it's pretty okay. The teachers are great, after school is nice, but the food is not from the school and is bought from a restaurant nearby. Also, the building is kinda old.

Currently my children attend Pui Tak Christian School and love it.
The staff and volunteers there are amazing.

The food is definitely superb! I couldn't say this is the best northern Chinese food(only been to this one.), but it absolutely represent the northern cuisine style! Free parking lot on the side is a plus. Great service too!

We came here on the night of Chinese New year because we were afraid Chinatown was going to to be packed that night but we were not disappointed! It's a very cozy place with a fireplace and a free parking lot! We enjoyed all the dishes from the rice cakes to the seafood soup with homemade noodles. We liked that the flavor was on the lighter side (good light) reflecting cuisine from northern China. Delicious and authentic, great reasons to come back!
Delicious food. Beef noodle soup was one of the best soups I've ever had. Melt in your mouth beef and rich broth. Fantastic

We saw this restaurant on Chicago’s Best and we really enjoyed it. I liked the dumplings better than the potstickers and the sweet and sour pork was delicious. The menu is difficult to read (wish I would have seen the takeaway menu). We also tried the fried dough and it was good. They could also upgrade serving dishes (plastic baskets, sauces in plastic cups with plastic spoons). Service was good. Prices were reasonable for portions and very huge variety of choices.

Gave my husband a plate of beef FAT and when we refused to eat or pay for it, manager came out and said we had to because fat is how the dish came. No where in description did it say "just fat from the cow " or just a pile of fat cut off a steak. It said, beef tips. Not a shred of meat, completely inedible, and the customer is not always right here. Hostile manager. Really will never go back here again.

I highly recommend visiting this church in the Bridgeport neighborhood of Chicago.  The beauty and grandeur of this historic church is best experienced and most complete if you attend a Traditional Latin Mass, which is offered by the current pastor, Fr. Tom Aschenbrener.  My husband and I had our wedding celebrated here by the Institute of Christ the King Sovereign Priest, an order specially dedicated to the Latin Mass.  We'd like to express our sincerest gratitude to the pastor for allowing us to celebrate here!  St. Mary of Perpetual Help is one of those rare gems in our time that allows one to get the full effect of the sacraments, supported by its strong catechetical and formation programs, as does the Institute.  Don't miss making a visit here!
Awesome church, welcoming community, and gorgeous services. Music is beautiful.

I was recommended to visit St Mary’s church on my trip to Chicago and boy it did not disappoint. Not only is it beautiful but I enjoyed how holy the mass was said there. It is so hard to find a church today that embodies the true nature of how the mass should be and what should be taught. Old school style and values that I have come to appreciate now more than ever. I wish I lived closer, because I would be so blessed to call this my parish.
Best church in Bridgeport  older priest very helpful younger priest needs work !

Best parish in Chicago!  My family and I have been coming here for 4 years and have loved every minute.  Fr Tom and Fr Bart give every spare minute and more for their flock.  The parish isn’t conservative, and isn’t liberal, it’s Catholic, and that’s all we care about.  It’s also one of the most organically diverse parishes you’ll ever see...old Polish ladies, young Hispanic families, white collar, blue collar, and Sox t-shirts are seen every Sunday.  Everyone is welcome, especially crying babies, and we have a lot, which is great!

It may because I'm not an expert in Chinese food, but I love this place! They have giant pastries for next to nothing! I've never left hungry or upset with what I had to eat. It's definitely something if you want a delicious way to expand your horizons.
Great variety, all delicious and super cheap!

I've made a point of going to this bakery every year during the New Year's parade. My son loves the egg cake wrapped in a paper cone. I always get the pack of winter melon cookies and a noodle bar/cake. Next year it's the moon cakes. Cash only and don't let the outside fool you. It's a great place.
Excellent char siu bao! Friendly service.

While the place is small, they've got a seating area right behind the wall with the fridge, but to most outsiders, this is a quick in and out stop. Definitely don't be afraid to try the pastries due to their names or appearance, you literally cannot make a wrong choice. They have unusual mochi-like breads on the left of the case and to the right, the unusually delicious hot-dog-wiener-in-a-roll-of-bread. Also, if you tell the lady you're getting a lot and ask for a box, you well better be getting a lot of pastries because it's a big box.

The best place for pho noodles other than Tank Noodle. However, if your wallets permits you, Tank Noodle has better quality meats in my opinion. This place does get quite packed but generally service is decent. A large bowl runs for 8.50 currently. I haven't tried much of the other items on the menu but spring rolls and the cold noodles are good are well. The lemon pepper pork chop noodles are fantastic.

So damn good we went two days in a row!
Huge menu. Great vegetarian options. Pho was delicious. Pad Thai was huge and delicious. I took the rest home for lunch.

Lovely little Gem!!! The pho bowls are the best part of this place. A large for $8 and I do mean large. Be prepared to take home a takeout container. Clean, modern deco and friendly service as well tea on the house this is my kind of place. Perfect for a quick bite, a student/young professionals on a budget!!!

Atmosphere is not bad, service is alright go restaurant in Chinatown. 
The food though, the soup in pho tastes pretty good with generous portion of noodle.
Just note that there is no parking validation in this restaurant, which is quite inconvenient for us at the time.

The place is quite small but I always like it when restaurants have tables that are half booth and half chairs. They have a large variety of drinks and plenty of dish options for people looking to each something other than pho. The service was good up until we finished. We waited a bit to receive our take out dishes and a bit more for the receipt. It's a bit far from the center of Chinatown but was a worth the walk.

A hole in the wall in a sense, one of the best places in Chinatown for wonton noodle soup and roast duck. I'm sure they have other amazing food too, but they're amazing enough that I don't bother. Been coming here for over a decade strong!

Seven Treasures has a soup called Wonton Noodle soup w/ Shrimp Dumplings, and I usually ask for Xtra noodles for a buck or 2...  Hands down the best soup I've EVER had.  The egg rolls are mediocre, but their friend rice is above average.  Tea is great and the seeded hot sauce on the table is amazing too.  It's never busy, but don't let that fool you.  Been coming here since I was a kid, and will keep going every chance I get.

I believe this is one of the best places to eat at in Chinatown for cheap and great food. The crab ragoon is amazing and so is the corn and chicken soup. At first the one thing I noticed was the tax that they charged a lot of people after they were done eating regardless of party size. That would make me upset. Therefore I would let that be my tip or I would add a few extra dollars. I understand the reason why they do that is because a lot of people unfortunately do not tip their servers for great service. I understand tipping is a choice but for a server that is a living. They stopped charging me the tax after they seen I go often and tip well. That was the only thing that I did not appreciate other than that the restaurant is amazing.

This restaurant is more of a right place to have cheap Chinese food than tasty Chinese food. The food was mediocre. Service was quick. It only took us less than 5 minutes to wait after we had ordered to get the food ready on the table. Perhaps we did not order the best meals at the restaurant, but both Beef with Black Pepper Sauce, and Wonton and BBQ Pork Noodle Soup were decent in taste. The food was cheap though.
Wonton noodle is taste good but the wonton is a little bit too salty.

An okay fast-food joint. The food quality isn't great, but the service is generally pretty fast. I ordered a pork-chop sandwich and fries and received the pork bone-in with some sauteed onions and an ample amount of fries in a brown paper bag. 

As it is open 24-hrs, it's likely best ordered in the late night to order.

Great late night eats, stupendous "real" fast food. The cheeseburgers here are easily my #1 favorite burger; I really didn't think I'd enjoy their standard loadout of only mustard and grilled onions, they're working some magic in there because boy was I wrong! 

I make fairly regular trips to Chicago and Maxwell Street Depot is my go-to food stop for a quick bite on the way home. It's amazing how quickly your food is ready, usually something like 1-3 minutes from ordering to bag of food sitting in front of you. Good luck getting anywhere even close to this speed (or quality) from a franchise burger joint!
Came here all time in college.  Great simple fast food.  Service was always quick.
Always good. Everything comes with fries and grilled onions. . They have cheeseburgers, double cheeseburgers, hotdogs, polish dogs, and porkchop sandwiches.

Perfectly prepared Chicago style burgers! All burgers come with a side of fries and the Chicago toppings which are mustard and grilled to perfection onions. I think a cheese burger (fries included as with all burgers) is $3.50. Open late and possibly 24/7 so grab some munchies at 2 am!

Love the food here. Great service! But recommend ordering food ahead of dine-in. 
Weekends tend to be busy. Long wait time if you aren't ordering pizza. My order came out almost 15 minutes after my friend.

But the food is amazing!

The food is excellent especially the spinach and mushroom deep dish pizza. They also have the best french fries in Chicago. The restaurant is very clean and the atmosphere is very fun with all the old vintage framed photos on the walls and the old time music that is played. Family friendly and good time.

Hands down the messiest, fullest, deliciousiest breaded steak sandwich. I recommend it. The poppers are great too, they have cheddar inside. 
I get mine with red sauce, mozzarella cheese, sweet peppers, and hot peppers. Others might like to omit the sauce. Mozzarella sticks we're good too. Expect a long wait for getting food during rush hour, worth it!

Classic spot for good food. I recommend the breaded steak with some cheese and the double BBQ wings. There's a lot of other food options from pasta, pizza, sandwiches, etc. Expect to pay at least $5 for the cheaper options. There are also pizza slices for around $3, I'd go for the deep dish sausage. Italian ice here is good too!

I had good service and the food was good. The portions are big so have an appetite or share. Open late. I had the silican beef; which is an Italian beef the flavor was different but it was pretty good. It's clean inexpensive and I give it a solid 3.5 out of 5.
Good variety of cheap food. Best meal I had in Chicago. I will continue to eat there. And it was cute they served us oranges with the check.
Nice spot for Chinese food. Food was so tasty. Menu is like a cafe in Boston I loved.

The service was good. I enjoyed that they were not overly in your face asking how the food was, "is there anything I can get you", etc. I ordered, the food came, we ate it. Then I made eye contact with the waitress, they cleaned the table, brought the check, we paid, and then left.

On to the food, the beef with Chinese broccoli and Beef and Vegetable Chow Mein were very good. However, the Crab Rangoons were even better, I could've eaten 3 orders of them in one serving. They came fast, were nice and warm, and were absolutely delicious.

Cool spot for cheap eats and the food was great! The place looked very clean. Food came out very fast and service was actually pretty good. Nothing too crazy in reference to the decor but I wasn't expecting too much to begin with. It's right in the middle of Chinatown and it's surrounded by a ton of other restaurants if you're not happy with this one. Just happened to be the first one we walked in once we arrived and I'm happy we did.
Chinese food, so great. Entered near ten, it was not crowded. Looking forward to going back again.

If you're in the area it's a good quickie spot. Good quality and portions for the price.
It has a decent menu with many of the familiar Chinese dishes. I've been there multiple times and each time has been pretty consistently good. No complaints.

MY FAVORITE CHINESE RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO!   I have been coming here for years and have yet to be disappointed. Get past the decor and see this place for what it really is - a family owned, mom and pop masterpiece! I highly recommend the sweet and sour pork.  The shell is sweet like a pastry.   I have never found anything like it elsewhere.  The pork fried rice is addicting.  Dinner for 2 is a value with egg rolls, soup, pork fried rice, sweet and sour pork and beef with Chinese broccoli. Just be aware that "Chinese" style broccoli is the stalks only. Get the hot and sour soup if you like spicy.  I cannot recommend this place enough.

The people there are super friendly and the food is simply amazing! Easily the best Chinese food I've had in some time. Went with my friends and ordered a lot for takeout. Will definitely be back and can't recommend enough!

Chinese food with no frills. You’ll be satisfied if your aim is to fill your belly with Chinese food.

Great portions at very decent prices. Everything was hot and fresh with the exception of the egg rolls which tasted re-fried.

Service was also minimal, but we went for Chinese food and that was exactly what we got.

Ordered fried pork and it was so salty that I had to get another bowl of rice. Plus the server threw away a piece of meat on the plate before serving it to me. Besides that I only liked the tea with fresh jam.

The food is definitely superb! I couldn't say this is the best northern Chinese food(only been to this one.), but it absolutely represent the northern cuisine style! Free parking lot on the side is a plus. Great service too!

We came here on the night of Chinese New year because we were afraid Chinatown was going to to be packed that night but we were not disappointed! It's a very cozy place with a fireplace and a free parking lot! We enjoyed all the dishes from the rice cakes to the seafood soup with homemade noodles. We liked that the flavor was on the lighter side (good light) reflecting cuisine from northern China. Delicious and authentic, great reasons to come back!
Delicious food. Beef noodle soup was one of the best soups I've ever had. Melt in your mouth beef and rich broth. Fantastic

We saw this restaurant on Chicago’s Best and we really enjoyed it. I liked the dumplings better than the potstickers and the sweet and sour pork was delicious. The menu is difficult to read (wish I would have seen the takeaway menu). We also tried the fried dough and it was good. They could also upgrade serving dishes (plastic baskets, sauces in plastic cups with plastic spoons). Service was good. Prices were reasonable for portions and very huge variety of choices.

Gave my husband a plate of beef FAT and when we refused to eat or pay for it, manager came out and said we had to because fat is how the dish came. No where in description did it say "just fat from the cow " or just a pile of fat cut off a steak. It said, beef tips. Not a shred of meat, completely inedible, and the customer is not always right here. Hostile manager. Really will never go back here again.

Food was served quick and hot. The waitress recommended something new for me to try and I loved it! The staff was nice and responsive, they even turned up the heat when I was cold. One of the wait staff asked if I was cold and I said yes and it suddenly became warmer. I will definitely find ways to visit again and bring lots of friends.
The server was friendly. I got the sangria. It was amazing. The tacos were good. I also liked the salsa. The verde sauce was good. I would recommend this place.

Great experience for first visit. Authentic Mexican menu with variety in choices. But small tables and cozy environment still made for crowded room during lunch hours. Will visit again when appetite is high for Mexican food.
One of my favorite Mexican food restaurants in the south side. Steak burrito is delicious. Their steak is seasoned and grilled to perfection.
Food was wholesome.  Drinks were awesome. Meat was very flavorful. Doesn't quite taste like Mexican food I've had in Mexico. But it was some of the best I've have in Chicago.
Much better and laid back than the pretentious one in River North. Tasty meals and steep “spicyness” levels. Generally speaking I would recommend it but I tried better. Good price deal though
One of the best meals I've had in Chicago. The menu is really long so don't feel guilty if you just order a bunch of dishes and take some home. Also be sure to order the plum wine, it's delicious!

Great food.  Been coming to Chicago for years on business. I've always wanted to go to Chinatown but never have. This time some co-workers who knew the restaurant took us here. The food was outstanding.  We had the opportunity to eat some unusual dishes. I'm very glad we ate here tonight.
Every thing I ordered was delicious! The staff was also very nice and on point. Will definitely go back.

I generally don't give one star reviews, but I had an exceptional experience.  I placed a delivery order, and the food arrived cold yet nevertheless overcooked, and racist.  On delivering the food, the driver commented that there were too many black people in my neighborhood.

Very noisy.  Kid friendly. Staff friendly, smiley. 
Food delicious, chose specials Fish and Chicken, would have liked to see more veggies on the plate bit sparse.
Cost Definitely Wellington $$$
Just visiting for the day, had lunch.

23/3: Our third visit today with other friends and overall experience was very good. Cafe Polo consistently amazes us! See you next time!

*****************************************

It was our first time at Cafe Polo and overall experience was pretty good. Staff was quite pleasant and food was good. I really enjoyed my beef burger and everyone else at my table enjoyed their meal too. We're definitely coming back.

Came from Auckland for the long weekend, stopped into Polo Cafe and ordered the Big Breakfast. It was amazing!! Really liked the fact they use steel straws. Would gladly come back next time I'm in Wellington.Such a chilled out cafe and we loved the artwork!

Great food and generous serving sizes. The coffee's pretty good, and the venue is nice and cosy.

I got the club sandwich, which was way bigger than I expected (a pleasant surprise) while the missus got the broccoli soup, which was a special at the time.

Cafe Polo is my fav breakfast place in the whole Wellington! The staff is so welcoming (and patient when I order lots of sides). The venue has a feels-like-home vibe. The coffee is great, the food is amazing. They have all the best local beers, wines and sodas. I'm looking forward for they dinner nights!
Free entry.. Perhaps one of the very few interesting places in Ankara. You'll find all about Ataturk.. his pictures, life size wax statue and his grave. Must visit place!

The place as a poetic painting of every part in which a description of the championship and courage.The fragrant anniversary and long history of the heroes of this great country.You can feel the spirit of heroes and brave fighters and you wander around this great edifice.
I love it.

A magnificent complex perfectly encapsulating the importance of Atatürk as founder and shaper of the modern Republic of Turkey. This is definitely one of the foremost sights for any visitor to Ankara. Just remember that this is almost a sacred place for many Turks and so act especially respectful here.
After Traveling to ankara I felt in love with the city! Amazing! Best city in middle east! Specially Young people are great in Turkey. Love it

Minimalistic monument, nice to see. When we visited it was snowing heavily so it wasn’t so easy to approach cause the stairs were frozen and it was slippery. Besides the weather conditions, there aren’t many signs so we didn’t even realise there was also a museum and not just the monument so we missed that part which I later heard was the best part :/ And the securities on the entrance were really nice and friendly.

Their affordable housing for senior citizens is one of the best in the city.  They also help seniors with employment and have a social impact business in landscaping.  The Renaissance Collaborative is worth your donation and contribution to its efforts to develop an additional 54-unit senior housing facility that will have set aside 24 units that will be 2-3 bedrooms for grandparents that are raising their grandchildren.  This under served population is growing and the need for affordable housing is difficult.
In the business of helping !💞🙏
Nice safe place accepting HCV from CHA.
Good place for a new start ... Help with Employment.
I live here  and like it a lot

While I did joyfully encounter 'her story", Dr. Margaret Taylor-Burroughs; her talent and life work in bringing "the only major independent institution in Chicago established to preserve and interpret the historical experience and achievements of African Americans", to life. I walked away feeling as if a huge chunk of the African American experience had been omitted. Such a history and culture is soo rich, diverse, complex, hidden, organic and powerful/painful yet, this beautiful museum provided a foretaste of some of the experiences the Negro in America.  

The staff members were very professional and friendly and especially the beautiful sisters in the gift shop. There's lots to see and read with one powerful exhibit not suitable for minors.

It was a very nice museum. The staff was very friendly. There wasn’t quite so much to see as we might have expected but what they had was nicely done. This is not an interactive museum so not for littles. They did have a couple of video history niches but I couldn’t hear them at all. I’ll go back when they open their other building across the street.

This museum is small but it captured my attention. Prior to my visit I was unaware of the extent of Dr. Margaret Taylor-Burroughs' sacrifices and contributions in Chicago. There are some topics I felt could have been developed more in the presentation. There are obvious signs of plans for expansion of the museum which I hope to see. Hopefully the expansion will include interaction for children.

I really enjoyed this museum and I appreciate they commemorated local black men and women. The museum displayed many aspects of African American culture from portraits to artifacts. The staff were really nice. I enjoyed the story-telling booths as well. The artifacts the narrators were describing were displayed in the museum. That will make everyone see what is truly going on which allows being to be sympathetic to our history.
Lovely place. Not too big so you are able to take your time and experience all exhibits, some of which are interactive. I will definitely return when I'm passing through again

Amazing art. I love Andre the owner. He is unbelievable as far as community organization and giving back to the community and community involvement. There is also an outside space that you really have to see to believe.it is definitely worth the trip down to 47th Street

Great black owned venue. I've attended a few events here. Very spacious and showcasing some of the best African American artists the city has to offer. The location is a great choice in the sense that it makes art and the art community easily accessible to the south side residents ; an effort to be more inclusive.

One of my favorite Bronzeville spots! Supporting local talent in a nicely crafted space is a win-win. You can also host private events here in which the ambience makes for the perfect setting for those laced with class.
Great place to take your spouse very lovely art work will come again!

Buy Art Not Drugs... The proprietors at Gallery Guichard are dedicated to educating the public on fine art. There's always an amazing event to celebrate the arts with ample opportunity to purchase. I love it!
Very rustic, It will be great for birding!

The guy who runs this place doesn't even know anything about Stephan Douglas. I didn't come to this tomb to learn about LINCOLN. Let me tell you what. If I was ever homeless, I would most definitely sleep here. IT IS DRY IN THERE. NOT AS DRY AS PROBABLY AT A LINCOLN MEMORIAL, but 5 stars none the less for effort.

Interesting historically,  if somewhat lost in the present day.  Some displays of information about Senator Douglas' remarkable life to provide historical perspective would make this much interesting and visited.
There is different from how it looks like in the street view. Now in 2017, there is a bridge, nice and full of lights. Good for walking or biking.
Interesting to look at, but have to agree, an outside historical display is needed.

Amazing art. I love Andre the owner. He is unbelievable as far as community organization and giving back to the community and community involvement. There is also an outside space that you really have to see to believe.it is definitely worth the trip down to 47th Street

Great black owned venue. I've attended a few events here. Very spacious and showcasing some of the best African American artists the city has to offer. The location is a great choice in the sense that it makes art and the art community easily accessible to the south side residents ; an effort to be more inclusive.

One of my favorite Bronzeville spots! Supporting local talent in a nicely crafted space is a win-win. You can also host private events here in which the ambience makes for the perfect setting for those laced with class.
Great place to take your spouse very lovely art work will come again!

Buy Art Not Drugs... The proprietors at Gallery Guichard are dedicated to educating the public on fine art. There's always an amazing event to celebrate the arts with ample opportunity to purchase. I love it!

I was fairly impressed by the quality of food in this establishment. A lot of people use their take-up service. Whenever I have dined in, I noticed that most of the customers take their food away. Very clean establishment, excellent customer service, tasty food. I did think though that they were a bit pricey, especially for a hot dog place.
Very clean.  We love the vegetarian hot dogs there!

H-Dogs is a unique eating establishment in the Chicago Bronzeville neighborhood on the South Side. It has a gourment menu with wild game sausages. The fare is fresh and whimsical version of fast food restaurant. It is spacious,  clean, open and inviting. It is across the street from the Harold Washington Cultural Center. It is also located a few doors away from the Jokes and Notes Comedy Club.

I have carry-out lunch here often.  I order their yummy salmon burger with truffle fries (the truffle fried are very delicious when hot) and a blood orange or limonata  San Pallegrino sparkling water.  Most of the time, I  call in to place an order and it is generally ready in 15 minutes.  I recommend this place as an alternative to fast food.  Always remember they close around 6 p.m.

Lunch was very good! The veggie chilli dog with fries was exactly what I was looking for; the pesto grilled cheese could stand to improve a bit. The high volume on the TVs was slightly disruptive, but the interior was generally appropriate for a hot dog joint with higher aspirations.
Food was so tasty. The service here is better than most. The bill was decent for the quality.
As far as the amber inn the workers stoled all my clothes do not trust them

Drove down from Michigan and was not disappointed! It was so good I came back my second day in town! Our waiter was amazing the young lady who prepared our to go plates was very polite and her and the waiters costumer service was on point! Thanks Pearls Place for and amazing experience! I will be back!

Pearls Place Restaurant is a iconic culinary gem in the Bronzeville community. Throughout the years you can always count on courteous service, comfortable seating & well maintained dinning areas for individuals or groups. The food is soulfully prepared, generous servings, with tried & true classics at every meal 
 ( breakfast, lunch and dinner) , when have you last had fried green tomatoes?. The prices are also quite reasonable. Don't just take my word, check the on- line menu , better yet take your appetite and go check it out for yourself  & bring a guest. I can't wait to dine there again.🍽️

Love the food. Definitely good soul food. You'll run into some celebrities and local politicians. The few times I've been there I saw Jesse Jackson, Sr. and his entourage. The time before was Bobby Rush. If you're a picky eater then don't order the buffet. Order off the menu. But if you like a lot of different things the buffet is for you.

Good old÷fashioned soul food cooking. The breakfast buffet was delicious. Whomever is doing the cooking in Pearl's certainly knows what Soul/Creole/Jamaica food should taste like. The Jambalaya, Jerk chicken, and Spinach was well seasoned; I did not have to use any salt, pepper, or hot sauce.I love the dining room! I will be back!
I honestly like the dishes and service, excellent area right next to my home. The employees are always welcoming. Would recommend to others.

This is a Gorgeous Church the prettiest Church I have ever seen. My parents were married here in the 60's. My Grandfather went to school here as well. Maiden name is Annmarie Doloris Daniel. Carole Ann Ben daughter. Ben Daniels daughter. My Grandfather the late Frank Ben. Helen Frank Ben beloved wife.
Very old structure nice view inside
One of the most beautiful churches in chicago.
Very beautiful and peaceful church.
The most beautiful church I’ve ever seen. The church is breathtaking. The Organ is breathtaking. Amen.

I love getting desserts from here when they’re fresh. The Carmel cake/cupcake taste like Garrett’s Popcorn which is so good. The strawberry cupcakes are rare, because those go so quickly! The vanilla cupcakes have the real buttercream frosting. 

Her lemon cookies are really good! Two small cookies sandwiched with lemon curd in the middle. 
Her potato chip chips cookies are addictive! 
Key lime pie is good.. to expensive for the serving size.
The cookies are phenomenal. The other baked goods are very good. The owner and staff are very helpful and take pride in their baking.
Horrible, cupcakes hard and dry, peach cobbler not sweet, cookies hard, ice cream ordinary as cheap ice cream at $6 a pint. The key lime and lemon pie tastes like the same but it is good.
Great bakery! The oatmeal and chocolate chip cookies are both especially good.

This is the worst bakery I have ever patronized!!!! The only reason I gave them 1 star was because I could not give a review without doing so. When I initially placed my order the ladies were very pleasant. I was very specific with the details of my order and asked both ladies if they were able to fulfill my request. They assured me they could so I placed the order. The day I picked up the cake I was in a serious rush so I grabbed it and rushed off. That was a huge mistake on my part!!! The cake was ATROCIOUS!!!! It was big, messy, and very poorly decorated!! I called to complain and they were so unprofessional and did not even attempt to offer an apology or solution!!! My guests arrived and could not stop laughing at the cake. They refused to believe I paid for the cake let alone from a professional baker. They took pictures and posted them on social media, it was so embarrassing!!! The cake tasted as bad as it looked!!! The whipped cream icing was too sweet and had chunks of sugar crystals. The strawberry center had very few strawberries and the ones that were there tasted like cough syrup and the cake tasted like sweet cornbread!!! A $76 garbage cake!!!! None of the guests liked it!!! My daughter was very disappointed, I was very angry and my guests were in disbelief and very amused!!! When you own a business you have to be more than nice, your product has to be good!! This bakery failed miserably and if the ladies were as nice as I thought they were they would have done the right thing and tried to work with an unsatisfied customer! They did NOTHING!!!!! I wish I could post a picture of this horrible cake so everyone could see for themselves!!!!

One of the best BBQ joints in Chicago!  Real smoke house ribs with an unique sauce, tender ribs, perfectly cooked links.  Late night hours perfect for after night life pit stop. Take out only. Small lot with free parking.  Small space, fast service, but sometimes long lines!

I have been a Lem's customer since 1982. My husband introduced me to this local delicacy!! A true gift of taste! 🤣 Lem's has a distinctive smell, taste and staff! The ladies and guys make you feel welcome by yelling out, "What you want"!! as you walk in the door. Always a beautiful experience for me and my family. I have sisters and friends who drive over an hour to come out to Lem's! Awesome.

My wife and I try to make Lem's a weekly experience. I've been a faithful customer for over 45 years. Not much has changed. So I'd recommend the entire menu. I would rate 5 stars, but on too many occasions they run out of something that leads to lines being backed up outside the establishment. Otherwise this is a nice Family ran business with quality Bar-B-Q.
Just understand the Owner has no tolerance for BS, and she will let you know. Bless her Heart...

Our first time here and the food was delicious! Hubby has the Bleu Moo brisket sandwich and I had the Pulled Pork plate. The Asian Slaw and Kale and Apple Slaw were both amazing. The guys were very nice too. Don't let the small place scare you away. Worth coming to LA just for this place.

Had the center cut and hot links. The ribs were definitely bland. The sauce helps but they should be soaked overnight or “something.” For 14.25 you’d expect some decent ribs. They also didn’t have enough meat on them! They’re  not terrible though.... just lacking flavor and quality. The hot links were good. You can’t go wrong with grilling those as their already made and ready to grill. Customer service was average. Food came out fast. Fries were MEH. Like most dark brown and not hot and fresh. My toddler wouldn’t even eat them and he is big on fries. Up the quality some please. I like to support my BOBs(black owned businesses) 
I will be back for some hot links and to try out the potato salad.
Went to Three Jays on 74th & Vincennes n it's closed down. I was so disappointed.  Was looking forward to eating there. Does anyone know where they moved to ?
The food is the best u can't go wrong try it u will like it

I work at a medical center on the southside of Chicago.  We have a lot of food trucks every noon from good restaurants.  The only two trucks that really brighten my day are the Three J's food truck and the Giordano's pizza truck.  Three J's is the only truck that serves a delicious home cooked meal.   My favorite is jerked catfish -- tender and juicy with a touch of tasty char on the outside.  The sides are very good: red beans and rice, greens, sweet potatos, mac and cheese.   After jerked catfish, I will take the pot roast, tender with solid roast beef flavor.  Smoothered pork chops, yes.  You may get two meals out of one box from the THree J's food truck.
I love the food there. I have to go every week

When fresh, hot links are excellent, full of sage and red pepper. They're smoked, then flash-fried, which gives them a nice pop when you bite into them. Tell them you don't want dry or burnt links. Sometimes they hold them too long and will try to slip you a Mickey. Quality control was better when the old man was around on 69th Street.
Very good and affordable BBQ. Great taste of smoked flavor along with great sauce. The building is clean with good assessible parking lot. I strongly suggest the turkey tips. Yummy!!

Sauce and tips delish. Customer service isn't a priority. You can buy a large tip and links box and its supposed to feed 4 to 5 but the coleslaw given is for a toddler.... Doesn't make sense but again sauce is A1.

Going up on the prices while shrinking the portions. I love the food. But the price to portion ratio bugs me. They are the only barbecue restaurant I know of where you can purchase a combo instead of buying everything separate. I love their hot links and rib tips. I must try the turkey tips.

They are hit or miss, depends on when you go and who's cooking. It was "GREAT" when they were located on 69th Calumet!! Its not bad though, I've had much worse. A little pricey (as you would expect from any BBQ house). Too sum it all up, I still eat from there and will continue to do so when I have a taste for some Uncle John's

We came here for Father’s day brunch and it was absolutely perfect. The buffet options were tasty and the service was impeccable. Definitely recommend. But remember that it’s BYOB- so bring your own libations.
Love the food it was so awesome...
Great food and service!

Great experience all around! My wife and I had dinner here to celebrate our 18yr anniversary. We had our wedding at the South Shore Cultural Center so this was the perfect place to have dinner and celebrate. I requested the best table in the house and when we walked in they had placed a reserve sign on our table. The food was good and the waiter went out of her way to ensure we were having a good time. They brought out complimentary sparkling apple cider in tall champagne glasses for us and really dressed up the desert especially for us. It was quiet with a small crowd, good background music, the ambiance was romantic and the view was fantastic. Quality cuisine at affordable prices. Thank you for a making our evening special!

This was my first time at the restaurant. The atmosphere was romantic and elegant (we were the only 2 there for the first 10 minutes) and the waiter we called D was extremely professional; you would have never known he was a student doing an internship if it wasn’t revealed. The menu was simple which I liked with 4 options of entrées to suit everyone; there was salmon, steak, chicken, and vegetarian. Four courses for only $25 and the salmon and steak was delicious. My ONLY issue with the experience was that at the end of the meal there was a fee on the bill called a “Scholarship Fee”. One of the reasons I initially said I would go back was because it is a restaurant giving students the experience they need to succeed so I’m all for educating and supporting students. My problem with this is that we were not informed of it beforehand. Therefore, I feel like we were being forced to contribute to this cause when it should be optional. We were told it wasn’t option and we had to pay it. What if…. Just what if we only had enough money for the meal and a small tip? What would happen then? I had plans on taking my mom and daughters there to support the school and introduce them to this hidden gem of a place, but that left a sour taste in my mouth and not sure now. The fee is based off the total bill amount so it was only $6, but it is the principle of the matter. This should have been listed on the menu or disclosed before the bill arrived and being told it HAD to be paid. Customer service is everything to me.
This is great. It's very clean, the staff is nice, the classes are good, parking isn't too hard to find. Happy!
Jeff Fest at the end of July is awesome! We've gone every year since 2014.

The fields are decent sized for soccer and baseball. The Fieldhouse is open, at least during activity times, and they have a public bathroom. No water fountains turned on, presumably due to the areas iron issue in the water. Half the area is paid for parking, the other half is free, but it is by an apartment complex and busy intersections so it can be a pain and dangerous to park on or cross the streets. They do maintain this park and it is clean.
We  had alot of fun
It is small and cute place!!!
I have been going to this church for a while and it is very friendly.
Catholic church
Beautiful Church. Attended elementary school here in the 60's.
I have went there a lot of times

He asistido  hace poco más de 4 meses ,las personas que ayudan son muy amigables pero lo que es el padre Benjamín Arévalo es de lo mejor que yo aya visto ,es tan agradable asistir a las misas que el imparte que te hace sentir excelentemente bien ,y creo que las palabras son pocas con las que yo pueda expresarlo , tienen que vivirlo para saberlo.

Wow. Great German food and drink in beautiful 2 story shop. Hard to find items, and deli is great value. Think that they make enough on wines and higher priced items to make the meat cheese counter a spanking great value. Outside Rooftop bar and grill featuring German cuisine. Great place
I love shopping at Gene's.  The prices are reasonable, the variety pleasing and the service is great.  You should definitely check out the rooftop when it's open!
So many choices of great food and meats. Not over priced, and a good place to try something new. Also the rooftop beer garden is the place to be in the summer.

Great selection of European and other meat, deli, cheese, wine, dessert, preserves, and packaged items that you don't often see available in one location. Items are beautifully displayed in a lovely market setting. Located in Lincoln Square it is surrounded by many other great shops.

They won't always have everything you want but they'll have everything you need. Excellent no nitrates in house deli selections. Great selection of European products, extensive chocolate selection, good organic dairy options, and many other pluses. Again, it's not a grocery store with everything but it wouldn't be a bad place to end up if there was a zombie apocalypse.

Amazing service and delicious Polish food! Gotta give a shout out to our waitress Elżbieta K .. she was amazing! Super attentive and so sweet especially to our kids. We absolutely enjoyed our family dinner. We will definitely be back! 😊

The service was great. Great selection of food. So much to choose from all so good. You get your money's worth. Our waitress was the best she knows this already. Will be back again as usual. Keep up the great work! Had a great time with the family.

We were there 2 hours before closing. The Buffett was still very well stocked with fresh food. The staff were very friendly and didn't rush us. I highly recommend this restaurant for a great tasting all you can eat Polish meal.
Shelly club is a good Polish restaurant. This election is outstanding. The service is good and it's even better if you speak Polish.
The food is great.. The price is affordable. You take your time in eating. The staff are very friendly.

Food is delicious, atmosphere too. Only reason I gave 4 stars was because we had to get up to the bar and get some drinks. On Saturday night they are badly coordinated. Prepare to stand for 1 hour just to wait for a table. They have no reservations either.

Great food, very very lively atmosphere!!! Come when the band is here. It's just two guys but they play authentic Ecuadorian music and as the night goes on they play other Latin stuff. Everyone was so hype and everyone was dancing on the dance floor. I don't speak any Spanish but the staff all knew English and menu was translated too
Absolutely stunning place with real south American atmosphere. Great food.. especially see food with the native south American dishes.. great live music on weekends
Definitely good spot for Ecuadorian food, great service and clean restaurant,I recommend to try the The octopus  it’s amazing, the pork is delicious too. The price are medium .
Exelent food    best Ecuadorian restaurant in chicago

I have been going here for years! This is a great place for BBQ. For me, the half sandwich meal is perfect; my  friends gets the full sandwich meal. The meat is delicious and the sauces wonderful. I’m also a big fan of their slaw! Well worth the trip. It’s all about the food at Smoque... concrete floors, basic seating, and always crowded, so we often do take-out. All the meat is cooked to perfection, and the sauce is really unique, a bit tart and so good. Classic sides are all home made, even the slaw. Can’t go wrong at Smoque, unless they run out of what you want.

Best BBQ in Chicago, hands down. There’s been a wait out the door every time I’ve gone, but the food is well worth it.

The quality of the meat is top notch, and it’s barbecued perfectly. I do not like BBQ sauce, and chains like Famous Dave’s depend on that to cover up the quality of their meat. At Smoque, the meat and its flavors stand for themselves.

We live 3 hrs away and figured we would stop since we were in Chicago and we already cant wait to go back. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and felt welcome. We were told how to order which was appreciated since we had never been before. We arrived as soon as they opened and were out of there by 11:45 so service was fast! Now the food was AMAZING! Hot and FRESH!  Ribs and brisket were soooo tender and juicy. All sides were delicious.

This is the best BBQ place in Chicago! I’m eating there for about 2 years already and I’m not getting bored. Brisket is delicious, full of flavor. Beans are insanely tasty. Fries are perfect. And small jalapeño always adding a little spice to everything. I love you guys!

Smoque is a great place to go if you want real BBQ. What ever you crave they have. The brisket is amazing and the portions leave you wishing they had a nap room in the back.   Pulled pork or chicken more your BBQ style they have it. Meals come with 2 sides and you will not be disappointed with any of them. The slaw comes with everything and is as good as Mama used to make..... Maybe even a little better. I have not even mentioned the sauces which pay homage to several of the places you think of when you think of real BBQ.
Super quick service! Delicious food. Their salmon poke bowl is to die for I cant get enough of it! Very friendly staff!

Ordered green curry tonight for delivery. Girl on the phone was rude and acted like she was doing me a favor for letting me order something below $15 that I always order. My order was a little over $13.50. I had to call back to find out when they'd get here. She told me and then hung up rudely. Delivery guy was really sweet. The portion I got, however, was HALF of what I get at Taste of Thai on Pulaski. I won't be ordering take out from here again.

It's good stuff, little funky and odd but good. Lots of smokey fish stuff, crunchy caviar, and color. You can tell I'm not some sushi aficionado but my wife makes me eat a good amount of it and this one's tasty as far as Albany Park area goes.
Good food, came in for take out and had too wait a bit longer than normal. Other than that he experience and food was extraordinary.

Ordered delivery, and was pleased overall. We got the spicy tuna, spider and crunchy shrimp rolls. They were delicious! We also ordered phad thai and another noodle dish. I wish it had been a bit spicier, but would absolutely order it again. 10/10 recommend this place!
In my experience,  the BEST RIBS EVER! This restaurant has the best service and quality food that I'm sure will keep you coming back again and again! Might also be the best bread pudding!

Great food, incredibly friendly staff! I had the steak & garlic mashed potatoes and both were excellent. Cute little spot; I went on a thursday night and it was not uncomfortably crowded! Great place to just get drinks as well. Plenty of parking!

Been coming here almost 20 years since my kids were little. Not much has changed about the atmosphere. Still noisy in a good way. The staff is very courteous and professional and the food is always great. Try the ribs or the lamb and pasta dish. You'll love them. The Key Lime cheese cake is OMG@otherworldly!

A very popular and well established restaurant. You can’t go wrong with anything on the menu, but the ribs and prime rib are hard to beat. Service is good and we’ve never been disappointed. Best to make reservations. Parking can be a little tricky on weekends

I have been dining here for 35 years.  They still have some of the best baby back ribs in all of Chicago.  The meat falls right off the bone with a sweet and savory barbeque sauce that I could drink on it's own.

My husband and I used to live across the street from this restaurant and went frequently. I also used to go at least once or twice a year growing up for special occasions with my family. I am so sad that it is closing because I have so many wonderful memories here. I am so glad that I got to bring my baby boy here once before it closed! The food and the atmosphere are incredible and will be missed.

Sad to see an institute with great history going away. My father always took my family there for special occasions. So my wife and got reservations, which took 3hrs and a month in advance. Wonderful service, fantastic meal, and drinks with friends at the bar. A belated anniversary with my wife.

Sabatino's Restaurant has been around for at least 50years possibly more  ... I just don't want to give up my actual age  ... 😉
As always it's been a wonderful experience dining there. It's like coming home every time for our family and friends. 
We're so sorry to hear about the closing of this  incredible establishment. Our blessings are with you and your family now and forever. May you live long and enjoy your lives together. 

Sincerest thoughts, 
Dominique Fazio-Egan

Legendary Chicago 5-star Italian dining establishment that fills every seat, every night, and yet is inexplicably closing in December 2018 so the owners can retire and sell the lot for condo development.  A major loss to the city.  Dinners here are great, but they are l-o-n-g, and you can't be in a hurry.    A full course meal, with dessert, will take you a minimum of 2.5 hours, and I had one that took 4 hours on a busy night.

Never had a bad meal here nor have I had bad service either and I'm talking about the last 17 years I've been dining here!  Great food, portions and prices.  Sad to see them close after such a successful 49 years.
Located in the heart of the historical Pullman community. The Pastor and Members are welcoming to everyone.
Beauty church, but needs renovation  badly.

The Greenstone United Methodist Church is literally made of green stones. It is such a unique sight that it stands out among the red brick row houses in the historic Pullman National Monument area. I love the architecture.
Greenstone United Methodist Church has a small BUT growing congregation. Rev. Luther Mason delivers an excellent message each Sunday to this growing congregation. It needs your support!!

Pilgrim Baptist Church of South Chicago is an established historic community church with a vision toward outreach. It is a welcoming, worshiping, praying and praising church with a concern for the congregation and community, and a focus on living the Word. 

Pastor Lasenby is a thoroughly prepared, knowledgeable, practical and wise Bible teacher. He is approachable and has an open heart for people and maintains an open door to the community he serves. The Sunday morning service and worship is both uplifting and spirited, and the Wednesday afternoon interactive Bible Study classes are thorough and filled with relevant practical examples, yet easy to follow and comprehend. 

Most of us know there are no perfect people or perfect churches, yet this fellowship of believers is 'steadily striving' toward perfection in Christ. If you are seeking a church home on the southeast side of Chicago, consider visiting Pilgrim.
Great place to worship Bible teaching church awasome pastor Corwin D Lasanby loving careing members all visitor are welcome Bible study class just come see for yourself we welcome you

This ministry is in need for a lot of prayer. It’s not all but some of the elder members need to learn compassion.Along with not being jealous hearted when someone is talented or succeeding in life goals because that prevents elders from receiving their blessings like the person they are not supportive of. Elders are suppose to lead by example. As Elders you are not suppose to  escalate in other people family issues. Especially when you have your own family issues to be concern with.  The youth and young adults have my greatest sympathy. I wish all the young people and my peers at Pilgrim Baptist  of South Chicago the  absolute best in their future life endeavors.
This has been my family’s church for decades and I am proud to have developed a strong relationship in Chirst through their teachings!!! I love my church, and my children love Pilgrim too!!!

Very family friendly church;  Bible teaching Pastor's have keep me and my family members at this location for over 40 plus years. I am very proud to call this my church home and my church members my family .

Old Fashioned Doughnuts is an institution! It should be designated as a historical landmark! I've been going here since I was a shorty and still pull up at least one Friday out the month to grab 3 dozen for the faculty and staff at Corliss HS... Same young gentleman in the window mixing batches of the good stuff always bring back fond memories for me
Love this place. Been around for years and produce a great product and not afraid 2 use the glaze.  Also black owned. Don't let the outside appearance fool u.
We tried it for the first time yesterday and it was so good!! I've never had a better donut. They were fresh, warm. The establishment is very clean and staff was very friendly and quick.

Ooooo!! Old Fashioned Donuts! The best donut joint in the hood. Neither Dunkin nor Baskin Robbins or anything other donut place can compare to this one. Their donuts are so fluffy and always fresh!!! Right now they have the Texas Donuts which might be as big as Texas and they aren't even 5 dollars. Which you would think they would be... Because of how big they are! I love their munchkins and glazed donuts especially but I have had some of their chocolate donuts... I usually don't eat chocolate donuts, but since it was the only kind in the box and it was from Old Fashioned, y'all know I ate that!!! The service is great... There was one lady in front of me and one cashier. Another staff member came right on time and took my order. So that's good! Damn I gotta stay away from this place fr. 🤤  5/5
Always excellent service and donuts!!! Atmosphere aint all that but I'll always come back even thou I'm in Indiana.

They are sooooo good. The fish and chips are the best. I love Calumet fisheries. I’ve been eating from here since I was a kid. It’s a great place to go and very respectful and knowledgeable about their items. I love them. Please visit. If u live on the south side or south east side area, then u definitely know what I’m talking about.

Great smoked fish and fried seafood. I absolutely love the smoked Sable (black cod) fish. They have a vast amount of fish to choose from at Calumet Fisheries. They have  Cash only, however they do have an ATM on premise. They do have a picnic table by the bridge and first to enjoy your food.

Actually it would be 5 stars but the absence of a “cocktail sauce” or red shrimp sauce is sorely missed. The shrimp and fish are fantastic. The smoked garlic pepper salmon is outstanding. But one star is taken because the lack of cocktail sauce. The red sauce served is a watered down version of Louisiana Hot Sauce. It’s ok in a pinch but not good enough. 
The smoked fish is a 10

This place is an absolute must visit if you're in the Chicago area. A large variety of hot smoked fish along with deep fried options. I'd highly recommend buying the smoked salmon. It's some of the best hot smoked fish I've ever had. It's cash only and always seems to be busy.

Historically delicious! Smoke em if you got em. Smoked shrimp is the best. Just remember it’s cash only. 

TASTE SCORE: 5 of 5
AMBIANCE SCORE: 1 of 5
SERVICE SCORE: 5 of 5

Good experience. I ordered a pan of chicken wings  and half lb of shrimp . The hot sauce is a tad bit tangy probably mustard based with a hint of horseradish. My food was fresh , i asked for my chicken to be fried hard because i like the crunch of their batter. The shrimp were perfect good batter to shrimp ratio ,not overcooked and chewy. We shall return!

Has some of the best carry out chicken and seafood in the Chicago area. For years I've gone there during peak demand times and always had excellent seafood or chicken. This time I went there during off peak, got a 8 piece chicken and one chicken breast was dried out and tough, the other 7 were good. The place looks a little run down and is not in an upscale neighborhood. All in all, it is good for a quick  bite or to call in large orders.

reviews.author_name: Monique Washington- Think Monique Real Estate Group
reviews.text: I saw this place on WGN's Chicago's Best and had to check it out. The shrimp were delicious. The breading did not overwhelm the shrimp. They were tender &  juicy. I really enjoyed the catfish. Great prices.
The food was just as expected...lovely. Customer service was great, down to earth employees. If I'm ever hungry while on this side of Chicago again, I'll definitely stop by again.

Their 🐔➕🍤 are bomb!  The only chicken with great sauce that I'm caring for right now. Not a fan of the Hienie Sauce,  but if you like mustard based sauces then it's for you!  Good service and great food!!!

I will never come back here again and I want everyone to know about it!!!! I ordered 2 three wing specials and while eating it I noticed a funky smell with the chicken, I immediately called back and told them about it. The hostess said she would notify the manager. Fast forward to the next day, I return to the restaurant to talk to manager she knows "nothing" about the prior conversation so I inform her instead of just remaking the food and me going on my way she didn't want to remake it or she didn't want to refund the entire order. I just took what she offered and left, this was a fantastic first experience at The Ranch SteakHouse in Roseland. Great customer service 😖😷😡😤NOT!!!!

Horrible Horrible Service.... Did not have alot of the basic things you need to compliment a breakfast. And the waiter basically told me if i need milk, I should bring it from home.... Not recommended....
Food was good, waitress was nice and the music was on point!! Love the fact that it's a black owned business now.
Friendly, very very pleasant wait staff. Food was very good😊I will be going back.
Excellent service great food and prices! Black Owned and Operated.. 💪🏿✊🏿💯💗🖤💚
Nice little piece of Chicago History . The south side Castle. The Unitarian church is a great neighbor and important part of the community
Great staple in the neighborhood with tons of activities
Warm, welcoming congregation. All people are wanted and appreciated there.
Welcoming--good community center. Annual Christmas tree sales.

I attended here for undergraduate, the campus is beautiful. My professors were attentive. It's a very liberal and diverse university. The only problem I had was with administration, there was always too much going back and forth to get things done.

This University is offering courses for semi-retired & retired people. Courses are facilitated by men & women who are "members" of this Renaissance  Academy at Chicago NFP. Courses are not for credit.
One of the best university ever in IL

Don't go here if you're not a football player or majoring in nursing! This school is garbage! I majored in music education and piano performance. The professors didn't give a damn about their students. The campus was garbage too! Goose poop everywhere you walk! Dirty lake water! Dorm water was different colors as if it was sponsored by Skittles (I kid you not!) My dorm room was literally a janitors closet! You're better off going elsewhere for school than SXU. Again, unless you want to be a nurse or doctor.

I currently attend SXU and it has been nothing but a headache. The professors and my classes are not what is wrong here, they are exceptional. Unfortunately, my issues come from the everywhere else. I have had several incidents with the financial aid office because they have either forgotten to give me vital information or have forgotten to post my awards, which should be the simplest thing to do. The department of education has consistently given me wrong information regarding my ACT scores. At first, I wasn't going to be charged a fee and all I had to do was send them to the school. I ended up paying $70 to send my scores to SXU because that is what the incompetent staff TOLD me I had to do. Now I have pay another $70 to send them somewhere else. It is completely unprofessional and I hope they correct these problems in the future. Thank you for constantly making my life more difficult SXU, great job so far.
Cinnamon doughnuts were fire! Definitely go here if you can
The food is always guaranteed to be great and the service is friendly and cheerful. Keeps me going back again and again!
Good breakfast. Good service.
Great breakfast place, love the fresh baked goods. I'm not a real coffee drinker but the roast their own coffee in shop!! My go to breakfast place!!
Great service, staff, coffee, and food.

I am a self-proclaimed burger connoisseur and I make it a point to try a new burger place every time I go to a different city. My personal favorite places to go are "Mom & Pop" restaurants, they have a nice home feel, greasy food, and special sauce or food. Wonderburger checks all 3 off of that list for me! I ordered a double Wonderburger and I couldn't have been more pleased. The wonder sauce is a ketchup and relish mixture that I was unsure of at first, but glad I went with my gut decision to try it. The patty was juicy and flavorful. The waitress was nice, not overly outgoing, but a decent server. Even though we were the only people in the restaurant at first the service was still a little slow. After my meal I struck up some conversation with local Wonderburger goers and it really seemed like a nice place to get lunch! I recommend this to anyone looking for a nice burger in a nice restaurant.
Love this place they have a variety of salads very tasty and a huge menu of everything that you can imagine, the establishment is clean and the staff is awesome.
Fast even if you call. Always fresh off the grill
This place is a gem ice cream is so good burgers salads and Philly sandwiches are made exactly how you asked

The food was horrible! I had a patty melt. The meat wasn't a real hamburger beef. It was one of those frozen soy beef patties. It was tasteless like they took it out the freezer cooked it and that's it. The French fries were hard and tasteless. They tasted like they cooked them in old grease. I have never had food that bad before. We heard that the food was good. One of the best hamburger places around. But that was not true. My husband had a gyro's burger. He said it was good. I guess it was if you have all that stuff on it. Where you can't really taste the so called hamburger beef. I told him to just taste the hamburger beef and not with the gyro's, tomatoes, onions, pickles, mustard, ketchup, and mayo. That's what was on his burger. So he just tried the burger, and said it was not good. It was tasteless. I guess when people come there to eat, they don't just get a burger, they get it with a lot of stuff on it. That way they don't really taste the so called burger. I will NEVER it there again!! I got sick right after eating the food. I went home and threw up! I will tell my family and friends never to eat there! They will be very disappointed if they do. I rate this place a F-!
My fav is the salmon burger with sweet potatoes fries! The guys are very nice.

Took family here and everyone loved it.. delicious and good prices. Also they are super friendly. I heard about this restaurant on television and decided to go and try it and must say was not disappointed. Everyone we recommend this place to also loves it.
Great turkey burger and the breakfast is amazing too. It hard to find a place for people who don’t it pork or beef. This has turkey burgers, links, bacon and sausage. I love this place.

The best Milkshake I have ever had!! My family and I are visiting from out of town and this was a great place for lunch. I had a corned beef melt and chocolate shake. AMAZING milkshake. My dad got the strawberry and that was also amazing. Super thick and very good flavors.

Haven't had Top Notch in YEARS!! Decided to check em today and it was delicious 😋 My only complaint is the fries, a little too hard for my liking other than that it was great! Will definitely go back! Must try the Oreo cookie shake

This is my childhood in a nutshell! French fries wrapped in pickles dipped in mayonnaise and ketchup... need I say more? Oh wait the best grilled cheese sandwich EVER! No other Top Notch can compare. They are the originals, trick or treating for french fries... seriously can it get much better? I think not! If you say your from South Side Chicago and haven't been here your a liar... bar none!

One of my favorite Italian places! They always have a good selection. Everything always tastes superb! You can’t go wrong! I am definitely impressed with how tender they get the seafood! Not everyone dresses fancy so if you want to be a little casual then that’s cool. Definitely worth a try if you are on the south side and craving a good quality pasta or some great Italian food in general.

The parking lot is kind of tight so maybe get there a little early to get a good spot.
Excellent dinner. Impeccable service. Classic decor. One of the best Southside restaurants

Very neighborly feel, we chatted for a long time (off peak) with no pressure.  Entrees were nicely varied, while covering the traditional bases.  Nice list of daily specials.  We had a salmon and a pasta dish, both generous portions and well-seasoned.  Give them a try!

Such a great spot to go for a dinner for two or a party of 40! The space, atmosphere and service makes it a great place to dine but even better is the food itself!  From the gluten free penne to the chicken Franconello we enjoyed everything we ordered.  I will say the prices seemed a bit higher than expected but the portions are generous.  A great hit for a party as well!

Attended a party and enjoyed the atmosphere and ther family style dilbert food was very good. Staff worked very hard to please. Lot of old world charm in the woodworking. I would definitely go again just to have dinner.

I had the opportunity of being on top the Sears tower once in my lifetime years back. It's very quiet up there because you're very high in the sky. I was expecting something like New York City and the top of a high skyscraper there. However that was not the case. There are not many tall buildings in Chicago like there is New York. The observation deck is windy and the sites are endless. If you're in downtown Chicago it's certainly worth the elevator ride for sure.  My adventure was at night so I recommend doing it during the day as well. It's a great place to bring the family.

I would recommend you do not go between 3 and sunset! Great place to take a cool picture and the walls are painted with funny sayings. But your waiting in line to ride up a fast elevator and look out a window. I wish it included the history of when it was the Sears tower since Sears played such a large part in the American economy for such a long time. RIP Sears and all other outlet stores.

The line was incredibly worth it! Seeing that view alone was mesmerizing, but being able to see it from a glass box hanging on the side of a building was exhilarating! Amazing photo opportunity also to keep as a memory so don't forget to keep your phone handy. Definitely recommend while staying in Chicago.

Really cool experience. I went on a Monday in March so queues weren't bad at all. Some pretty cool views although you can't see Navy Pier. The sky deck is freaky but great experience. Well worth the visit.

The line was incredibly worth it! Seeing that view alone was mesmerizing, but being able to see it from a glass box hanging on the side of a building was exhilarating! Amazing photo opportunity also to keep as a memory so don't forget to keep your phone handy. Definitely recommend while staying in Chicago.

Amazing place! Best coffee shop in the city! I don’t mind driving up here all year round! Very welcoming and cozy! Staff is always welcoming and friendly! Food is outstanding all the time! I recommend a lot of my close friends to stop by!
Great coffee drinks, served with care. And really good pastries. There are no outlets though, so not the best place to go get work done.

I can tell the food here is made with thought and love. Their coffee is smooth and tasty; had their mocha which was balanced as in not overpoweringly chocolate-y. Their hot breakfast sandwiches were amazing. Fresh baked bread and it certainly tasted like it. The ingredients down to the lettuce and mayo was very fresh. I will be bookmarking this place. I look forward to coming again and trying their other stuff.

Rude. The woman working the counter was talking with a uniformed officer as I walked in. She didn't greet me or even acknowledge me. I didn't even try the coffee or food. I was so turned off by the woman behind the counter, I left. The counter with the cookies and muffins appears to be self serve. However as I grabbed a piece of wax paper, the woman from behind the counter (finally noticing me) yells, "that's not self serve!" I was embarrassed? Offended? I'm not quite sure. But whatever emotion, I didn't want to be there anymore.
Best sandwiches hands down. There are many puertorican restaurants/cafes on Division st. But I always find myself back here! The passion fruit water is a must try, very authentic to the island.

The standards in the industry some times are very subjective. 
I could give 3 1/2 stars. Not because it's bad. It's because there is a lot of room to improve.
Food is not bad.

We had a nice friendly waitress.
Found out they have karaoke on Friday and Saturday. Plates are huge!

The entire time there were children screaming and running. Although it was the customer who allowed them to do so. Management could/should have been able to request that the kids remain with there parents. The ceviche tasted a but dry as if old or sitting out. The best part of my camarones a la diabla  was the garlic bread and garnish salad. The fries were unexpected with the plate but not bad. Good luck.
Good food,good service and good prices
I love this place. Great food for everyone!

I love this place... Quote it's not not your everyday taco joint. I been a customer before I came out the womb. They were the only thing my mom could hold down while pregnant. 34 years later they are still#1. Today I made a huge order her my mom and they didn't disappoint. I can only say it's a hood place with cheap food. If you're nit from here get ready for a new experience. Shout out to Miss Barbara and John the cashier.

Today was a PEOPLES TACO day for me. I took the bus there and home again. I have been craving them for a while. It was not crowded, right at the beginning of lunchtime. Couldn't wait to get home. Steak deluxe hot. Really really good. I'm satisfied (big smile).

I move to Chicago in 1993 and a friend of mine brought me these tacos I didn't want them because they were too greasy and the bag was wet but it was 2 in the morning and I was hungry we was up all night I have loved them ever since but I moved to the western suburbs and I often go back to Chicago to get them every once in a while I may only get two but while the management has changed is still some consistency with the tacos it's not Mexican the way that this app explains what type of restaurant is but the meat is very different I always get beef I've never gotten chicken or steak so I don't know what that tastes like but it's an acquired taste and hey if you like it you like it
The Tacos taste  plain. Tacos don't taste like they use to. Don't waste your money on this garbage. 🤔👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼
It has been around for years. Good for after you party.

Authentic, open late, free chips and hot salsa and the food is delicious. Super affordable cafeteria table style place with great wait service staff. It comes out fast so be sure to hurry up and wash your hands in a jiffy. SO CHEAP AND AMAZING. 

   The sinks are outside the bathroom for your convenience so the bathrooms aren’t clogged up with people washing their hands before dinner. I wish more places did this. 

    Al pastor tacos (probably misspelled) and steak are unreal in my opinion! The burrito was great, too! You’re missing out if you miss this spot while you’re in Chi town Pilsen area!

Great for late night tacos and burritos. The service is always on point, just be polite, raise your hand, and they'll be right there. The crowd there is sometimes a little sketch but there's a security guy there now. So it should be alright for the most part. A burrito here is about 6.50, but with a dinner combo it's 8.50. Tacos are about 2 dollars. A large 32oz horchata is 3.50. Everything here is really good and there is also free appetizers on the table (cauliflower, carrots, and jalapenos in vinegar) along with chips and salsa that they will gladly refill.

Small chain of Mexican restaurants in Chicago.  Food tasty, service quick and the staff friendly.  My go-to place for steak torta or tacos. Open late.  Dine-in or take out.  Free parking available in a lot off the back of 17th Street.

Use to be a ☆☆☆☆☆ but now I'm not so sure. Girl on the register has an attitude that is unbearable. Sweety stay home if you hate your job. If I say thank you have a great day and you wanna rule your eyes at me, oh no . I can slap a smile on you if you like. Servers some are nice some are in a bad mood. Sorry i can't cook at home and wanna come and leave you my money. My respect for the cooks though.
Very excellent authentic Mexican food. Best waitstaff,  hands down.  Great location.  Would revisit and recommend over and over.

It's a good banquet hall for small 20 people birthday parties to big wedding parties. You can bring your own pastries and your cellphone DJ music. There is also a convenient free public parking garage nearby.
Delicious food very reasonably prices

It's a good banquet hall for up to 180 people birthday parties to big wedding parties.The place was very nice, the food was delicious they are well- organized and regretful There is also a convenient free public parking garage nearby.Very recommended for others ,Thank You Grace and Daga to help me organized  me party.A+
Great for private banquets,manager is very helpful,will accommodate to any situation,friendly staff.
It's ok if you are on a budget, the place Is dated but clean, the food was ok but the staff were efficient and courteous

Visited for their Valentine's Day deal after spending the evening at the Garfield Conservatory. It was a three-course dinner. Relatively small menu, but great meal! Also very affordable and great ambience. Will love an opportunity to be back. Great experience

Great food supporting a great cause. The menu is somewhat limited but my family of four all found something delicious on a Sunday brunch visit. Cinnamon rolls were warm and yummy, my breakfast bowl was good and filling, and my husband gave a thumbs up to the Impossible Burger
Love this place.  Decor is really cool and chill.  Food was cooked perfectly and delicious.  Staff is very friendly.  I'll definitely be recommending this place.

Visited 3/30/19. They pay a living wage to folks overcoming homelessness and poverty, providing training and jobs. Great service, fantastic comfort food (biscuits and gravy were on point!), and an incredible mission. Couple this with a visit to the Garfield Park Conservatory and you’ve got yourself an amazing day on the West Side.

This place is a hidden gem. We attended an event here for a family member and the staff was great with helping us set up our decorations. The food was really good, and the space was open and well lit.

Never a disappointing experience. Quality, service and operations are continuously excellent. Not only is the 🍕 😋 but a 🐒🐵 could serve it and it would still be on time, accurate and delicious. For those of you who enjoy dressing w your 🍕 (to enhance the flavors), they have a unique club dressing or what I call sawce! which is undoubtedly the best complement to a slice, any day. Order the Chicago classic + pepperoni+ mushroom and you will not be disappointed (assuming you eat meat and veg)
