Lou Malnati’s is the best Chicago deep-dish slice you can get (IMHO). A true Chicago classic.  I prefer their buttery and flaky crust to some of the other offerings in the Windy City.  This is a great location with a very clean and inviting atmosphere.

Heston was by far the BEST server we’ve ever been blessed with.  Great personality, first class service and the incredible food made our first trip to Chicago super duper.  Thanks for feeding us and giving us a the best experience!

Delicious and one-of-a-kind! This place defines Chicago-Style pizza and goes down as one of the most mouth-savoring places in all of Chicago. The salad that we also ordered was so tasty and had such a portillo-feel to it as well. To top it off, the customer service was excellent and friendly! If you are visiting Chicago or live here, you have got to check it out!
It's in my top 3 for pizza from a chain. They have a few good beers too which is nice. The place is very clean and the staff is friendly.

I was there on a wedding day and this gentleman actually stole my jacket. So I was able to get in touch with the GM Katy S. Without any trouble at all she was on it looked at the video and had my very wonderful jacket back in less then a day. Thanks also great spot for any situation really the place is big enough to have a company party and still have enough room for the public to be able to come in and play pool shuffle board

OK so I hate to say it but it's your run of the mill after work happy hour. I've been there twice both times it was either crowded or not very many people there. On the night we went where the crowd was bustling they only had 3 bartenders total for 2 different bars. Very difficult to get drinks. But cool if you're just gonna pop in for a few min. Oh & outdated decor.

I visited strictly to watch a game during happy hour. I was quite impressed. Very good and attentive customer service, and outstanding prices on some draft beers, considering the area. $3 for selected drafts is a downright steal in this part of Arlington.
Service, food, pool tables. Bring your own cue. Good specials. A little crowded for real shooters after 5.
Cool spot to hang out and play some games with friends. Good food, cheap drinks, and lots of games. They have pool, ping pong, arcade games, board games, darts.  Lots of fun here!
Beautiful structure. I’ve visited this lovely place. It has the 1800’s feel to it. They don’t make this like this anymore. It’s very stunning.

So many small details and embellishments to find both inside and outside. I loved that the house not only has a small elevator in it, but the elevator was decorated and tied into the motif of the front of the house. I could be wrong, not an expert, but I know I like everything about this house.
Very nice people here.
Beautiful Frank Lloyd Wright design. Private residence.
Attended a Humanities Festival Lecture.  Beautiful building.  Not a lot of parking available.
If your looking for a dance class for your child. Kenwood Ballet is a great start.
Great place and warm and welcoming just getting in due to Presidential guards can be a pain
Great place to worship !
great place for CTU commencement

Loved this masjid, just so new folks know that restrooms are outside (right by the parking lot).
It is a regular place of worship for musilms.

Some of the reviews here say that kids under 7 years of age are not allowed in this masjid. I believe those are old reviews and that kids are allowed in the masjid and it’s a beautiful masjid. Jazak Allah.

The bathroom and no child policy can be inconvient for women that want to attend.

I dont have a problem with that, its how they 'screen'  you before you go in. 

They make there poli ies very clear and even for non diaper babies they dont make you feel welcome with little children and i get it however. Its the masjid and they sre forgetting moms need to connect to.
Very welcoming and friendly! Mashallah
Nice and quite atmosphere clean  masjid
Attended a Humanities Festival Lecture.  Beautiful building.  Not a lot of parking available.
If your looking for a dance class for your child. Kenwood Ballet is a great start.
Great place and warm and welcoming just getting in due to Presidential guards can be a pain
Great place to worship !
great place for CTU commencement
Free Large Art space with great artists and beautiful art work. My husband and I enjoyed our time here.

This is a great little museum on the University of Chicago campus, and the best part: IT'S FREE!!! 

And seriously, for being a free museum, it has a great collection. They have work by Joseph Albers, Mark Rothko, Frank Lloyd Wright, and Louis Sullivan (just to name a few). 

They also have great temporary exhibitions that are always well curated, and they always have interesting things in their lobby. They have artists paint a huge wall in their lobby or create a site-specific installation, and they never fail to impress.
Interesting, historical exhibition. However, they should do better job posting updates about what's open. We came in and were told that all exhibitions are closed but one.

This was a fun adventure on a rainy Saturday afternoon. Informative and interesting. My only complaint is that one of the workers at the museum was a bit rude and must work on her customer service. I didn't get her name as I didn't want to ruin our visit by giving her too much attention. We felt singled out and that was not cool. I understand she was doing her job, but she could use some lessons on approach and how to use her words in a non confrontational way. Other than that we had a wonderful time!
One of the hidden gems of Hyde Park! Wonderful, thought provoking exhibitions...and did I mention that it's free!
Great sculpture that really fits the atmosphere on campus
One of the masterpieces of modern sculpture.
Historically significant, though Stagg Field has moved slightly northwest since.
Great statue and easily accessible.
Someone has added to the sculpture, to great effect
Small, free to everyone, it's on the fourth floor. You need to leave your bags and coats outside.
Odd and extravagant art, great wine, Win Win
Amazing space for contemporary art. Small but a must see! Check to make sure there's an exhibition on.
Wonderful space with intriguing exhibits xxx

One of my favorite places to visit because the gallery routinely shows artists commercial galleries may not be able to

It's especially bettee when there's enough time to walk the magnificent campus

I've attached some photos of sculptor Richard Rezac's show that show the space

Love this place. They serve great coffee, and you can browse some really great art installations. In addition they have great children's programs to help children get involved in the arts. Getting your hands messy is one thing, but creating subjective works of art that the world can enjoy (and isn't drywall inside your parent's house) is a fabulous experience.
I've been taking classes here for years and I know many of the students do! They always have some free exhibit going on. Great place to hang out, mingle, and learn.

Nice place. Friendly people. Cool at. Brightly lit. Clean. Only problem I had, as a far West suburbanite was, parking in the city stinks. Give yourself some extra time, to find a spot. Or, take public transport.
Great Ceramic Studio with 2 large gas kilns and 2 electric kilns, plenty of potter's wheels and glazes.
This space is always interesting, changing exhibitions on a regular basis, and their classes for seniors are engaging and free!

Garden of the Phoenix is a small Japanese garden established for the 1893(!) Colombian Exposition held in Chicago.  This park epitomizes all that is Japanese:  Small yet ornate, isolated and serene.  The garden resides on an island which is accessible with two bridges, one on the north and one on the south.  No pets allowed,  so leave Fido at home.  If you want to enjoy this gem, parking is available south of the island off of E. Hayes Dr. (cost is about $2 per hour).   Also, it is about a 15 minute walk from this garden to the Museum of Science and Industry.

My wife and I was travelling from Milwaukee to Indianapolis.  We made a special trip to find this garden.  This is not going to be an attraction to a lot of people.  This garden is much like a Bonsai tree:  small but incredibility beautiful.  If you appreciate a Bonsai, you will love this park.

This is THE BEST location in Chicago for all nature lovers. This park is a bit far from downtown (around 13km) but is very well worth it.
I was biking through lakeview trail with a Divvy bike and passed by this park. Only inconvenience is that you cannot take the bike in the park and there are no Divvy stations outside of it. However, there is a bike station for normal bikes to park but you need to have a lock.
The location is very calm and relaxing. The park’s blend with the lake is superb. It’s design is far better than all parks in Chicago. It is a Japanese park. Once you step in all your worries are gone. I highly recommend this park. However one note: there are no sitting areas which makes it a bit annoying.
Amazing tranquility in the hustle and bustle of the city.

A place of stillnes and peace in the din of modern society. I've lived in Chicagoland for over 30 years, and have become quite familiar with its local wildlife. Upon my first (and hopefully not only) trip to the garden, I saw three new birds. One looked like a sandpiper, but not quite, and had a one LONG feather adove its head with a small yellow doodle at the tip. Fabulous.

A true South Side gem. This serene spot, offering lovely views of the former Fine Arts Building from across the lagoon and landscaped in traditional Japanese style, is a calm oasis for reflection, a casual stroll, or a lunch-hour meditation.

This museum was a real treat. They had many interesting exhibits. It was fun to see some things that were in the museum when I was a kid next to the new stuff. I really appreciate how they are always working to bring something new into the museum. 

You can easily spend an entire day here. I highly recommend this place for people with kids. It isn't as interactive as a children's museum, but it isn't as hands-off as many other museums we've been to. They have a good mix to keep kids engaged. We will definitely visit again.

I went here as a kid and remember it being awesome. This time we didn't even but tickets, they are crazy expensive and they want 20 bucks to park in the garage on top. The basic museum cost is pricey and if you want to do anything extra there it cost more, like the submarine, it cost extra. The only way it's cost effective is if you are a member and go more than once, but that doesn't work when you are just visiting for the day.

Way too much to put in a review. We could have easily spent 3 days here, and saw only part of everything in our 6 or so hours available. There are plenty of interesting, interactive exhibits. The prices are high but certainly worth it. Traveling/rotating exhibitions are certainly worth seeing. Definitely accessible to children but still in depth enough for adults.

A Chicago institution. Good for kids and grown-ups alike. Although the total for 2 adults and 2 kids Rose to $167 with the u-505 and coal mine tours, a good time was had by all. The u-505 tour is great (Allison was an enthusiastic and engaging tour guide) the coal mine tour could be good, although our tour guide needed a  serious personality adjustment. You could tell that she's given this tour a thousand times and didn't care less about doing it again.

Amazing place, must visit museum in Chicago. Has limited parking space. Exhibits include historic modes of transportation and all sort of scientific inventions. A giant area of models of trains is awesome. Area with live exhibits of tornado is worth seeing also.

Do go early in the morning it is an great and amazingly large museum.

One of few restaurants which provides French fries fried in peanut oil which gives unique taste. Their shake as well is yummy. Don't forget to grab some complimentary peanuts as well. They are fresh and fried salted nuts with shells. They have vegetarian options as well.

Cool joint like how the wrap the burgers in the foil so when you open cheese is melted. Fries are really good but get the cajun ones. A little expensive because everything is charged separately but worth trying and seeing if you like it yourself.
Food is always hot and fresh. Love the fries and hot dogs. I like all the burger options and the food is not too salty. Good stuff!
They were very nice and the food was good. This is one of the cleanest fast food spots in Austin even the bathroom is clean.
Good food and nice staff. Price of food is kind of high. Minimal decor and kind of looks  like a semi done.

This place was absolutely AMAZING. We happened upon it looking for some pizza after leaving the museum science and industry. It is like 6 or 7 blocks from museum and it is well worth the walk or drive. The pizza is some of the best I've ever had and I grew up in the city. Small place and service was spectacular. I would give 100 stars if I could.

I stop by the bakery most mornings. The coffee is excellent and the muffins are wonderful. The great service really makes my morning.
The actual restaurant is a Hyde Park staple. It's a great place to go with visiting friends or family as it really captures the spirit of the neighborhood. I highly recommend the pizza

Their dine-in food is good, but their bakery is AMAZING. Still remains some of the best cinnamon rolls and almond croissants I've had in my life. Their pumpkin milkshake in the fall is also amazing. Sandwiches are tasty. Really can't go wrong with any of the bakery goods. Extremely limited seating though, which is a bummer.
Great specialty drinks! The mocha is amazing and the ice mocha (with ice cream) was very good. The cafe is small with very limited seating, but is a great place to grab a drink to go.
Always a fine time here. The food is very tasty. I had Turkey chili.  It came quickly and was delicious.  Staff is friendly and efficient.

I've been here before. I really enjoy the food here. We went for my niece's birthday. The server was nice. They came over and sang happy birthday. The food came out hot and delicious. Great customer service.

Went for brunch on a Sunday and service was great and fast.  We were seated right away and food came out quick. I got the caramel French toast, which was AMAZING and the turkey bacon with eggs. Definitely a place worth checking out

The best breakfast in Chicago!
We had Build you own scramble, blueberry pancakes, hashbrowns with added onions, thick slices of real bacon, & endless cups of coffee. Everything was delicious,  fast & hot!
The service was excellent in a neighborhood restaurant where the atmosphere was friendly & busy.

So i was there yesterday first time ever going, i had the worst experience ever i waited all day for my food and when my food came i saw hair on it.I was already upset due to my long wait then for me to see hair on my food really upset me more, then when i notify the manager on duty Carl about my food he was super rude wasn’t apologetic about my experience. I just want you all to learn how to train your employees everyone  needs to wear hairnets  and reconsider who you all put in a position of management.I would never eat here again for the record and i will notify all my friends and family  to never come back again.

My parents would bring me here when I was a little girl and this is still my favorite breakfast spot hands down. Their food has stayed the same. It may take some time to get your food because the place is always packed but it's well worth the wait. The pancakes are the absolute best. The omelets are always great and you never feel skimped. And I even notice some of the people who worked there when I was a kid still work there today. I love this place, it's like going to visit family.

Ribs and Bibs gets a 5 stars for food. Hands down the best ribs I've ever had in Chicago. I would not recommend this place if you're looking for a sitdown restaurant with full service. This is a grab-and-go. Grab some delicious food and go on to the Point for a picnic.

I will miss this place. Ribs n bibs was high park I remember me and my friends used to sneak from recess to eat here. I remember when it burn down and rebuilt. At the time if you said high park people always said have you eat at ribs n bibs..

Best ribs I've ever had! I like them dry- without bbq sauce and they are the tastiest!!
I've been eating ribs from here since 1992 and the quality has not changed. There's a reason they've been in business for so long! Loyal customers and great tasting food.

There is nothing to this food.  You get a burger on a bun. You get chicken and bbq sauce. But they smoke up the place (and the food) in a way that is hard to match in Chicago. Not for the feint of heart.
An Hyde Park Classic. It is probably one of UChicago students' favorite local restaurant. The food takes a while to cook but it is worth the wait.
Not a bad dish on the menu.  The golden bags, the potstickers, the pad thai.  I could go on.  Always hits the spot.
Very good place to go.  Great service and delicious meals.
Excellent service and the food was quite good.
the people who work here are all extremely friendly. they could have served me soggy white bread and I would come back to see these guys
The wait staff was nice and helpful and the food way yummy! We loved the pork pot stickers, pad thai, and garlic chicken!
Not a bad dish on the menu.  The golden bags, the potstickers, the pad thai.  I could go on.  Always hits the spot.
Very good place to go.  Great service and delicious meals.
Excellent service and the food was quite good.
the people who work here are all extremely friendly. they could have served me soggy white bread and I would come back to see these guys
The wait staff was nice and helpful and the food way yummy! We loved the pork pot stickers, pad thai, and garlic chicken!

Quick, easy and cheap. Always reliable on the food you will get. Is it the best ever? Nah, but it will do. I go for breakfast and usual get a #2. Eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast. It taste just like it sounds. Simple. If I go for lunch I get the grilled cheese and kool-aid. Could I make this at home? Yes but I'm not home, I'm at Valois where I will pay about $5-$10 for something I can make but enjoy someone else doing it for me. I'm a millennial.

Chill atmosphere and delicious food! The food is all right there and you don't got to worry if someone may or may not do something bad to your food. Relatively affordable! I have been going here for years and I will continue to come back!

Great for breakfast, lunch or dinner. They have food prepared for your convenience. If you want to order while inside you can as well. They prepare your food quick and it’s always tasty. Long time Hyde Park go to for our former President “Barack Obama”. I always get the breakfast and it’s delicious.
My favorite place to go when I want a home cooked meal but I'm on the go. They have a great variety of meals at dinner time and they serve breakfast all day. The food is always good!

This is a Buffet style restaurant. Food  is reasonably priced and the service is good. Be advised, they don't accept credit or debt cards of any type!! There is a cash machine in the restaurant that you can use to get cash for your meals. Also be advise though, to use the cash station, there is a rather hefty "surcharge" from the company who owns the mechine. My advise, is to get  cash from another source and have it ready before you enter the restaurant!!
The pizza was amazing!! The mediteranian lamb was SO good. Service was friendly and helpful.
Absolutely rate this place, pizza and pasta is absolutely delicious. Just be sure to phone ahead it gets really busy. That’s a great sign. Staff very friendly as well.

I stayed in Samoa for 12 days and visited this place three times.
The service is great and the pizza is delicious - best pizza in Samoa by far!
If you visiting Samoa this place is a must!

Decent pizza. Be forewarned though, you should call ahead and order food in advance on Friday and Saturday nights as they get super busy. Wait times are 1 hour or more on those evenings. Nice garden setting, outdoor yet covered seating area. Pizza's and pasta are good.

So delicious. Fresh ingredients, herbs and salad. Something for everyone on the menu. We had a late lunch here and had to return for dinner the next night as it was so good. Reasonably priced and lovely staff giving great service. Lighting and music were great too.

This place was absolutely AMAZING. We happened upon it looking for some pizza after leaving the museum science and industry. It is like 6 or 7 blocks from museum and it is well worth the walk or drive. The pizza is some of the best I've ever had and I grew up in the city. Small place and service was spectacular. I would give 100 stars if I could.

I stop by the bakery most mornings. The coffee is excellent and the muffins are wonderful. The great service really makes my morning.
The actual restaurant is a Hyde Park staple. It's a great place to go with visiting friends or family as it really captures the spirit of the neighborhood. I highly recommend the pizza

Their dine-in food is good, but their bakery is AMAZING. Still remains some of the best cinnamon rolls and almond croissants I've had in my life. Their pumpkin milkshake in the fall is also amazing. Sandwiches are tasty. Really can't go wrong with any of the bakery goods. Extremely limited seating though, which is a bummer.
Great specialty drinks! The mocha is amazing and the ice mocha (with ice cream) was very good. The cafe is small with very limited seating, but is a great place to grab a drink to go.
Always a fine time here. The food is very tasty. I had Turkey chili.  It came quickly and was delicious.  Staff is friendly and efficient.

I love this place. The atmosphere is so quaint, the server and owner (?) Are friendly and service is always quick. I especially like the omelettes. They are packed with flavor and they don't skimp on the ingredients. This place is a throw back to old school Americana with the wooden booths, red plastic cups, and no fills food. Just good, quality, and made with love..
Food was delicious. We had the pancakes for lunch. They were light not too heavy. Had eggs, sunny side. My sister had the egg whites. Service was great. Nice little restaurant.

The staff is kind, and quickly accommodating for seating. The chefs make sure to have your hot meal to you asap (and it is a FAST asap). The coffee and water flow endlessly and attentively, thanks to great server staff. 
I can 🐺  down meals here, or pick at them depending on my appetite. But however I am feeling, these meals have always coincided with Selonica's comfortable, familial atmosphere that seems to make conversation with the people at my table flow more naturally.
Thanks Selonica!

The food hits at an average 3/4 out of 5. The pecan pie is a whole 5 star event, though. 

It's the type of restaurant that holds neighborhood history.  At any given time you can find college students, politicians, or local business owners meeting and enjoying the atmosphere. There is a counter in the back and wooden booth seating along the wall. The back is usually open and is a lot less cramped. As most people choose to seat themselves in the front of the restaurant.
The six of us felt crowded into one booth. The food was fair. It's mostly just a sandwich place. I did think the portions were generous but the cost wasn't a bargain.
Wing app was good but chix was dry again. Short rib was tender and flavorful but won't be coming back.

Staff were nice and friendly, but the food was terrible. I had chicken that was plain en had no taste, the fries were soft and had a really bad aftertaste I do not recommend this restaurant because the food is very bad. Others at my table had bad food as wel no taste at all, even the bread was bad.

Decent place for mediterranean. The appetizers were good. I enjoyed my mixed greens salad. But the chicken tikka was very dry. Veggies and rice that came with it were alright. Service was attentive and nice. Not a bad place by any means, but could be better.
Great food. Tasty. Nice ambiance. Polite service. Fairly priced
I highly recommend the shekriya it was good as hell only thing is I should have told them to stream my veggies to they was tender

Purchased their all you can eat lunch buffet and it was delicious!

Their rolls they offer for all you can eat we’re unique and they offered a variety. My favorite was the spicy shrimp roll and their Chicago roll. I went with a group of 5, so all of our rolls came out on one plate - it made it confusing for us to determine whose sushi was whose. Their Thai smoothies were also good! So was their miso soup!!

For 14.99 each for the all you can eat lunch special from 11-3, we got our moneys worth and I would recommend this place and hope to go back soon.

You probably shouldn't expect world class sushi here and sometimes service is a little slow, but the value can't be ignored. The all you can eat deal is fantastic, and includes nagiri. You have to pay for what you don't eat, but you can order in as many rounds as you'd like so it is not a problem. They're usually very packed, so reservations are a good idea. Coming in larger groups is advised, as if everybody buys in on the all you can eat you have to worry even less about finishing everything because odds are everybody will be able to eat a little more.

Pretty good all you can eat menu with tasty sushi. Parking sucks because Hyde park and city of Chicago but that’s beside the point. The place is BYOB which I feel is important to mention. Staff is friendly enough and the facilities are clean. Be aware though that if you go with the all you can eat option and you leave  any sushi on the plate when you settle your bill you WILL be charged a la carte prices for that sushi.

I love this little Sushi Spot in Hyde Park. I used to live in Bronzeville and I will come over here just to get sushi. It is bring your own bottle and the staff is always so nice. $20 for all you can eat sushi on the weekends, you cannot beat this for girls night. They serve you ice cream at the end and you can even make reservations if you have a large party.
Best all-you-can-eat sushi + appetizers and free homemade ice cream for dessert! Vegan options! BYOB! Reasonably priced!

The staff was nice but they were out of everything I wanted. They should change their board if they don’t have stuff. I didn’t end up getting anything because every time I asked for something they said they were out or didn’t have it. I gave up after the third thing.

Excitedly stopped by for ice cream after Korean BBQ.  Unfortunately the girl working was very unfriendly. No smile and seemed annoyed at everything we asked. We didn't feel wanted so we left and went down to Maple Butter and had a great experience.

I love Bobtail! Fantastic ice cream, friendly staff and generous portions make for a great visit every time! 

I'm crazy about their strawberry milkshakes! Got me through the last month of my pregnancy 😊

Ice cream, can you ever screw it up? I'm not sure, but Bobtail owns it! Minus the long line (can you blame them?), this place is fantastic. Good ice cream with great service that's friendly. I couldn't decide what to get (so many good options), so I just told the guy to get me what he would eat. Came out with a caramel pecan scoop on a cone, and was happy. Great stop for some good treats.

Atmosphere: 9/10
Service: 10/10
Food: 9/10

Bobtail is a neighborhood gem! They have everything you would expect from a traditional ice cream shop along with several unique flavors (Jack Daniels and chocolate, for one) which is what really sets them apart. For me, it doesn't feel like summer until I've made a trip to Bobtail!
RIP, Melrose Diner. You will be missed o7
Classic Dinner food, but at a higher quality. Reasonably priced. Nice decor! I go here any time I need a good branch spot!

Sadly, it's just a shadow of its former self. No longer 24-hours, no longer a classic diner. Regular stand-by diner foods replaced by trendy foods on menu. BUT the sweet and sour cabbage soup is still delicious.

Low key diner- good for lazy weekend meals with friends.  While they do have delicious breakfast option, they are very strict about lunch starting at 11.   If it's a diner style tuna melt you want for brunch, you're going to have to wait until 11 to order.   You can't put your order in with the waitress at 10:45 when the rest of your table is ready to order so by the time you get your food at 11:10, you can have the lunch item you wanted.   You'll wait patiently till 11 to order that tuna melt, with cheddar- it's better that way.   When you do get it, you'll be so happy.  Because it was just what you wanted.  

It's a BYOB situation for brunch.   Try the pancakes for breakfast- or just get an order for the table while you wait 20mins for the lunch menu.  

The staff could be friendlier, but whatever.  

***not actually open 24hrs***
Super friendly service. Nice quality diner fare with a somewhat more creative, compelling menu than you'd usually find. Not at all pretentious though.

What a great place for Vegan food. The menu is expansive and offers many options.

I love taking my friends, family, and coworkers there since they have so many options for everyone. A warm and cozy atmosphere is so welcoming and friendly. Staff are some of the coolest people to meet.

The decor alone is very interesting. Our server was enthusiastic. Everyone was super helpful in taking care of our vegan order. Very vegan friendly. Knowledgeable staff. Great vegan menu options! Vegan milkshakes!! Late hours!! Exciting find! Will be back!!

I'm a mocha person so it's difficult to try different things when you love something so much. But the menu here is pretty imaginative and makes you want to order out of your routine. The espresso is delicious!

the food was very very good. I had the vegan hash (i think that's the name, i came with potatoes). I would recommend you get a pancake or a side item if you ate very hungry.  I was basically starving.  I had 2 glasses of water before I ate and 1 glass after and I was still hungry.

the service was good. we're went when it wasn't busy so maybe that's why.  but the server was nice

Open super late and everything is delicious! To know that I can still have mozzarella (vegan) cheese sticks made me so happy 😋  They offer something for everybody. My husband and daughter both enjoyed it! This has become a go-to.

The menu sounds amazing and the food is pretty good but there is a large quality value issue with their food. I got take out and was expecting to have a really good feast with friends for the $50 I spent. When I opened the containers at home I found my $6 bowl of chili was in a half filled container that measured a total of half a cup of product. My cheese burger was nothing but a burger on a bun not even cheese. My $10 order of pretzel bites was exactly 10 tiny bites. I will not be wasting my money here again.
A cool place to hang out with friends. Awesome beer. Great food. Nice music and courteous & extra polite staff are some things that make beer guzzling a bright activity here.

Sundays are great at Rocks because it's not too crowded. The food is great and service is pleasant. We usually have a group of 10 or so, and it's always a good time. The nachos have frito chips, and it's delicious!

Great food, beer, and whiskey selection. I happened to be there on burger night and it was great. The burger was tasty and the price couldn’t be beat. Service was on top of everything as well. Will definitely be back if I’m in the Chicago area.

This place was really quiet for a saturday. Not sure if this is typical. The other one they have on Broadway is usually really busy. Service and beer was decent and the burgers actually better than I expected.

I've been going here fairly regularly for a couple years now. It's still good, but it's gone a bit downhill, I'm sorry to say--they're cutting a few corners, I think. Here's hoping they turn that around. 

Still, they're hard to beat in this neighborhood. You should definitely consider ordering off of the "secret menu," which has more interesting choices than you find at a typical American Thai restaurant. They have a full bar with decent beer and wine selections.

I would feel bad leaving one star, but this place needs to get it together. I've been there a few times because it's so close to me, but each time it's gotten worse and I won't be going back. Thai quick means you should eat it really quick so you can't taste it. They clearly don't clean their pans between cooking  because my chicken fried rice tasted like expired fish which made me feel sick, as I'm allergic to most sea food and shell fish. Not to mention on top of that it was very mushy like something you would feed to a baby. This is definitely a roulette place. I've had decent food from there 1/3 times.
Amazing Thai food! I loved the Thai movie posters on the wall. Super neat eatery. Worth checking out!
We love Tac Quick - rarely too crowded, inexpensive drinks, and great food!! It’s perfect for a casual date night.
Adorable atmosphere. The chive dumplings (pot sickers) are fantastic. Lad Nar noodles were a little too soupy, but the flavors were awesome.

Can i give this place 10 stars?! Because if I could, I TOTALLY would. I went here two days in a row while I was visiting and wish I could have gone more. The food is amazing, especially the cinnamon rolls. They were the best cinnamon rolls I have ever had in my life. This was also the best brunch ever! And the service was exceptional!!! Everything is homemade - the juices, the applesauce, the breads! Go here and thank me later! Best brunch in the world!!!!

Charming decor, absolutely delicious food.  Fresh and perfectly prepared.  Great choice of sides.  Generous servings!  I dare you to finish everything on your plate!  And those cinnamon rolls!  Heavenly.  I heard a choir of angels singing when I took my first bite.  Super friendly staff.  Get over there asap!

Delicious! Went there on a Wednesday morning so it was absolutely pleasant and not busy at all. Our server was friendly and quick without being intrusive. Food came out in a reasonable time and was very tasty.

Good portions, too. Left with leftovers of my entree.

A lovely and local institution. Good food and fun atmosphere. Staff is great, too. Like any other place, IF you arrive while it's super busy, expect some bumps in the road, obviously. However, go while at other times and it is quite wonderful. Cheers.

One of my most stop restaurants when I visit Chicago.  The breakfast is incredibly good.  The cinnamon rolls are some of the best I've ever had. The chicken sausage with basil is amazing.  Eggs Benedict were prepared perfectly.  Come hungry and plan on skipping lunch as the portions are large.  Servers are friendly and I enjoy the Cafe atmosphere.
Mostly just came for a Valentine's Day milkshake. It was excellent. Super interesting shake. I definitely plan to come back to try some entree items. Friendly staff, too. Very warm host and hostess.

Th vegan friendly menu was easy to navigate.  This is a beautiful cozy restaurant to take even a meat eating friend or family member to and you can surprise them that vegan options are just as delicious as their traditional dishes.  The shakes are a MUST! The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is relaxed and easy to just want to hang out.  Easily one of my favorite vegetarian restaurants in the city!

I went with my friend for her Birthday.  It was our first time there.  The food was delicious. She had the Reuben which was yummy. I had the Black Bean Burger which was delicious as well. Although I'm not vegan I will definitely return for another meal and we had great service.
A favorite spot for tasty vegetarian food. I had a cousin come into town and she asked me to go back here. It has a nice atmosphere.
Service was good. Music was good. Nice yet simple atmosphere. Food came in a very decent time frame as well. Great portions. And it was DELICIOUS!!!

Good cozy place. I’m not impressed by their crepes, to be honest. The crepes don’t have its own flavor and sometimes weird combinations of flavors in general. Since I love France very much, but didn’t really met here something similar to what I had in France, maybe because of local ingredients, but still

Wonderful big crepes, especially the dinner ones. I am not too crazy about the selection of French wines ( I prefer  American wine). I love, love the ambiance, especially in the summer, when the outside is open. It is a must for Bastille day, they have roaming musicians!

One of my favorite restaurants in the area! The food is authentic and the portions are a great size. They have  something for everyone. Every time I go I try something new and have never been disappointed. The staff is just as great as the food, so kind and friendly.
So tasty.  Substantial savory crepes, too.  Not like the ones that are rolled up like a flute, with not enough filling.  These are big and square with lots of filling.   Mmmmm

I think this might be the first french crêperie in Chicago. If not, it's definitely the best. I actually went to check out the French onion soup (ITS AMAZING HERE MUST GET IT!) I don't really like sweets, but the server gave both my gf and I free crepes for our anniversary and oh my lord I was instantly converted into a crepe lover. This place is very charming, has amazing service and a warm energy. Must check it out!

I have ordered from this restaurant twice and had it delivered via DoorDash. The taste was great, however, the first time I ordered I noticed that the corn tortillas had green mold spots that I had to tear off.

I assumed this was an isolated incident and tried a second time. I wanted to give it another chance, because the toppings were delicious. Sure enough though, green mold spots on the corn tortillas again. This time it was so covered, I had to throw the whole taco out.

Will NOT be ordering again, as clearly there are some unclean food handling practices going on here. 🤮
I made a mistake when I ordered. Wouldn’t refund me or give me the correct burrito in place. HORRIBLE SERVICE WILL NEVER GO HERE AGAIN.

This place is so good! My husband and I have gone a couple of times for the tofu burrito and it was filling and delicious. If you're across the street for a concert, this is a great place to go after for food. They can get busy when concerts get out but when we were there, they were fast despite that.
Delicious and affordable by any measure. As a late night spot for after-club munchies, it's one of the best un Chicago

I ordered delivery from them and this place is incredible. They're open super late, you get a lot of food, and the food is extremely affordable. They always have a coupon to use, and the delivery was super fast for a Saturday night. Their horchata is decent, I got the veggie burrito with a side of rice and beans, and they put peppers and veggies in their beans, so it has extra flavor. I absolutely will be ordering from them again!

The food was average and bland. I was less than impressed with the options on their “vegetarian menu”. Both of the dishes I ordered were not well seasoned and the side of beans and rice could have used some work. The prices aren’t bad and the location is easy to get to, but the food wasn’t special enough to warrant a re-visit. The service was also quite slow, for it being a fairly quite Monday evening. Wasn’t thrilled.

The food was below average and the drinks were water down. Have had better Mexican in the neighbourhood. 
Service was good and the restaurant was clean.

The Food Was Great Thanks To Edwin the Chef! I'm being going to this restaurant for many Years. It was always a pleasure to go there, cause I feels that I  was @ home! I always feel welcomed. The waiter's before were the Best, Specially Gabriel, and Victor! Now only Cesar is there, he's Good too! But the one serves us last night, was Not So Helpful, weren't Not So Happy with he's Service. Victor the bartender was a Great worker Too! He's Not There anymore! The restaurant Needs to bring Back All of Those Great Workers, So It Can Be A Pleasant Restaurant Again, and Enjoy The Wonderful Environments that Use To Be Before! Happy, and Welcomes People Needs To Be There. So Old Costumers Can Enjoy the Wonderful Environments that Use To Be!
Great food, great price, and great ambiance.
Great guacamole. Really nice wait and bus staff.

I never leave reviews, literally ever. This place is DIVINE. We ended up having to wait about 3 hours and was completely worth the wait. The meat was cooked literally to perfection, the atmosphere was perfectly intimate, the service was top of the line. The waiter was taking care of our needs before we even had to ask. Would come back here everyday if I could!

We flew from England to Chicago to meet friends who took us to this AMAZING restaurant.
From going in, to coming the atmosphere and vibe was brilliant.
The staff are excellent, the food was incredible. Nothing was a problem....take your own drink cuts your bill by half by not getting ripped off. been to Chicago many times, eaten at many restaurants but this one is TOPS. well done to all the staff for making it a night to remember. Thank you

Tango Sur is a BYOB Argentinian Steak House that has a very cool atmosphere. It is dimly lit with wall sconce lighting that help make the atmosphere what it is. The only drawback to that is that you may need your cell phone to read the menu, not a big deal. I do suggest making a reservation prior to your visit. I was there on a Sunday evening about 7:30 and the place was mobbed. I arrived a bit early before my table was ready. The host directed us to a nice sitting room in the rear of the restaurant while we waited for our table, it is the perfect spot to enjoy the bottle of wine you may have brought with you until your table is ready. My meal was outstanding which was a bone-in pork dish on the nightly specials menu. Also tried the corn and ham & cheese empanadas which were great too.

Pretty incredible! The food, the ambiance, the waiting staff!  it was all absolutely on point! Don't eat anything else that day so you have room for the amount of meat they can offer you :) it is absolutely satisfying!
The meat was cooked to tender perfection. The sweetbread was delicious, the short ribs were heavenly. Best steaks ever

Excellent service. All staff friendly and helpful.
Great food. Got the basil pesto, sun dried tomato omelette and pancakes very fluffy! The sassy eggs are tasty too. Love the red potatoes hash.
Cute ambiance. Thank you, will be back!
The food is delicious and the service was wonderful. The place has energy but it isn't  loud and overwhelming.

The omu rice was excellent both in flavor and presentation. The apple souffle pancake is fluffy and delicious. Unfortunately the service was under par, we had to wait for caffee, water, check, throughout the meal, and it was not busy. 
Free parking on Sundays, credit accepted

This is probably one the most delicious and cleanest Asian/French cuisines restaurants that I have ever dine at. The service and food was beyond my expectations. I will be returning; probably tomorrow lol. Thank you Yoshi's Cafe!!
Always the epitome of elegance with excellent ingredients for a very fair price.

This has become one of my favorite spots after just two visits. I went for dinner the first time and fell in love with the grit tots and biscuits with honey butter. Amazing start to my meal and the shrimp and grits entree was also incredible. My fiancé had steak which was also very well prepared and juicy. Second time we had brunch and it was amazing! The chicken and waffles were a generous portion with a delicious hot sauce. The French toast had great texture and flavor. I would highly recommend the biscuits and grit tots, must try if you dine here.

This place is assume and the food is great. A nice spin on the hot sauce. I had the shrimp and grits nice size shrimps and grits soft and the seasoning great. I'm from Charleston SC, so I know what good food taste like. 
I could go on and on but you gotta go there and see for yourself.

Have had brunch here twice, both times were excellent. After a night of partying, its hard to beat chicken n waffles with a mimosa. The biscuits are always warm out of the oven, and the gravy was pretty good. The chicken & waffles is a great deal for under $20, its a ton of food that will set you on a path to Deep Couch City. I am salivating just thinking about it.

All of the food was fresh, creative, flavorful and delicious.  The cocktails we're excellent as well.  It has a rustic farmhouse vibe which compliments the southern themed menu.  The atmosphere was lively and energetic and the bar has a unique design with a decent amount of seating.

Go for a good brunch experience. Great food and soothing ambience. 
Must try— Short rib hash and biscuits.

There's some cool history here, but it's a deceivingly small museum, especially when a few of the exhibits were closed. Other than the major Chicago history area with the antique El car and other artifacts, a lot of the exhibits felt like... a stretch. An entire room was devoted to Lincoln and places he happened to visit in Chicago, when he didn't really have much to do with the city otherwise. There's a wall about a tiny connection Chicago had to the nuclear bomb AND the birth control pill, which felt like a bold choice.

A lot of the interactive pieces in the museum were in need of repair- a practice piano was out of tune, the "learn to play" guitars were missing multiple strings, and the historical statues by the El car had almost all the paint chipped off of them. The museum cafe is also not open for the entirety of the operating hours of the museum, which is... strange.

They gave us a discount (not sure why, but we weren't going to ask!), and the staff was very friendly, but this was a one and done for me.

P.S. Definitely take a picture in the hot dog. If you're going to go, go all in.
Very nice museum! Low prices, and definitely worth visiting! I loved the exhibits they had, especially the one focused on freedom. Also, the exhibit about Martin Luther King Jr was extraordinary!
What a great hang out spot! I came here with my sister and we had a blast! We were very pleased about our visit, and the exhibits were awesome! ❤️❤️❤️

A very accessible museum, with interesting and thoughtful exhibits organized in a casual and not overly voluminous way. It makes the material highly digestible. Many of the galleries are focused on the history of Chicago, and much of the history of Chicago is quite fascinating. Aside from that, however, there are special exhibits which focus on particular issues of sociological and historical importance, whether related to Chicago or not. And just being able to see the actual bed in which Abraham Lincoln passed away is worth the price of admission.
More interactive exhibits would have pushed this to 5 stars. Reasonable with groupon at 10.00 for entry. Kids under 12 free of from out of state. Very clean and well laid out.

I really enjoyed the exhibits at this museum. They had great paintings, and artifacts, and paired them well with written text to help really bring to life the history of the museum. The staff was slightly aloof, however, and the building gives off a little bit of a creepy vibe. If you have any interest in surgical history or just want to kill an hour learning something new - this place is the place to be!

If you're looking for something different to do in the city look no further. After having visited the other main museums dozens of times when visiting the city this was a very unique change of pace. They have a wide array of medical tools and artifacts and I learned quite a bit. It's crazy to see how much progress we have made in just the last 100 years in medicine. They also had a really cool modern art exhibit on the top floor of the museum which was very unique.

I do not understand how his museum has a 4+ star rating. By no means is this museum a rip off. There is substance. However, the organization of objects and their description could be vastly improved. A lot of times I have to look for a description for an object, but have a hard time finding it. In addition, the interior and the display cases of the museum are old. The paintings and sculptures look low quality. Perhaps you can justify the quality of this was 8-10 dollars, but at 17, I do expect something better.

The lady at the front desk was incredibly rude. My friend took about 10 seconds looking for her student ID when she stated “we don’t have time; there are 8 people behind you.” There was actually a grand total of one person behind us. Maybe don’t hire someone with absolutely no people skills to sell tickets. Maybe someone who could count would be helpful too.

This is a pretty interesting and educational museum on all sorts of medicinal, historical, and scientific information. It did feel a little underwhelming but it has enough to keep you entertained for a couple of hours, nothing too out of the ordinary here. Wouldn't really recommend it for kids as it doesn't have too much for them but if you're studying or practicing in the medical field, you will have a lot of fun here. Also, the admissions office can easily be skipped here as there is no one that works here that checks if you actually paid to get in or not so I don't know how they overlooked that here.

A total oasis, this is a place where you can go and find complete piece of mind. To the point where you wouldn't even want to leave. This is a very family friendly place, with lots to see... This would make a great memorable, wedding spot too. I suggest everyone too go, and please donate as well to help keep this beautiful place up and running. This place also offer volunteer opportunities, I recommend it to broaden your horizons.

Another great place to visit that's completely FREE!!! Just like the zoo, donations are welcomed and deserved. If you go in the colder months, be sure to wear layers, it's very warm and humid in the Palm House. It's absolutely beautiful!! I could spend hours reading on one of the many benches listening to the chiming bowls and rain sounds.

This was the surprise highlight of our most recent trip to Chicago! I love plants, and this conservatory was brimming with beautiful blooms and trees, ferns and fronds! There were a number of exotic and impressive plants and trees. I truly loved this place.

This conservatory is much bigger than how it looks from the front. There are so many different variety of ferns, flowers, orchids, and trees. This is wonderful to walk through especially during the Chicago winters. It's right next to Lincoln Park Zoo and best of all, it's free.

I always love the conservatory. It's free, there is a rotating flower exhibit in one of the rooms, the plants are well-tended, and it's wonderfully peaceful. The fern room usually has excellent sound exhibits that elevate the experience, and there are benches in almost every room for resting/relaxing. You can sponsor a bench in someone's honor, as well. This is a great place to visit in any weather and makes a beautiful backdrop for photos. Just be sure to get permission to do a shoot first!

What a wonderful surprise. Found parking right outside did not go broke paying for parking. I could even afford to check my coat. LOVED the butterfly release!! Very relaxing and fun. My new little buddy sat with me for an hour. Had to have a staff member relocate him. Loved it.

Be prepared for kids! 

The exhibits are often hip high, and very simple. It's obviously meant mostly for kids. The butterfly room, however, is worth admission alone. Tons of butterflies and birds liven up the space. It's a nice break from winter. 

Some exhibits are a little more adult friendly, but I'd love the whole second floor to be dedicated to adults, since I felt that I didn't learn much from the exhibits.

This is a really cool place to learn more about the animals and nature around you the coolest part were the butterflies but I was disappointed when i overheard someone say that they have to get new butterflies every single day because they  die very quickly in the room they are in and I did see a ton of dead butterflies and I saw one with part of its wing dangling off. Then we visited the bird area and that was not what I thought it was going to be at all I belive it was going to be similar to the butterflies room but it wasn't it was just a deck outside that you have to hope there are birds around.

Great experience for school field trip. They set us up and give us open access pretty much. It would be nice to have more staff around to explain the exhibits to students as they progress through museum. The highlight was the butterfly exhibit.
Awesome garden with ever changing floral beauty. The best part is that there is no entry fees and you can come back often to keep track of seasonal changes.

One of the best galleries we get to go to on a regular basis. The owners are always very attentive and take their time to elaborate on current shows and artists work. Going there for openings is always satisfying.

I was in town to visit a project in the area and found myself in a chatty circle with my work colleagues randomly just outside the entrance to this gallery. A gentleman who was employed by this gallery took exception to the three of us conversing on the public street in front of his gallery and asked us to leave. I had considered taking a look inside this gallery in the past, but never had the time. I won't consider taking a look inside ever again.
Amazing original Art got to meet the Artist Thomas Masters
Thomas was a pleasure to work with and the studio is filled with beautiful artwork and paintings from multiple artists.
Ok

The association as cited in the news seems to care more about the charm and integrity of a structure in the neighborhood than the damage their stance  causes to a child and their family. People with disabilities should have every right to modify access to their homes to suit their needs, regardless of history. Recommending that this family move adds yet another challenge, barrier, and potential strain; all of which are wholly unnecessary and ableist.  

For years people with disabilities have been denied access to public and private spaces in the name of historical preservation, but all this does is tell the disabled community that we are not valued enough to gain access to the same spaces as the abled. It says we are less than. Valuing ableism over humanity does not support your mission of enhancing community. I find this group’s choice to sue over a garage appalling.

Noticed on the website that OTTA said they are “committed to enhancing the quality of life for residents in the area” and wanted to point out that that statement is entiretly incorrect. This association is discriminatory against the disabled community and would rather protect a building that was built to ablist standards rather than support a young woman in their community. 

Not all things from the past are worth protecting. This history of Chicago’s ablism should be something we actively work to abolish and learn from. The OTTA is on the wrong side of history.
Is this the association that Mr Weiss discriminates against a child in a wheel chair by complaining about the house renovations to accommodate the handicapped child. Pretty sick.
Great place!
Great community based arts organization.

Beautiful church. Daily Mass is in the chapel on the left of the main church. Entrance is hidden between the buildings, so it was a little hard to find. No kneelers in the main church, but it's a beautiful, peaceful place to pray. Thankfully they keep the church accessible during the day, which is nice.

A classic church that was built before and actually survived the Chicago fire. Tons of history. Beautiful interior with very picturesque stain glass windows. It is in the heart of old Town with scenic walks straight down to the lake and Lincoln Park Zoo.
This is a church built based on mid 19th century Bavarian churches. The interior is worth a visit. Keep in mind that I am not a Catholic, so I am purely looking at the architectural aspect. 🙂.
This is a beautiful sanctuary in an historic church. I got to sing Handel's Messiah with other members of the Apollo Chorus as guests of the church's Schola Cantorum.
Many GREAT MEMORIES, WHILE ATTENDING @VAN GORDER WALDEN SCHOOLSCHOOL...@GREGORYDANIELS@JoanLoPrestI@@Amazingedibles

Good middle eastern food at a great price. Hummus is amazing actually and I'd probably grab it here over any grocery store. Nice cozy seating and located 15 minute walk away from the Lincoln Park zoo it's the perfect place to stop for a quick lunch.

The seating is pretty limited. It seems like the place is more famous for take outs. But they were very polite and arranged the tables for us.  

Then came the ordering part. The serving size is huge for the price. The plate was full up to the brim and then some more. The food tasted very good. The price for the dinner plate was very reasonable. 

I would definitely try this place again next time I pass by.
Best spot for takeout. The prices are reasonable and the portions are large. The food is always delicious and fresh!! Recommend the hummus, lentil soup and falafal.

Classic quick serve falafel joint. Cash only, incredibly fast, and delicious. I'm used to going to the North Avenue location and there's a remarkable consistency between the two locations. Prices quality and service are excellent at both locations. It's very easy to eat delicious vegetarian food on the cheap here.

We had chicken shawrma, and it was AMAZING! We don't mind to drive back from Milwaukee to Chicago to have it again.
The staff were awesome, Peter is a wonderful man. Very friendly and elegant.
The cook was very helpful with offering samples. Great place. Thank you!

🤣 I love this place. Go, have fun in there. Please, leave your mannerism in your home, and definitely don't come here if get easily offended. I had a Char Veggie Burger, & it was very delicious. Worth visiting not once but 1000 times! A must stop if you're in Chicago.

This place is a Chicago classic...we go here every time we come back to town and it hasn't changed at all.  Why change perfection?  We heard a rumor the building had been sold and they were closing.  THANK GOODNESS this fell thru!

If you're sober, the food tastes like trash. If you go after a night out, the food tastes a lot better but the employees are ruthless. The crazy lady behind the counter held my burger hostage for only tipping $1 and would not give me my food (which I had already paid for) until I tipped her more. Hate this place.

So much fun... If you're easily offended, don't go here! This eatery is run by a dynamic duo (at a time- order taker & cook) and they will not be traditional about service... I love this place!!! Great for late night eats
My Turkey burger was better than burger king... Definitely recommend to stop by.... Don't be shy because all you can eat is at Wiener's just stop by...

Was looking for a place to grab brunch with my girlfriend yesterday. Lines and long wait times in most of the usual places on Wells St, but this place had no wait. Sat down outside under a nice, big umbrella, with flowers along the outside railing. Server was very nice, and food was delicious. I had the apple cinnamon french toast, which was amazing. 

The only thing I was a little dissatisfied with at this place was that no one ever came by to refill my water during the meal, which is something I think is pretty standard practice at a majority of sit-down restaurants.
Great dishes and superb service. Really enjoyed the ambiance. They're a bit too generous with salt on the fries but that can definitely be rectified by asking for less salt when you order.

One of my favorite places for a chill dinner in the neighborhood. This is a perfect place to sit on the front patio, get a glass of wine and people watch. If I go here for brunch, I feel like I could sit there all day! The staff if really friendly and, in true European dining form, they don't force you out of the restaurant or try and turn your table around quickly. 

I would say the best mussels on Wells street and their Bistrot salad is to die for as well!

Best mussels in the city.   I would go back just for these.

Great food with a French twist all around.  

Able to host private parties upstairs.  Nice touch. 

Get the mussels!

Had an amazing brunch at Bistrot Margot last weekend, no wait and great attentive service.  The food was delicious, every plate brought out looked better the next.  They have some truly unique menu items and I can't wait to come back and try more.

My boyfriend and I both left here feeling slighted from the food we were served. To start, our service was slow to begin with. It tasted good, but for $71 bill we feel that we should have received more sushi when ordering the $34 sushi combo. Did our waitress bring out the right plate? We ate it because we hadn't ate all day and we were starving. I'm including pictures. We left still hungry and with a lukewarm feeling.
Amazing food!!!! Wonderful, attentive service. Very beautiful ambiance, lovely and cozy i absolutely loved it. And again, good was amazing. From sushi, to steaks and seafood.

Amazing sushi, atmosphere, and service. At first glance, it might just seem like an upscale bar. However, when you walk further into the restaurant, you encounter a cozy, relatively large dining room. The sushi menu is not the longest, but you will be highly satisfied with what is listed. The specials were delicious as well!

Beautiful atmosphere, great service, delicious sake and sushi.
We had the two sake flights, spicy tuna and salmon deluxe rolls and everything was amazing. Great quality fish!
Aesthetically pleasing interior designs. Delicious food. Spot on service especially our waitress who was superbly nice!

We have been coming here before the Steppenwolf for many years... the prices have gone up and portions have shrunk a bit recently. Still good, lacks a little in atmosphere for the prices. Pizza is also still very good, just pricier. Just a little disappointed the last couple of times... not the value that it used to be here. Since the place was not full up as it used to be before a show, I guess the word is getting out.
We had a Groupon, and they treated us very well. Breanna was plolite and prompt, and the food was delicious!

I got onion and Italian beef. I was absolutely surprised when I picked up the slice and it held together. The crust was crispy, very hearty. The beef was a perfect blend of fatty and lean. Not dried out and it was tender enough that it didn't get pulled off the pizza when you took a bite. Onions were perfectly caramelized: sweet and translucent. The sauce was absolutely high quality, made in house. The crust is a cheese ring. It looks burnt but it's a tasty cheese crisp. It's layered like so: pizza crust, mozzarella cheese, sauce (on sauce), mozzarella cheese, then onion and beef. Highly recommend you visit.

I’ve heard for a while now that Pequod’s is the best pizza in Chicago, and that’s saying something because Chicago is known for its pizza. 

When we arrived, perhaps shame on us, we had our two kids (13 and 10) and were asked to wait two doors down until a table opens up. Well, even though the spot two sores down was “family friendly” it was a bar... hard to not explain it that way. Either way we stayed, had a drink and when we asked to order an appetizer (after trying to wave the waiter down for about 15 minutes) we were told the kitchen closed hours ago (then why did you drop the menu off???). 

But all of that changed when we were able to sink our teeth into their pizza. If there is anything on earth that is better than that delicious pie, I don’t know what it is. The pizza is filling, but almost forces you to eat more and more. I just never wanted our stay there to end - so we ordered a pizza to go. 

We did order a deep dish (I mean, come on, right?) but the pizza to go was a normal bar style pizza. Do yourself a favor and don’t order anything but a Chicago-style pizza. You won’t regret it.

I have been wanting to try this pizza for a long time. We are pizza lovers. Walked into the place at 11am. No wait. Very friendly service. The lunch special was an absolute bargain. We ordered the salad with it. Salad was fresh and good, garlic dressing was good. Pizza was absolutely delicious. I’m very picky about sausage, and the sausage recipe is delicious!! We will be back for this amazing pizza😋 highly recommend!!

I polled a number of folks I was meeting with on best spot for pizza and this was the consensus.  Can't claim to be an expert on deep dish pizza, but it certainly was amazing.  Highly recommend.  Casual place.  Two floors with bars on both.  Just good down to earth place with great pizza.

This was my first trip to Chicago and I wanted to do everything local possible in these 4 days. This friend recommended this pizza place. We were a little unsure when we saw the pictures in the reviews. However, this was such an amazing experience. We went here just before flying out. The pizzas are unique in taste and variety and the taste is outstanding. My husband and I had a great time here. Ordered the half buffalo wings and a personal pizza and were literally Blown away with the taste and experience. Super friendly staff and quicker service than expected.

BYOB restaurant with traditional and fusion dishes. Very reasonably priced (about 16-20 for an entree with unlimited rice and chutney). Friendly knowledgeable staff, authentic yet creative dishes. A great place for a relaxing dinner with friends or a date. Would highly recommend.
Great place, great atmosphere, and great food! If you got a taste for Indian food or want to try something new, come here! Just be sure to make a reservation... this place gets busy!!
Had a excellent experience in this spot with my friend. The food arrives quickly and the service is just great. Prices are affordable.

Best Indian food we've had in Chicago. We make a point to come here often. It's all delicious and the service is phenomenal as well. It's pretty small inside, so make sure to make a reservation if you don't want to wait.

Best Indian food in Chicago and beyond. The tandoori chicken is to die for. Amazing attentive service with very reasonable prices. Naan is soft fresh and fluffy. Vegetarian options are made fresh and not oily at all. Byob with great street parking. This is the best Indian food I’ve eaten in the US

Very unique experience. It is a culinary journey and all your senses were awoken with the food. The visual aspects as well food was incredible. The waiters were knowledgeable and the ingredients were unique and proportioned to perfect amounts. The wine pairing was very sophisticated and were matched well. I would go again.

Very unique experience. It is a culinary journey and all your senses were awoken with the food. The visual aspects as well food was incredible. The waiters were knowledgeable and the ingredients were unique and proportioned to perfect amounts. The wine pairing was very sophisticated and were matched well. I would go again.

Alinea is the best restaurant in my life. It's was great experiments go to this place. There are professionals of what they do. 

When you go to the restaurant, it feels like you are in another reality, where everything is only for you because you are special.

The interior is very modern, each part of the restaurant is different but good combination of each other.

Food ... Just something unbelievable. We had 12 dishes. All of them were a work of art not only for presentation but also for taste. This is a combination of something cosmic what I never had before.

They really deserve their Michelin Stars!!!!!
I thank you so much everyone who work in that restaurant you do the big job guys and I'm really appreciate  that I was  part of this Magic.

It's really difficult to write a review for a three michellen star restaurant. This is really meant to be a once in a life time experience and well worth the price if you are into food and experience. Alinea  easily lived up to its reputation. Amazing and thoughtful service starts the second you set foot in the door and continues till you walk out. Service is well thought out every step of the way.  The mood and environment created by the staff was relaxed and fun which I was not expecting.

Was it expensive? Yes.  Was it worth the money? DEFINITELY.  This was such a phenomenal, memorable dining experience. You have to have an appreciation of what they do here; if you’re into chain restaurants and fast food, this will be a complete waste of your money.  If you’re considering it, just go for it.  I can’t wait to come back!
Beautiful  church. Went there for a wedding.
Very nice catholic church.
Beautiful space for events and large teams. Great location right off downtown.
Food not rated good.
This church has been nothing but warm, welcoming, and kind. My family and I have always felt like we belong.

Came to a Quinceanera ( fifteen birthday celebration) and the mass was very nice.  The church looks great from outside as well as for inside.  It was also nice to take pictures in front of the church since it has very large pillars.  There are two angels as you come in the church and you feel welcomed.   Many nice paintings all around and statues.

I went to St. Mary of the Angels school practically my whole life, and I absolutely loved it. The teachers and students were great. The school did a fantastic job of teaching me my faith and allowing me to succeed in high school.
Beautiful church with amazing religious  artwork. Awesome choir and organ music at Sunday mass. A serene setting for prayer and contemplation.

I think you all did an excellent job on the daycare centerwho's the best suggestion all you know those kids is a drama school had around their window what can you put around that so the kids can play baseball again I'm more secure that was a church in where the priestess hang out at I appreciate it thank you
Just went in to check it out.  Very beautiful. Very.  Know nothing else about it but a wedding there must be stunning. Nice neighborhood location.

Amazing service!! The kind friendly person  working led me through the menu with excitement & shared enthusiasm about what I ordered. Food was spot on! Got some tacos, I tried 3 different kinds. Super tasty & filled with flavor! I can’t wait to return!

Love this place!! Such an awesome vegan/vegetarian option and it is nice and cozy. The variety of options is excellent. We have tried every single taco choice on the menu! Their juices and smoothies are excellent as well. It's never like crazy crowded but there are always people rotating in and out no matter the time we have gone. Highly recommend.

Great service good prices. The menu is fully vegan but can be vegetarian-ized. Lots of fresh justices or smoothies. Good amount of seating and you can have food delivered through a variety of services. Street parking can be tough but you know, welcome to Chicago.

Overall I thought the place was great. It's not huge but they use all the space to have  a lot of tables. Staff is very polite and the flavors are so authentic. Some "meats" have a different size than the original, but overall the texture is very true to the original dish which honestly surprised me, especially for the chicharron. The only things I will say could be improved is waiting when the restaurant is full, and desserts. We tried a couple different desserts and they really weren't very good. The texture and the flavor were a little off. That said, the food was very good and the prices were very affordable. For some dishes you honestly wouldn't be able to tell you're eating a vegan dish.

Delicious food, easy ways to veganize most dishes and the staff is knowledgeable about the menu making it easy to order! The staff is always very friendly especially Fernando! Love coming here and recommending it to everyone I know!

Margie's has some of the best ice cream I've ever had and don't even start me on their fudge. The fridge is absolutely the best thing there. The servings can be a bit large for some, but I can promise you, you'll be glad at the amount of ice cream they give. They also have amazing Terrapins at the candy section. Their chocolate is just all around amazing. I hope you enjoy.
Oh yes!.. what should I recommend? I basically love everything they have... Been here so many times and this place is always packed!!! Probably my all time favorite!

Margie's was very crowded with not much room to stand to wait. However, the staff are fantastic! Despite being extremely busy they worked well together, were polite, and were very efficient. Lots of dessert options that were delicious. I say it was worth the wait!

To say that I am in love with the ice cream here is an understatement. It is #1 in my heart and on my list of favorite ice cream places. I’m not an ice cream connoisseur by any means but this place definitely deserves some kind of award. I get really emotional thinking about that chocolate sauce and those wafers. It’s that good.

Really pleasant vintage atmosphere. The Turtle Sundae was absolutely amazing and well worth the money! The quality was really great, the staff/waiters were friendly and the old man who cleans is so sweet. I'll be back here very soon.
Regular

No me explico como este tipo de establecimiento le dan una licencia de turismo para que operen con tanta impunidad y colocan en la recepción un documento que avala que fue supervisado por el ente rector, por Dios vayan e inspeccionen y verán que no cumple con los requerimientos mínimos para operar como hotel y menos en esa jurisdicción de Chacao.
Problemas de agua y con algunos elementos esenciales como el aire acondicionado. La ubicación ideal, cerca de muchas cosas incluyendo una estación del metro.
Muy cómodo, bueno y limpio. Son muy atentos con el cliente. Las habitaciones son limpias. El agua llegua las 8 am y 10 pm. Me gustó el lugar además de ser muy céntrico.
Buena opción relación precio valor
Always love going back to this place when I'm in my old neighborhood. The ultimate Mexican comfort food spot. They hook it up!
Great Taco Salad bowl! It came in a unique flour/bowl and tastes amazing. Very filling and one of my favorite meals!
Cool little neighborhood place.  Family owned and run with good food options and great margaritas.  Tight seating but friendly people.  Numerous visits and always enjoyable.
Despite the name, this is a decent place for Mexican food. Prices were reasonable and the food was decent. I found it a little noisy, but not excessively so. A good place for Mexican food.

I ordered a chimichanga and my friend ordered nachos. Both dishes were extremely authentic, and flavorful, with plenty of cheese and meat. The service was excellent and the food came out really quickly (like 10 minutes!). This was actually the best Mexican food we’ve ever had.

Why travel to France when you can experience France in your backyard? The ambiance is very cozy... ideal for a date night. The space is a bit crowded but it adds to the ambiance of a bustling neighborhood restaurant. The French onion soup was good and the bouillabaisse was a bit salty. I would revisit to try the duck.

I have too many wonderful things to say about this place. It's the perfect size, feels cozy & familiar.  The standard menu items are amazing, & they change things out seasonally. TALK TO YOUR SERVER & ask for for her recommendations. She will definitely guide you in the right direction. 

And then come back in 2 weeks & try the things you had to skip. ;)

Really enjoyed my visit here! The food was delicious and I especially appreciated our server's willingness to help me with finding gluten free options. She was extremely helpful and made great suggestions about other options that my friend and I would like. I would definitely recommend Le Bouchon and hope to return soon.

Amazing. 5 people, ordered 3 appetizers and 4 main dishes. Every single thing was literally out of this world fabulous. The service was perfect. If you want a nice quiet experience, go elsewhere. It is very, very loud due to small size. We happened to love everything about the place.
This is one of the best French restaurants in Chicago. Staffs are very friendly. Very strong recommendation.

A lot of different styles of art. If you're looking for Dutch, Belgian or other European painters, this is a very good place to see some of their best work. The museum is a beautiful mix of old and new art. The museum contains different small rooms what gives you the chance to admire everything in silence. 
Best way to enter the museum is to use the "New" entrance because the waiting line is much shorter at this side.

Was hot inside...maybe because so many people.  Most of the employees in the galleries were well informed of the history of the artwork....one not so much.  Said she knew nothing about the artwork.  Guess it was just a job for her. Was not easy to negotiate a route whereby you could visit all the galleries without backtracking.  The selection of art work was tremendous.  Well lit galleries.  Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.   Highly recommend the Art Institute.

Truly a world class museum. I've lived in Chicago all my life and have visited this museum more times that I can count, but I always feel I see something new.

It's also a place where you wander around and think 'wow! How did Chicago get all these incredibly famous pieces.' these are precess if are you learn about in school and see on the internet, but I'm person they are even more incredible when you get up close and see each brush stroke or dot on canvas.

 There is something for everyone to enjoy at the museum. Highly recommend to tourists or lifetime Chicago residents!

Amazing exhibits, variety of art to view, modern to traditional. Audio tour is great!  Its a little chaotic at the entrance door and near the door but once you venture into the museum its quieter.  Love seeing students and kids.  Great museum to see, worth the visit!

This was a great place. However the staff was not very friendly. We toured on our own. There was only one young man that spoke to us about one of the pieces there (the huge lock with the Snow white and dwarfs). In talking to some others in another one of our groups, no one spoke to them either. So definitely recommend for the staff to be a little friendly.
Very good experience. It enabled me as a tourist, to understand the history of the African-American population in Chicago. Staff was super-friendly and welcoming.
Great free exhibition.  The collection are well prepared and message is clear and strong. Highly recommended.

Love this place.
Shows are always interesting and the lecture series even better!!
Columbia College does Great on this one!

I enjoyed this museum's exhibit, but it is so hot inside, it's hard to stay long. Three floors of exhibit space, though the top floor was occupied by a big group of students (the museum is located at Columbia College.) Most of the exhibit is located on the first and second floor, anyway. In this exhibit, it's not strictly photography, but an amalgam of media including photography.
