Beautiful free museum inside Columbia University. It has 3 floors and it's located few blocks away from millennium Park

A massive and beautiful park area in the heart of the Chicago Loop. A good place to park is the Grant Park North Garage, which you enter at 25 Michigan Avenue. Grant Park lies in between Michigan Avenue and Lake Shore Drive/Lake Michigan. The area is huge, and there’s plenty to explore within the park and in the surrounding downtown area. The park is also home to many Chicago festivals, including Lollapalooza. If you’re in Chicago, Grant Park is a must-visit.

Wonderful place to visit, whether you're a local or a visitor. In the summer there a lot of flowers and grassy sections to sit on, enjoy the day and people watch. There's always some kind of event going on, whether its Taste of Chicago or Blues Fest. Visit Buckingham Fountain and take a stroll along the lake.
It was very relaxing. I felt safe at dusk here. The view was amazing.

Grant park is the one of the coolest, most underrated attractions, especially if you have kids. There's like a dozen playgrounds, no exaggeration, and they are really freaking awesome playgrounds, some with water, made for different age groups. Between those and the gardens we were in heaven. So much to discover :)

Must go park if you are in Chicago, very ideal place for a walk and Running. It has a good and well maintained park for kids. It is at this park where start and finish of the iconic World Marathon Major takes place. Easily accessible and wheelchair friendly. It houses the world famous millennium cloud and fountain.
Pretty little area in the city
Fantastic place to honor our veterans!
Architecture is the claim to fame here.  A popular lobby bar, and a good basement breakfast & lunch cafeteria.
This is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city. And also if you are a batman fan this is the Wayne tower in the dark knight movie
Great art deco interior design. Good restaurants and shops.
Cafeteria on the lower floor of the building has excellent food and a great place to people watch.
Chicago Board of Trade - Chicago Mercantile Exchange in the Financial District, LaSalle Street Canyon, build 1930 Art Deco, topped with a three story aluminum statue of Cere, goddess of agriculture

This building is one of the coolest things about Chicago. The exhibits are always interesting, and the building is warm and well-kept. The best part is that it's totally free, even for most of their public events. Even if you're only passing through Chicago be sure to stop in and catch a glimpse of all the incredible artistic endeavours being put on display at the Chicago Cultural Center.

Lots of great things on display here.  Close to other tourist areas so it's not out of the way to check out.  Great stop in the area for some free fun.  The place looks really nice as well with great architecture and a good layout.  Be sure to check the map as there are other places inside not open to the public.

Great place to visit. It is free and is quite a magnificent building. It is well wort a few minutes. If you have10 minutes run in quickly just to get a feel for how great the building is. You can certainly spend an hour easily especially if you sit down for a couple minutes and just admire the atmosphere.

The cultural center is beautiful. The history and the attention to detail is stunning. I joined one of the free guided tours and it was really interesting. I thought it was cool that it was originally built as the Chicago library after The Great Chicago fire.

It was really weird coming in here, didn't realize that it was no longer a library. That being said, it was pretty cool inside. The performance art exhibit was again, weird. But that's more to do with me not really getting the point of it than anything else. Someone more attuned to that sort of thing would probably enjoy it much more.

What an awesome experience. Breathtaking views and a ton of history of the building to read through. We went on a weekday and there were no lines or long waits. I like that you could walk around at your own pace. A once in a lifetime experience.

If you are visiting Chicago, this is a must-see attraction. It offers awesome views of the great city of Chicago.
Plan ahead for your visit. The lines are usually long and the wait times can range from 3-4 hours during summer days. The general admission is $24 and the fast-pass tickets are $49/person. $49 is a lot but is well worth it. If you are visiting Chicago, I'd certainly recommend the City pass that includes fast-pass($106/person at the time of writing) which covers 5 great locations all worth visiting (1. Skydeck Chicago - FAST PASS
2.  Shedd Aquarium - PRIORITY ENTRY
3. The Field Museum - VIP ENTRY
4. Museum of Science and Industry   OR   360 CHICAGO Observation Deck - EXPRESS ENTRY
5. Adler Planetarium - VIP ENTRY   OR   Art Institute of Chicago - FAST PASS)

The elevator ride up to 103rd floor is real awesome. Staff are very helpful. To get on the ledge, it is always crowded and some people spend way too much time on it and don't consider people behind them.
The restrooms are clean and well maintained.

All I can say is WOW!! I actually did this and I still can't believe it! The views are breathtaking and the staff were all so nice. The lines were long, but actually moved quickly.  They only give you a minute one there, but it actually is plenty of time and if you want you are welcome to go back in line to do it again.  The staff offer to take pics of you in there which is awesome and they do a great job. You can tell they have been doing it for awhile because they take several at different angles to capture all the views. Highly recommend doing this!

Do. The. Ledge. You will not be disappointed!   Even if visibility is poor, it's an amazing thrill!  They give you about 60-90 seconds to look around/take pictures.  You can do it as many times as you want, you just have to get back in line.  The attendants will take pictures for you which is really nice.

The views up top are incredible and The Ledges are fun,  and they have informational displays along the waiting area to keep you entertained in line.  Once you're in line, you don't know how long the wait ahead of you is, there are no obvious restrooms, no drinking fountains, and only one bench to sit temporarily in what could easily be a 2 hour wait.  And there's a surprise security checkpoint where disinterested employees bar you from bringing pocketknives, if they notice.  None of the employees seemed awake or alive until we got to the top.  Neat, but not the best experience.

Great hotel to stay at in Chicago.  It's in a perfect location, right next to the river and easy to get around.  The room itself was very spacious and clean, and the hotel building is really cool!  I definitely recommend staying here if you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel downtown.

Great experience! The room was gorgeous with picturesque views of Chicago. Lots of activity and entertainment in the lobby and within walking distance. Good food just a few steps from the front door. Very satisfied!

I love this hotel. I was lucky enough to be able to stay here for 3 months while I was on a temporary assignment for my company that has an office directly across the street in the Illinois Center.

By the end of my 2nd week I talked myself into a corner room Jr Suite.

I was able to experience just about about all the services offered from room service to laundry service. The concierge and doormen proved to be very helpful and knowledgeable about Chicago.

My company said I could fly back to my condo in downtown Seattle every weekend or stay in Chicago. I stayed in Chicago most weekends to explore the city!

I experienced great service the entire time I was there.

My only recommendation is that if you get a room where the shower has a big window like the one I had overlooking N Michigan Ave close the curtain otherwise you'll be giving a show to the office workers in the bldg across the street. ☺ 😉.

Like this place. I stay here on business and like the modern rooms. Lots within walking distance. Prompt service, quiet nights sleep with restaurant on premises. My coworkers love the ping pong table. Nice quick walk to Millennium park.

The lobby was wonderful and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had booked a standard room with two queen beds. When we got to the room is was really warm. We asked them to take a look at it and maintenance arrived right away and replaced the air filter. It helped a little, by the evening it had cooled to about 65, but then raised again to about 68. Honestly, I was expecting more for the price we payed. I felt that I would have had the same comfort and amenities at a 2 star hotel.

Such a cool old building. You have to go a few times to understand your way around- where bathrooms are, what floors have stairs and what floors don't. But it's got such a neat vibe and is in such a cool location and has really great businesses inside. I come for the American rhythm center. ♥️
Beautiful historic mixed use building. I love that you can hear music as you walk the halls. The manually operated elevator must be one of the few remaining in the city. Just a gorgeous building.

Where else can you take in free art like THIS. Talk to artists in their studios surrounded by their work, so intimate. I feel a little stupid because I never know what to say. And I saw a free opera there a few weeks ago. I have been here with friends, I might come here alone some time to really immetse myself.

I went to a Zumba class here and had a great time.  The class was offered under the American Rhythm Center and was very affordable.  They offer many different types of classes throughout the week. It was a good time.
Great experience with Maestro of Chicago Youth Symphony. Amazing building! Loved the elevators!
Beautiful building.

One of my favourite places to visit when i come to Chicago. The building is an absolutely amazing time capsule. It feels like you've gone back in time 80 years. Aside from the amazing coffee from intelligentsia there is an old school flower shop, shoe repair place and fedora shop.

This is a beautiful, historic building in Chicago! I am always surprised to hear people who work in or around the building not know about its historical significance. If you are in Chicago, look it up and check it out!
Ordered cappuccino today! Tasted really good. Will come next time!
Good selection of shops but varied levels of technological acceptance for payment.

This is fine building in which to have an office. Small offices abound. The building management is very good and takes good care of this historic architectural icon. We recently renewed our lease and find the rates to be a good value for a Loop office. For a charming office that will make you feel like Sam Spade is your neighboring tenant, this is the place.

Another fine example of why Chicago is such a cool city to explore on foot. The outside of this building has all sorts of great detail work and it would be easy to check it out and just walk on by, but the central lobby is not too be missed. Go on in and see for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

A must see in Chicago. The interior stairs are amazing. And the details in the columns, redesign by the famous architect Frank Lloyd Wright, a treasure. Don’t miss the elevator doors. Otis Elevators state of art

Truly a hidden gem in the city of Chicago. It has the most amazing spiral staircase I’ve ever seen. Chances are, you’ve seen a picture of them at some point. I haven’t done the tour, but it is on my to do list in Chicago. 

It’s hard to get in if you’re simply trying to get a look at the stairs. But if you’re inconspicuous about it, no one will say anything. If anything, sign up for the tour!

A true historic gem! This Frank Loyd Right building is a muat-see for every architecture enthusiast. You cannot simply walk into this building by yourself. If you want to be able to go up the iconic stairs, you must book the official guided tour. You can however walk into the foyer, just not up the stairs.

I wish we would have had more time on the tour to spend in this building. It was outstandingly beautiful. You walk in the front door and it's like stepping back in time. So much attention to detail. My husband and I were both absolutely Blown Away. Definitely intend on going back next time we're in Chicago sightseeing. A must-visit for any trip if you love architecture and beauty

Due to a mix up on my part with my landlord my water was shut off yesterday due to the land lord ending service. As a pet owner with two large dogs and a cat as well as a roommate I needed the water back on quickly. I went in, signed up and explained the situation and within 3 hours my water was back on. I realize this is definitely not the norm as far as turnaround time and truly appreciate the extra mile these folks went to help me.

While I do understand that sometimes water outages happen, my whole neighborhood has been without water over 17 hours (and counting!) with no explanation and no update as to how long it would take to fix.  There was no natural disaster or major reason why our water should be out this long.  Living without water in your house is a major deal and some update should be given to customers.  I asked to speak to the manager after I got no update from the customer service rep, but she said that because I wasn't the primary account holder (I rent), I wasn't able to.  So that's why I'm leaving a review.  Aqua Texas, you really need to change your policies and better serve your customers.

I had three of their pipes deteriorate and leak in my backyard. I had to spend several hours waiting for the contractors they hired to come and repair the pipes all three times and they left my yard lob sided from the dirt they didn't level.

I called Aqua regarding a water leak on their main, near my neighbors house. I first noticed the leak almost four months ago. I finally caught the neighbor at home about two months ago and they said it had been reported. Aqua sent someone out to paint a blue mark indicating where the leak is at. This leak is still ongoing, possibly contaminating the community water supply. The response from the Aqua emergency phone number was "Sir, you'll have to call back Monday after 9:00". Called back only to hear them say there was no report of a leak at the address, and there was no such address on Lakeridge  Loop. Tried to help this neighbor, but sorry, they're on their own now. It may get fixed after a meter reader falls through a sink hole caused by the leak.
If I could give them zero stars, I would. I was on hold for a supervisor for over 20 minutes and still never spoke to one. Worst customer service!

I'm trying to book a room here, anybody know how much a suite costs for 4 nights?
The hotel has a prime location, and a wonderful view of the rest of the city. I have waved at the guests playing basketball on the rooftop court, and they wave at me back! Very glad this hotel installs chainlink fences on the rooftop so nobody loses their basketballs or falls off the side of the building. Would love to stay here for an upcoming vacation!

This place does a good job keeping the criminals away
Sick rooftop views
Why are their reviews for a prison

A massive and beautiful park area in the heart of the Chicago Loop. A good place to park is the Grant Park North Garage, which you enter at 25 Michigan Avenue. Grant Park lies in between Michigan Avenue and Lake Shore Drive/Lake Michigan. The area is huge, and there’s plenty to explore within the park and in the surrounding downtown area. The park is also home to many Chicago festivals, including Lollapalooza. If you’re in Chicago, Grant Park is a must-visit.

Wonderful place to visit, whether you're a local or a visitor. In the summer there a lot of flowers and grassy sections to sit on, enjoy the day and people watch. There's always some kind of event going on, whether its Taste of Chicago or Blues Fest. Visit Buckingham Fountain and take a stroll along the lake.
It was very relaxing. I felt safe at dusk here. The view was amazing.

Grant park is the one of the coolest, most underrated attractions, especially if you have kids. There's like a dozen playgrounds, no exaggeration, and they are really freaking awesome playgrounds, some with water, made for different age groups. Between those and the gardens we were in heaven. So much to discover :)

Must go park if you are in Chicago, very ideal place for a walk and Running. It has a good and well maintained park for kids. It is at this park where start and finish of the iconic World Marathon Major takes place. Easily accessible and wheelchair friendly. It houses the world famous millennium cloud and fountain.

It is at this park where start and finish of the iconic World Marathon Major takes place. Easily accessible and wheelchair friendly. It houses the world famous millennium cloud and fountain.
Consistent and good food. Big menu and lots of healthy options. Great service & prices too.

Place was empty and waitress was still super slow.  Food was mediocre.  Waitress wanted to cut us off after only 2 drinks.  Was with my family of 6 people and they tried to add gratuity to the bill already.  Would not recommend.

I ate here for breakfast and it has a nice Chicago counter service feel, which I appreciate when traveling alone.  Everything was good, service was good, food was good. Prices are on par with other places I’ve eaten at in Chicago.  It was a way better experience than eating at a chain or just getting something quick.  Also, there seems to be a mystery challenge in finding the rest room in the place, because everyone had trouble finding it while I was there.
One of my favorite breakfast spots in Chicago. Excellent food, friendly service, good coffee and fun location to watch people go by!
We've had breakfast here a couple of times, and everything has been quite tasty. The side I ordered got missed initially, but that was sorted out with no fuss.
Always so delicious. It’s at the O’Hare airport so I always get it there but the locations downtown are great. They just came out with some drizzled in chocolate too 🤯😍
Fantastic popcorn! Very fresh and quick customer service. Good selection. We love the nut caramel crisp and Garret mixes. It's a little expensive but totally worth it
THE BEST you can get. The special Hot Cocoa mix they had for the holiday season was great. The Carmel corn is fantastic all year long !
The workers get the line moving quickly and the popcorn is still hot when they give it to you in the bag.
Best popcorn ever. I have it sent to my house at least three times a year if you ever get a chance to try it, do!!! they have it in Vegas now!!!

this place is great! the food is fresh and tasty. Portions are good and the staff is pleasant. It is busy at lunch during the week so plan accordingly. The Chicago Federal Reserve is just a short walk and offers free tours (currently in the afternoon). Sky deck is also close by Luke's. plenty to do to make this a great Chicago experience!

Really good food! The quality and the flavor of the food here is excellent and also organic so they come from good sources. Our server Angel was super cool, very friendly and very knowledgeable about the food and menu. Definitely recommend it if your in the area and you want some good burgers and nice service!

Incredibly good food, big portions, and always packed. The front counters confuse people- there are 2. Either will take your order for anything on the menu. If you can get a table, grab it! Chicken sandwiches were great, excellent chicken parmesan, beef sandwiches, and pasta. Marinara is delicious.
Best Italian Beef in Chicago. Everything I've ever ordered from here has been amazing. If you're thinking about going here, stop thinking and just go. You will not be disappointed.
Good spot to get a Chicago Dog after doing the Sky Tour at Willis Tower.  Lots of seats and good food at a good price.

These cats are the bomb!  I've run a number of Chinese visa requests through them and every transaction has been timely and flawless.  If you need visa services from one of the Chicago consulates, this the place to go!

The restaurant located inside hilton garden inn. The place is small and cozy. We ordered 2 deep dish pizzas. Unfortunately,  our waiter screwed up on our order. Instead of spicy chicken and mushroom, he ended up getting us mushroom pizza. He did bring us grilled chicken on the side instead. Both pizzas were delicious. We had to wait 25 minutes for the pizza. I had to pour my own water since I cannot find our waiter.  The food were great but service needed some improvement.

I ate here twice in two days. Both times the staff were friendly and the service was good. The first night I ordered a large thin crust sausage and pepperoni. The pizza was good but not great, I would give that pizza a seven. However the next day a local Uber driver suggested we try the signature deep dish. 

So on day two I returned and ordered a Bacinos specialty deep dish and boy am i glad I did! The deep dish pizza was amazing! The best deep dish pizza I have ever had! Ten out of ten!

If you go here, order the deep dish! You wont be disappointed!
We had a supreme pizza and Mediterranean salad. Both were excellent and they had some cool beers. Definitely recommend giving this place a try. Can't wait for downtown to get more vibrant.
I had a thin crust pepperoni delivered to my hotel. It came quickly and was piping hot. Spectacular pie!

REALLY good pizza!  My coworkers and I ordered 4 different kinds and we enjoyed them all.  Our waitress was really friendly.  I would have given 5/5 but we waited an extremely long time to eat and, after asking where our waitress went, they said they had sent her on a delivery in the middle of waiting on us.  I still would come back.

Beautiful old-school decor, wonderful staff, great menu. Monday Night Live is not to be missed! The "theatre menu" is a satisfying 3 course meal at a great price. Gotta have a "Windy City Martini", too!

Food is good, a little pricey. I have been in the restaurant once a while ago. I was at one of the banquet rooms in the basement last time I was there. It has an old clubby feel which is nice. Drinks are good and the service is good too. I might go back but it is not high on my list just because I prefer smaller places.

What you are seeing here is their mushroom soup, teriyaki glazed salmon and their jumbo shrimp cocktail. Let me tell you it was DELICIOUS!!! I recommend this place to anyone who wants authentic Italian and such an elegant environment. The service was excellent and the seating was immediate although I think evenings could have a wait due to its delicious menu. Wish I could of had dessert, but couldn't really fill it in. 10/10

Beautiful old-school decor, wonderful staff, great menu. Monday Night Live is not to be missed! The "theatre menu" is a satisfying 3 course meal at a great price. Gotta have a "Windy City Martini", too!

Didn't have reservations so we sat in the bar. Had play tickets for 7:30  and sat down at 6.. They got us in and out but  we didn't have time for  dessert before the play. The waiter told us to come back after the play .  It was perfect. The Waiter didn't bring our meals out at the same time so he didn't charge is for our drinks.  The dinner was so delicious.  The waiter suggested the white fish.  It was really good. It was so convenient to valet parking the car ,eat dinner, go to the play, come back eat dessert and then get the car. Will be doing that again.

I must tell you first and foremost, that if there's a Chesterfield chair there I plan to go get it let alone almost full deck of world book encyclopedias! On the serious side this food is perfect! Everything tastes real. Also I want to let everyone know the service is impeccable the charm is perfect here. I cannot wait to bring my friends, my parents, and my children back here on multiple occasions. I met the current owner and his name is Kenny. Make sure you are give Kenny and the rest of the staff a hug for maintaining a family Legacy.

Ronny's is just the best you're going to find downtown for good food at a ridiculously great price. My dad took me to Ronny's when I was a kid and, 45 years later, I still stop in for a bite from time to time. Yesterday, my daughter and I got the #5 (10 oz steak cooked to order, huge baked potato, and garlic bread) and, as usual, we loved it!

I've been going to Ronnie's steak house for 20 years and they're probably the only establishment that hasn't changed their menus or meal sizes in the entire time.   The prices are the best you're gonna get downtown chicago and the amount of food you get for the price is definitely a plus.   The taste is great!  Parking may be the only issue unless you don't mind meters but if you're in the area it's a must stop.

I love going here. I have yet to be disappointed! I love there lemonade drinks, the steaks are awesome! When the live band is playing it's an even better atmosphere! The Mac and cheese is A1. I enjoy going here. Red line train takes me straight there. If u haven't tried it, try it!
I didn't eat my meal until the day after I got it it was very good as always. I love how the chef prepared my steak. 😍😁😍😁

Came here because of recommendation by Chicago Architecture Center tour guide. It really is a lovely restaurant. 

The food has great visual appeal. I ordered the carrot soup which was great. The eggplant garbanzo bean dish ... I love eggplant - not so much in this dish - very chewy/tough. Maybe it was an off day?  Maybe it is just me. The beans though, they were really, really good. I'm not a big garbanzo bean fan, but these were GREAT. 

I did order the sorbet. I had just read that this place has best ice cream in the Loop. They also offered pumpkin spice ice cream. (I hate pumpkin spice and wish the obsession would die NOW.) Anyway, the mango sorbet was good, presentation was GREAT. 

Staff is great. Service was terrific. The waiter and assistants were very attentive. Hostess was very welcoming and helpful.
A little pricey for the food and drink.  Atmosphere is very nice and service was above average. The people watching on State Street isn't what it used to be, eh?

I had two drinks at this location and I ordered the salmon. I enjoyed myself the bartender was really nice. It wasn't crowded so I was able to have a nice catch up conversation with one of my girlfriends it's a nice chill restaurant on a Sunday evening.

I can only comment on their drinks and service as we didn't have enough time to eat there.
The service was excellent. The mixed drinks were delicious. I went with the whiskey sour and the old fashioned, both very well made. My wife had the paper plane which was equally as nice. 
Will definitely be back when we're back in the loop.
The food was wonderful and the service was great! My boyfriend had the smoked salmon benedict and I have the egg white omelet. We'll definitely be back!

I was very impressed with the restaurant. The service was good and the food was good. Some of the items are a little pricey, but it is worth it in regards to the quality of food you get. I was most impressed with the Napoleon dessert. Honestly it is the best version of the dessert I've ever had.

Russian Tea Time gives the best service and value. Everything is made fresh and comes quickly (as they know people come for tea services, so they are constantly making tea service trays). They have food accommodations for different dietary restrictions. They give you a tea pot with the tea leaves in it and refill the hot water so you always have tea. If you get the house blend, you get a cool glass and metal cup with unlimited Black Currant tea! The food is very delicious and plentiful.

I had an extra day in Chicago, so I wanted to find sometime unique. I’ve always loved Russian food, and even traveled there in the past. I was very impressed with the food, drink, and dessert, and the staff. I’ll definitely make it a point to stop here next time I’m in Chicago.
Lovely reasonably authentic Russian and Uzbek dishes. They were very accommodating to our large group. For a taste of something different - do give them a try.

We came too early for high tea so instead tried the family tea platter for 2. There is definitely enough for the 3 of us that shared it! This was fun to try as none of us had really had Russian food before. The things we never would have ordered on it’s own... like the stuffed cabbage rolls were our absolute favorite. Our waitress was super helpful in telling us what everything on the plates were and even suggested their homemade dessert, the Napoleon Bonaparte. Fabulous choice for a new experience in the Windy City!!!
The atmosphere is good.  The staff is excellent.  The food is amazing.  Make sure you visit 3 times so you can try each of the other restaurants in the building.
A beautiful, older restaurant that has lost none of its charm. The food is exquisite. It's a good place to sit down, leave time to enjoy the meal and the company you're sharing it with.

Good friendly service. I checked this place out before Hamilton .the staff knew the times, food was very fresh and filling despite the other comments that portions are small. The quality of the food fills you up-went with the three course theater menu- I highly recommend it. Our serverss name was Heather. She was on point.
Pricey for Italian but very good.  Very convenient when heading to the CIBC Theater.
Great way to start our birthday weekend in Chicago. Excellent food and service!

An interesting museum with a lovely collection of Tiffany glass. There are guided tours, but I chose to wander around on my own. Each room you go in has stunning features, and the more you look, the more you see. It's a beautiful house.

Architects/Artists/Historians rejoice! This place is absolutely stunning. One of a kind. I am serious when I say DO THE GUIDED TOUR, it’s so worth it and you’ll learn a lot! Carl was our tour guide and he really knew his stuff! My husband and I will be back for certain!

Very cool place. If your interested in historical architecture this is a really neat place to see. It also has lots of Driehaus's personal collection throughout. The guided tour was nice and the girl was very passionate and knowledgeable about the history at the museum.
Astonishingly beautiful house in the middle of Chicago. It's a must visit if your in the city. Incredible glass tiles and glass ceilings everywhere. Don't miss the venerable in the men's toilette.

I was thinking it'd be more like the Molly Brown House in Denver but grander, so I admit it was a little underwhelming. However, the story of how Driehaus came in and gave so much to the restoration to preserve a sense of the time and the effort clearly given to the task is astounding. Loved the art, loved the tour's highlights of the house's architectural details, and loved the Gilded Age portraiture on display. If you're not into stuff like John Singer Sargent though, not sure if you'll have a great time.

Equally as impressive as the Sears tower, this gigantic building has impressive views of downtown Chicago and the Lakes.  I visited here the same day I visited the Sears tower when I was in Chicago. I had nothing better to do so I thought I would check out the views from both these buildings. The elevator ride was quick and fast. I was alone and had a great time as I pondered over downtown Chicago. It was cold and windy. Which ever skyscraper you climb in Chicago, the views will be good. I recommend day time over night time.

What a view! It's truly 360°Chicago. The lift took about 45 seconds and did not feel bad at all, only ears went locked few times. The best time to go is in a clear sunny day or evening, you can see miles and miles away. Some of us also tried the Tilt, very exiting... You can also take a glass of wine or bear or a cup of coffee in the 94th floor. And you can by photos of yourself if you want to.

I love the 360 at the John Hancock, and to be honest I think the view here is a lot better than the one at the Sears tower. The building is right next to the lake and you can see Chicago from a different perspective. 

The tilt ride is not that exciting, I did it once and found it kinda lame. 

I will definitely recommend going up before sunset you will love it !!!

Outstanding place for a chill out session with a fantastic drink in your hand. While you sip on your drink, you can enjoy unforgettable views of Chicago than are just spectacular. The experience is a bit costly but worth every penny. If you get hungry, there is a luxurious restaurant on the floor just below.

I loved visiting the John Hancock Center observatory. There are great views of the city, and it was fun to read about the construction and history of the building. I highly recommend getting a City Pass and using that to avoid the lines - we were up in the sky in 15 minutes, while others in line waited 1 to 2 hours.
This small museum is easy to miss, but it is worth to go. Entrance is free. Exhibition was about religious art from Europe: Italy, France etc., paintings, sculptures and so one
Charming albeit limited collection.
Went in March 2017 and it was soo fun. The exhibits were fascinating ranging from  simple to modern to historic. 🖒

I enjoyed  an unhurried viewing here of what I call art portraying the human condition. A good example was the photographic exhibit of Pigeon Hill.  A photographic portrayal with an accompanying  biography  of how challenged people overcame or did not overcome the adversity of their circumstances.  If you are looking for priceless works of art and a traditional museum layout by period, this is not it.  Admission is free.
Their Renaissance paints are not many but high-quality. Free parking on the back street.

Do not miss the Museum of Contemporary Art in Bangkok! Not only is it a wonderful museum it is also a stunning piece of modern architecture. You'll need all day and then some more, a dream for any art buff there's five floors of spectacular exhibits. On the ground floor there's a restaurant, garden and an interactive experience. Take the family.  I loved it and next time I'm in Bangkok I'll be heading back for another look.👍🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

The Museum of Contemporary Art is from 2012. It is a private museum housed in a large building. 

There is no double pricing. Same price for a Thai and a foreigner. If you  are more than 60, you can enter for free. Not only Thais, but also foreigners. The price for a regular ticket is TB 250.

Obviously, most of the items on display in this museum are from Thailand, but on the fifth floor there is an interesting collection of foreign items.

Next to all items on display is a label with information in Thai and in English. 

You are allowed to use a camera inside the museum, but you cannot use a flash. There is one exception: you are not allowed to take pictures inside the special Robert Green collection on the fifth floor.

There is a coffee shop on the ground floor. There is a car park in the basement. 

The staff are friendly and helpful.

If you are interested in contemporary art, this place is definitely worth a visit.

Oh....
This is an ....hard to say.
They declare that this is a contemporary museum but this museum does not explore the comprehensive contemporary art all over the world because it’s simply this is a private museum owned by one business man.the collection is rely on his taste.of course this museum is playing a key role for collecting national artists of Thailand but mainly the collection is reflected on his preference.
I really love this spot because I can enjoy the most sophisticated art works in Bangkok.
I’ll come back here again.

Great museum. 
Beautiful building. Lots of great surrealism and some traditional Thai art. 
Definitely worth going although it's hard to get to, since the nearby train is not operational yet. Try to make sure your cab driver knows the place. Took us some time to get there but was worth it 👍👍

Surprisingly beautiful (and modern) structure that houses mostly modern and some traditional art. Peacefully quiet—not many locals seem aware it exists. The art is fascinating—a modern reinterpreting traditional Thai aesthetic forms. Lovely reprieve from the hot chaos of the city.
Great building. Unfortunately it was under renovation but, don't miss the lobby and the different stones and sculptures in the front walls. You would be surprised about the details you can find!!
Beautiful building. It's fun to inspect all the stones from famous places around the world

Miscellaneous office space leased from the remarkably ornate tower -but now I believe transitioning into residential units.  Cool concept.  Reliable meeting point for tourists and pedestrians which stops travel for quarter mile around DuSable Bridge.  The view here is remarkable.  Nobody's fault for appreciating.
Great. Wish it was retained for what it was built.... I understand it's being remodeled to house apartments. 7.3 billion & going strong..... got to house them all.

near Tribune maybe if you will be so nice to help WGN up with the sport the finals scores maybe they can get WGN back on here you don't believe me it comes on labor day with the labor day Marathon the telly

Loved it. 
Alot of excellent stores and shopping at Macy's was Great

This historic building is very important for the city of Chicago. This building is the only one, that survived Chicago's great fire in 1871. Now surrounded with chic shopping district and Magnificent Mile, it serves like a tourist destination.
Beautiful building where you can find art and learn about the city.

Really pretty we stayed near the tower for a birthday weekend in my home town chicago. I was hoping to see it at night but chicago weathee had other plans. Some issues trash on the ground and people trying to sell "school candy".
Interesting view over Chicago. One of the important must see attractions in Chicago.

One of the most remarkable art galleries in the River North! Excellent exhibition, curated by one if the most extraordinary gallerist I have ever met. Too bad that art galleries like this one is closing ... Sad face ... But thanks for the wonderful, rich, aesthetically enriching experience. Without Andrew Bae the world would be less beautiful! Thanks for bringing such wonderful artists to Chicago!
Mt go tl for Asian works. Have a colkection and they have varied artists and styles
Loved the artwork!
Neat stuff
I love the atmosphere and their art pieces. The owner Mr.Bae was very welcoming and gave us tour about their inspirations and the works. You must see it. Incredieeeble. ;)
Such a beautiful art!! And amazing paintings I have seen!! You should see them two!!!

I attended an event at this gallery and it was fantastic. The featured artist was there to discuss her work. Management was very helpful and forthcoming in discussing their venue, which has an interesting history. Highly recommended for a seasoned collector or a novice alike.
We had fun as a family.  It's a great part of Navy Pier to visit, even for adults :)
The maze was a fun way to kill some time. Doesn't take too long

I often take visiting kiddos (not recommended for little ones but 5-7+ is good since otherwise it’s a little scary...but it’s not a “scary maze” if that makes sense?) and also visiting friends in general. Kids and adults alike never figure out the mirror part right away. There’s a variety of little sections to navigate and a few super cool elements. If going with kids, I also do recommend the light rooms since even though they look lame, they lend themselves to very fast running for a couple minutes which is always good!  As an adult, I like them too because they remind me of old game shows on Nickelodeon as a kid :). 

All that said, check groupon as it is pretty pricey (like everything at Navy Pier) on its own.
Our cheer squad went here before they competed. The girls all had so much fun! Wait was not bad even though the pier was packed. Great for the kids!!!
Sooooooo much fun!!! Must try.

Absolutely love this intimate theatre.  The stage protrudes into the crowd and the seats sit around it in a U shape.  Parking is validated which is huge, and the theatre has its own parking so even if the parking garage is full you will have parking.  Dinner on the pier topped off with a mid summer nights dream was a truly wonderful evening

Excellent quality theatre. Very strong and imaginative production value for both the Shakespeare plays and the others of their season. Their facilities are well-marked, bathrooms are clean and attendants are very kind and helpful.

Package and season rates are very reasonable and their exchange program is also great if some conflict comes up. Places like this are why Chicago has such a good reputation for live theatre.
Hidden within the kitschiness of Navy Pier is this gem. I always enjoy great performances here. Will never forget the modern-day rap rendition of Othello—stunning, provocative, and entertaining.

I went to the Shakespeare Theater in Navy Pier with my school and we went to go see Macbeth. The play was great. The actor's had no microphones but i could hear them loud and clear. I also like how some of the roles were made for people not of color but African Americans play certain parts.

Fantastic theater, set up in the same style as Shakespeare had his theater set up. Watched A Midsummer Night's Dream here and it was great, the set is quite detailed and the actors are very talented. Would definitely recommend!
5 star staff.  Plesent and helpful.  Not the biggest fan of some of the prices, but found some bargains and stocked up.  E-mail deals are great at this store.

Nice clean store, huge and great selection. Was just buying bottle rockets etc for the kids for NYE. A lot of security- the guy at the entrance had a gun!! Everything is kind of expensive, but everything is BOGO- so in the end not too costly, but more than you need.
I liked this fireworks store. They are nice and have a amazing selection of fireworks. This store is way bigger than the Morrisvile store.

Great deals here everything is buy one get one free. Fair prices for what you get. The staff is very helpful and very knowledgeable on their product. You don't have to pretend to know everything when you come in here they don't treat you like an idiot.

Prices are pretty high-1star. They don't sell bricks of jumping jacks...-1 star.
People are nice and helpful :)
I'll be back when they have better promotions :)

The seats don't recline, but that's the only negative. There is one big screen and it's massive, clear, and worthy of a visit. Honestly this is the movie Plus it's located at Navy Pier so you get a good view of the city after the movie.

This theater is so much better since AMC took over. The seats are much more comfortable and there's a bit more room. Would be perfect if it had recliner seating, but you can't get everything you wish for.
Went to see the Apollo 11 IMAX film. It was awe inspiring. The detail and quality of the footage was top notch. Theatre was clean and the seats are nice.

You could literally just walk into any theater! Its a little pricey but was deff worth it. Although, i definitely didnt like that perishables were out in the open for anyone and everyone to spread their germs on. Relatively clean. Its a movie theater at the end of the day...
Saw a movie. Was great. Had a lot of fun

Equally as impressive as the Sears tower, this gigantic building has impressive views of downtown Chicago and the Lakes.  I visited here the same day I visited the Sears tower when I was in Chicago. I had nothing better to do so I thought I would check out the views from both these buildings. The elevator ride was quick and fast. I was alone and had a great time as I pondered over downtown Chicago. It was cold and windy. Which ever skyscraper you climb in Chicago, the views will be good. I recommend day time over night time.

What a view! It's truly 360°Chicago. The lift took about 45 seconds and did not feel bad at all, only ears went locked few times. The best time to go is in a clear sunny day or evening, you can see miles and miles away. Some of us also tried the Tilt, very exiting... You can also take a glass of wine or bear or a cup of coffee in the 94th floor. And you can by photos of yourself if you want to.

I love the 360 at the John Hancock, and to be honest I think the view here is a lot better than the one at the Sears tower. The building is right next to the lake and you can see Chicago from a different perspective. 

The tilt ride is not that exciting, I did it once and found it kinda lame. 

I will definitely recommend going up before sunset you will love it !!!

Outstanding place for a chill out session with a fantastic drink in your hand. While you sip on your drink, you can enjoy unforgettable views of Chicago than are just spectacular. The experience is a bit costly but worth every penny. If you get hungry, there is a luxurious restaurant on the floor just below.

I loved visiting the John Hancock Center observatory. There are great views of the city, and it was fun to read about the construction and history of the building. I highly recommend getting a City Pass and using that to avoid the lines - we were up in the sky in 15 minutes, while others in line waited 1 to 2 hours.

What a great place! I love grabbing a quick breakfast on my way through in the morning, and they're always VERY accommodating of my strange breakfast requests. And rather than upcharge me for my custom choices they charge incredibly reasonable prices. Today, the cashier charged me what I thought was a very reasonable amount! By the time I got my food she was ready with $2 and an apology for overcharging me. Holy cow. What nice folks! Buy their food; you won't regret it.

The food was AMAZING! The food was extremely fresh and came out very fast! Also great customer service! The woman who took my order was very sweet and patient. Reasonable prices. I ordered a steak n egg with swiss plus fries and cheese sauce for 11.29 including tax. :)

Apparently, Billy Goats is a big deal in Chicago. I've heard of the name, but I've never been compelled to stop in until it became a connivence.  I eat here often for lunch since it's so close to work. I really like the workers in this building very friendly and they get you in and out. I'll recommend this place.

The worst italian beef I've had in chicago.  I am a chicagoan who works nearby, I went there for lunch today,  craving an authentic beef. Nope, it looks like one, but the meat was horrible.  I should have returned it, tough meat, that seemed reheated and not cooked a long time like necessary. Still not feeling well in my stomach 5 hours later .  Will never go back, many other great options in and around the mart.
Delicious french toasts, and the workers are always fast and friendly.
Grear hole-in-the-wall kind of place. Good hot dogs. Huge servings of fries ($3). Free refills on drinks. Freaking great place altogether.
These are literally the BEST hot dogs I've ever had! The line is usually pretty long, but that's because the hot dogs are absolutely delicious, I want one now.
Quick, friendly service. Good food. Small counter space which will not allow for an eat in option  when busy.... Love the local dog pics!
Small joint that sells a good, authentic Chicago dog at a reasonable price. Service is quick, staff are very friendly, professional, and hospitable. One of my favorite spots in Chicago.

Great place a traditional tasting Chicago style hotdogs. Loved the downtown dogs. One order of fries was enough for two. Great doggie decor, very cute. Quick service. Will continue to come when we are in town
 Highly recommended!!!!

This is the fanciest McDonald's I've been to. Very airy and bright, and the team is fast and deliver your food to your table. The parking spaces and bathroom stalls are comically small, but I guess that's the price you pay for a McDonald's in the middle of downtown Chicago.

I feel like this is one of those stores that is great ... on paper, but doesn't really translate to what you want it to be in actuality.  I went here to get a frappe, just one frappe so I could check it out.  The menu ordering system was simple enough -- not sure I would call it a "street" or anything, but the kiosks were designed so that I could order what I wanted relatively quickly.  Then comes the disappointment.  

The staff here is so oblivious to what's going on.  To me it seemed like they didn't really care what was going on, they went about looking and acting busy.  My frappe was made, sat out on a counter, had melted by the time I went up to the counter to ask what was up, and she still tried to give it to me.  When I asked her for a new one, she took it behind the counter, poured it into a new cup put a dab of new whipped cream on top and handed it back to me like I wouldn't know the difference.  Just disrespectful.  And had I not walked up to ask about it, it might still be sitting there.

McDonald's gets props for thinking about sustainability (this place is not going to stop global warming or anything by a long shot, it saves about as much electricity as a one person over the course of a week) but the execution leaves a lot to be desired, even from McDonald's.

Very interesting flagship store, but I prefer the memorabilia it had here when it was the 'Rock 'n Roll McDonald's'. Supposed to be environmentally friendly and has over 1,000 solar panels on the roof. Very large inside. Other than that it's a typical McDonald's.

Beautiful new store, the sustainability of the restaurant is amazing. The design of the building is exquisite and the staff was very nice, the food was great also. Take a look around when you were there and try to spot all the different environmentally friendly designs that were incorporated into the store.

It was the most modernized McDonald's I've ever been too. You order yourself and the food is brought out to you. The service was fast and friendly. Atmosphere was great too. Lots to look at with the hanging garden and trees.
Food was deliciously good. Loved that I didn't have to deal with a cashier. Also loved the transparent screens where I got my food out of.
Hi, we mistakenly ordered pickup from different location, but wow bay graciously honored it at Gold Coast location with no extra charge. Thanks for the great service. Food was amazing too!
Really cool to see the futuristic theme. Also good tasting food.

Fast and very modern. Fully driven by technology. Fancy! Your food shows up in a clear version of amazon pickup doors....you tap twice and the door opens and you grab your food. In and out within 3 minutes! I love it!
Yum! Chicken curry bao was awesome and my kung pao was tasty. Yum! Yum!

Very disappointed.  Had reservation for months and finally went last week. It's very noisy with tables close together and no privacy. If you want to hear about the relationship issues of the girl sitting at next table,,, this is the place for you.

Also felt rushed, we ordered apps before main which was good because as soon as we ordered mains, they arrived.

Food was reasonably priced. Unfortunately I was talked out of what I wanted to order to try something different, and didn't like the chefs choice beef enchiladas.  However the shrimp and scallop crevice was delicious, and my companion enjoyed the duck.

It was a very busy environment.  Not recommended if you want to talk or have a nice relaxing meal.

Amazing place, when you can get there.

Reservations about a month in advance are not unexpected if you want a good time to eat on a weekend.

All food options we tried were amazing. Price was not too unreasonable for what we were getting ourselves into, and you can definitely leave without a huge dent in your wallet (if you're prepared to save on drinks).

My advice: get a bunch of different things and try them all. You can't go wrong with anything!

Came here with a group of 9. We were welcomed with the first step in. Food came out in a timely manner and it was delicious. I tried their coffee and “press pot coffee with cause”, it was rich and intense in flavor . The waiter was phenomenal patient, courteous, professional and they took away our dishes when we were finished. 👍🏽

Bucket list... we are from Minneapolis. Anne Casey Letourneau and I planned this weekend to come here. Excellent service and the food was exceptional.  Our server was first class too. If you are able to get here it's worth the effort.

I have wanted to go here for a long time after being a viewer of the owner's cooking show on PBS for years. Finally went, and it was well worth it. The black beans may be the best I've ever had in or out of Mexico. I don't think I could put it any better than my companion who remarked that upscale Mexican is generally not great and not worth the price. However, this place is upscale and freaking delicious and not excessively expensive. You can expect to pay about $25 per plate, and you won't leave feeling like you've overpaid.
Amazing! Really cool place, great ambiance, and beyond than tasty food. I tried the Pepito sandwich. Highly recommended. Will definitely come back for more.

mexican food, yeah, very delicious. I love this place, great food & service. Really nothing but enjoyable experiences here, I'll be back. This place has a cool design. Mood here reminds me of Colorado Springs area.

Brought my sister here for her birthday, and apart from the slightly confusing seating arrangements (you wait in line until a place is ready and then order) the food was amazing! I wish they had one of these everywhere. Food is locally sourced and freshly prepared, I had the short rib tacos which were 4 for $12, and they were fantastic! Drinks were good, only two options. A paloma and a margarita, but both were delicious! No beer for us, but some Mexican specialties were available.
Went there for breakfast.  I hand their version of avocado toast which was excellent.  My son tried the French toast with bacon which he loved.  Will definitely be going back.
Incredible place. The food is perfect. The atmosphere and staff ate excellent. You can't go wrong here.

Great service. They were able to accommodate our somewhat large party (7) without a wait, even when the restaurant was busy and calls to their competitors made it seem like we'd have to wait an hour anywhere else. Loved the pizza. The Gino's crust really is the best. There seem to be some new menu items (specialized pizzas) since I had last been to a Gino's. Everyone enjoyed their meals and the craft beers.

When in Chicago you have to have pizza, and Gino's was recommended by some people at a conference I attended. Restaurant setup and vibe were really great. Lots of drink options and different seating options inside. Pizza was good but service was slow. Overall a good place to get some Chicago pizza.

Slow service. Practically no service. Got here for lunch at 12:15 and rather quickly ordered two apps and two pizzas. Over an hour and a half later and we finally received some of the food. Will we ever get the rest? We shall see...

Edit update: Two hours in and still no pizza. We have been told the manager will come talk to us. Like the food, that hasn't happened yet. At this point we're only staying because we're curious where this is going.

Final update: The manger showed up about 2.5 hours into our time at the restaurant. He apologized for the situation though we still don't know where things fell apart. He was vague about the details. He did cover our entire tab which was the right thing to do and we appreciated it. All in all, a terrible experience but at least it only cost us time. We probably won't go here again.

We were at the right place right time to catch this comedy show.  The acts on our Thursday night were a mix.  The emcees for the night were more funny than most.  Guess we weren't the right crowd for the jokes that night.  It's open mic night after the base show and frankly the open mic comics were generally better than the base set.  The deep dish pizza was good (+1 star).

If I could give a higher rating of 5 , I would. From enter to exit everyone was super friendly. Food was delicious, even our picky 10 year old daughter loved it. We had a deep dish pizza and split it three ways. We are from Ontario and don't come to Chicago often , but would recommend this place to anyone.

This is where my folks had their 1st date in 1964. My son & I had to check it out. We loved the Chicago style deep dish pizza. The staff were so nice. Located real close to a parking garage. Worth the trip!

Best Chicago style pizza I've ever had. I recommend it to all my friends visiting the city. There is often a wait to get in and for the pizza to arrive, but it's well worth it! I recommend walking there from wherever you're staying because parking can be an issue and you'll need to walk off some of the calories you eat here.

It's kinda the godfather of deep dish pizza but although the staff is the best in the business the wine selection is very basic and the pizza just OK. I used to come here as a young adult and it was fabulous.... Now it's just coasting on the reputation. That's kind of sad to witness. 

Common guys... Get your soul back!

I’ve been at this place last night with my friends and since I‘m not the biggest pizza lover, I decided to order a normal pasta dish. Since they apparently have good pizza, I figured it would be good pasta as well. Sauce came out of a jar and soup as a side was way to salty and I wasn’t able to eat it. Service was friendly though !

When I went to visit Chicago, I’ve gone to Uno for the deep dish pizza. I came for dinner, first sat at the bar and had some pretty good beer. Small pizza with Pepperoni, Mushrooms and Onions. It was the first time to try the original deep dish pizza. The pizza and the service were all good.

West Egg Cafe is always delicious. Be prepared to wait 30min-1hr (average) for a table. It's always worth the wait. The cinnamon rolls, shrimp and grits, and banana nut bread french toast are fantastic! 
Drinks are also made top notch! 
I only wish they would consider using the NoWait app.

reviews.author_name: マーチングリーウェスリー
reviews.text:
Phenomenal tasting food. I had the smoked salmon avocado toast. It was a beautiful blend of flavors. Thinly sliced salmon that melts in your mouth. A light marinade that assaults your taste buds. All on top of perfectly ripe sliced avocado and toasted rye. 

My only complaint was the hint of sweat and body order that permeated throughout the restaurant. I became numb to it after a few minutes though. Overall wonderful a  experience.

Never disappointed. Wonderful service, wonderful food. They do give large portions, so beware. The coffee drinks are amazing! You can order while you wait. Go before 10 AM so you don't have to wait for more than 15-20 minutes.

Good atmosphere in a better part of town. The sour cream pancakes are what this place is known for. The “small stack” is very generous, although a little on the tasteless side if I’m to be completely honest. Still, the hospitality and the cafe itself is 4 stars because it’s one of the nicer cafes in Georgia. Come here for breakfast on the weekday when there are zero queues at 9-10am!

Wonderful breakfast. Staff is extremely accommodating and quick with service. I was in a rush and several people made sure I could get in and out. They were so busy and were on top of their service with me and typically people aren't so attentive when someone is in a hurry and they've got a full house. This has been the best service I have received when a restaurant is completely full. And wonderful food!!

The restaurant itself is cozy and warm. All of the pictures on the wall remind me of Satdi's restaurants in Chicago. I am told all the famous pictures are at the owner's friends and people who have eaten here. The picture over our table is one of the late and great Prince. I had the opportunity to cook for him for 2 weeks.  The lights hanging in the middle of the restaurant reminds me of our flat we had for a week in Chicago.

My husband and I have been dining at Coco Pazzo for more than 20 years.  Their service at every level is a rare combination of highly professional and personally welcoming.  Every course and every choice is exceptionally well-prepared.  Their wine choices and recommendations are outstanding.  We highly recommend Coco Pazzo as a great value for an excellent dining experience.  John & Mary Galati

Good location, less crowded. Place is right upstairs through the entrance doors. Greeted to be seated.

Seating arrangement is fine. Tables seem fairly well spaced so it does not seem crowded. There is a water table that is kind of next to some tables so some people may find that intrusive as many busboys will crowd there.

Food selection was good. Lots of pasta options. Less so on salads and appetizers. 

There is a wine menu but no drink menu.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious authentic pasta. There are a ton if Italian restaurants in Chicago and I've been to many.  Coco Pazzo is definitely in the top 10.
The papadelle in wild boar ragu was absolutely amazing!  Great service too and very nice Italian wine list.  I just wish they had half bottles for someone like me who travels a lot and dines alone...

Food was excellent. I ate way too much. Don't fill up on the salad bar or sides. They are really quick to come around with the meats. Tables are close together but we were next to a couple of nice ladies so it didn't bother us. Our waiter was super nice.

Love this place. Staff is excellent. A bit pricey... You get what you pay for. Sign up on their web site and you can receive coupons/discounts. Best steak house in Baltimore by far. A lot of variety of meats and great place to go with friends and family. I had an amazing time at Fogo. The staff is friendly, the food is amazing and it’s an all around great experience. MUST GO!!!

I love Fogo de Chão, either Baltimore or D.C. are great. You might want to take with you a list of the meat cuts so you can make sure you tried them all after your visit. In some cases, you end up eating the same cut several times and you don't get to try other cuts. Never had a cold peace of steak. Servers are awesome, salad bar is great. The best Brazilian steakhouse IMO.

Top notch, napkins down, a good time! My friend and I went to Fogo De . The experience was great! the staff was responsive, quick to meet needs, and we even got a complimentary chees cake to celebrate. Would diffidently go back to celebrate more occasions. I had an amazing time at Fogo. The staff is friendly, the food is amazing and it’s an all around great experience. MUST GO!!!

5 star food, 5 star service. The staff was amazing, quick and ready to go. The self serve bar was really good but the meats, they were all out of this world. The service manager is a great guy, he spent some time talking with the table about all the different things they had, we missed one somehow. He had it brought out to us to try. That’s service you just can’t get anywhere else. We will be going back. It’s worth the trip if you can do it. Be ready to tap out however. The meat doesn’t stop coming unless you make sure the card is on the red. The hard part is, it’s all good. You don’t want to stop.

First time in Chicago and was told this was the place to go.  I will say it didn't disappoint.  We arrived about 6pm and were seated immediately. I was surprised after the reviews I read that we got seated this quickly.  We had the pleasure of being seated with Joe.  His level of service is what you should expect at a 5-star restaurant.  His passion was on full display as he explained how the meats are procured and prepared to be that of an ethereal experience.  His passion was spot on for the meal I received.  After I ordered my meal I went to the restroom.  It was clean,  well lit and had a very pleasant attendant.  When I was through washing my hands he wished me a pleasant evening and hoped I enjoyed my first time at Gibson's. The meal came out and I was definitely impressed. We started with a wedge salad,  we got one twice baked potato that was enough for the three of us to share.  My prime rib was cooked perfectly.  After finishing we asked to see a dessert menu.  Joe put together images of food worthy of kings so we had to order the chocolate mousse, it too was worthy of kings.  I highly recommend heading to this restaurant as the cost of the meal is absolutely justified by the passion,  presentation and quality on full display the moment you walk in the door.

Made reservations on 4/3/19 for my Mom's birthday at the Downtown location and overall, I couldn't of been happier with the service I received. My brothers and I wanted to remotely pay for my parents meal and their team made it as easy as possible, even sending over the final receipt! As for the food, it was top notch as well. My Dad called it "the greatest steak he's ever had". Their service was excellent too thanks to their server Dante. Overall, it was undoubtedly a meal they will never forget. And to top it all off, the Gibson team unexpectedly sang "Happy Birthday" to my Mom as they enjoyed what was "the most amazing apple strudel" of their lives. So in summary, I would highly recommend this establishment to anyone and everyone looking for great food and service. And my thanks to all those involved with my parents meal!

Decided to go here last minute for a celebration and it did not disappoint. We walked in and were seated right away. The service was amazing and food was delicious. Ordered the chocolate cake for dessert-great decision but it's HUGE! Definitely too much for two people. Will definitely return for future dinners.

Excellent experience. Great price and delicious foods. I like on how they accommodate their customer they were friendly and helpful. It was the best place to go where you in Chicago. Thank you. I'll surely be back here again. You deserves 5 star rate and more.

So myself and 3 colleagues wanted to have a good steak and some drinks. We found this great steakhouse and a server name Joe who made our evening an awesome experience. We were shown this 5lb lobster and these beautiful cut steaks 🥩. So we shared the lobster 🦞 and the steak and a wailing good time. The meal was plentiful and we were stuffed. The atmosphere was wonderful and inviting. I had so much fun I told them I’m never going out with them again.

This intimate, sophisticated  and romantic spot is an absolute find. A perfectly creative French bistro in River North with James Beard service and food. A foodie find that is not a scene is my definition of perfection.
French food and service at this location is great. Visited on a Wednesday I think. The staff was very kind and attentive. This place has a cool atmosphere.

One of the BEST restaurants I have ever been to! From the incredibly welcoming staff, to the pleasant surprise of having a taster cup of warm mushroom soup immediately brought to our table (it was to die for), to the perfectly complimentary dishes, the amazing wine, and just when we thought we couldn’t eat any more, they couldn’t let us leave without bringing a tiny taster from their award-winning pastry chef before we left (best two bites of dessert I have ever had!). We traveled up to Chicago for the very first time to get a taste of their food scene- this was our first stop and we were completely blown away! Keep up the good work, Brindille!
Terrific place for French food & wine. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. Noise level was a bit loud for conversation, but we had a wonderful time. Highly recommend.
We came in for drinks and the bartender was really friendly and made us feel welcome. Very knowledgeable about the drinks, definitely will be coming back.

Came in late on a Friday night after a long day of travel and was so excited that they could accommodate us.  We had the beet salad, truffle risotto, and a roasted squash dish (these descriptions do not do the dishes justice).  Selection of Italian wines was perfect.  I wouldn't have expected anything less from a Top Chef winner, but it was a delightful meal nonetheless. So happy we came.

I must say that my wife and I had possibly the best meal we have ever had tonight. The staff was very knowledgeable and caring. Compliments to everyone. Chef Brian came out and spoke with us a couple times. He really seemed happy to be there and was able to answer any questions we had on the spot. I truly recommend coming here for special occasions. We will return one day!
Only been to the bar, but service is fantastic and they make great drinks. Patrick is awesome. Also have tried a dessert which was over the top good!

What a wonderful place in Chicago
I chosed this place to propose and I couldn't been happier that I have chosen Spiaggia. Everything was perfect, the food was extraordinary! But also the wonderful service and kindness from all the employees made this night so special for us. 
Thank you !!!

Brilliant-: refined cuisine, elegant room and a wonderful combination of warmth and professional service. Sitting ar the bar is great fun if you enjoy conversing with the talented bartenders. Much to learn from these gems!  All meals beautifully plated and sublime .

Very interesting Place! I have been on July and I spent about three hours inside. Maybe more. 
Shows are good. Live experiences are fun. Perfect way to visual things we can Imagine only.
A very good position to take a look at the city from the lake.
I recommend it . 
Alessandra from Rome

The Adler Planetarium is a beautiful public museum dedicated to the study of astronomy and astrophysics. It is located on the northeast tip of Northerly Island, and offers one of the best possible views of the entire Chicago skyline. Adler offers a wide variety of events throughout the year. My personal favorite is “Adler After Dark”, a monthly event with a different theme each month (for example, Across the Universe was a great event with a Beatles theme).

I learned a lot! We took our three year old and she was less than impressed. They have a lot of buttons to push but not very much hand on other than that. We loved the shows! That was my kiddo’s favorite part, and the staff were great. The whole place is set up like a maze though, the bathrooms seem difficult to get to and I was always running into a fork and not knowing which path to take or how to get back after.

The Planetarium is a bit bigger than I was expecting and it was more interesting than I was anticipating after reading some other reviews. I think it is definitely a great place both for children and adults. The adults who left reviews saying it's not a good place for adults, don't really care to learn and aren't open minded about space and our universe. My husband and I found it interesting and a good way to spend some time together and be out of the house and to learn more. We spent about 3-4 hours here. I had the Chicago Go Explorer Pass through Groupon and 2 shows and the old planetarium exhibit was included in our ticket. Pretty good deal and definitely worth it for that reduced price. Not sure I would have wanted to spend the full price of admission plus extra for the shows. The Cosmic show was better than the Night Sky one. If you have been to any of the NASA locations (we had gone to the one in Galveston), it can be a bit repetitive, but they do have some interesting additional things to look at and learn about. Also -- we had lunch at their cafe which has limited hours, so keep that in mind, it was quite overpriced (expected but still annoying) and they didn't have some of what we wanted. The food itself was NOT worth the price, so if you can eat elsewhere, then do so. Overall, good way to spend some time out.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with it. My 5 year old had a blast. Only 4 stars because if you have limited time the Aquarium and museum are much better. I’ve been to the aquarium with him several times and he always asks to go back. He won’t ask to go back here...

I really enjoyed this Aquarium. It was very easy to navigate and had wide hallways. I highly recommend buying you tickets ahead of time to avoid the line at the door. The exhibits were beautiful and well maintained. If you are looking for an experience without all the kids, look into their 21 plus nights. I hear it is amazing!

I loved it. It's the best place to go to for Spring break! The dolphins were amazing and gorgeous to watch. The seal was funny and very cute. All the dishes were interesting to see and read about. I Love it there!! I do wish we could touch or get an up close encounter with a dolphin though.

We traveled from Wisconsin and we loved it. The Employees were very kind and helpful. It was clean and lots to see. I recommend getting tickets for the dolphin show first thing. Could have had some more food options for the kids. But my daughter loved the hot dogs. We had a great time.

Four stars only because this place is a bit pricey when you consider that parking comes at a premium! However, my daughter and wife loved this place. So for that reason this place gets 4 out of 5 stars. The exhibits we're phenomenal! There is lots to see! Three hours was no where near enough! You also get free tickets to a water show and active military get in free!!! Good stuff!!! So although a bit on the expensive side especially for a family of 4 it's still good to go and check out.

Went for the second time since I was very little. It was beautiful! Tons to see. Seems like endless fish (and more) everywhere. Very clean atmosphere and the fish were amazing. It was a long day... not just a place to quick run through so I should have worn more comfortable shoes. I would go again and spend more time just watching.
The tours are $15 and are definitely worth it. The house is beautiful and the rooms have items that were originally there. If you want a piece of Chicago history you need to check this out!
Great knowledge staff, amazing building and back story. I went in a special to hour tour which showed more than the regular tour... Worth the money and getting up early in a Saturday.

Very Interesting house museum with major historical significance. The tour is quite interesting and tour guide is very well prepared. They have free tours on Wednesdays and the did this free tour despite the fact, that only two people arrived at tour time.

House is definitely different than most of the houses from that time period. 
Tour guide was great 
Only negative is parking
We enjoyed the tour. We went during the week and was a very all group. Very interesting and thorough tour.  Very nice property.  Staff are great.

This place took our breath away.  Being a military family, seeing the photos and paintings brought tears to my eyes. We were sad to find out that the dog tags display is NOT at this place, but at a library in downtown Chicago. Otherwise, this was such a great place to visit and look around.
Great place.  massive support to veterans

When you go there, remember it is about veterans working through their life experiences. I found it a great exhibit and the staff on site were very nice people to talk to. They have events at this museum, I would recommend of you have a chance to attend one and show your support for these men and women whom have given you the freedom.
There is a lot of variety here. My daughter and I learned a lot and really enjoyed our visit. They put up new exhibits up every six months so we will be back.

Just left after bringing a group of high school students from my War Literature class. Brandon and Andy were knowledgeable, friendly, and a pleasure to work with. We were also able to hear from Maurice, a Vietnam Veteran. This was a very meaningful experience and I can't wait to bring another group of students. I wish they had more space to display all of their artwork.

The church is gorgeous and the congregation is very very kind. Greta, the church's wedding coordinator, is extremely professional and *really* knows what she is doing! I'm disappointed to leave a less  than stellar review for a church,  however the minister - Cress Darwin - seems to have his head in the clouds and really drags the place down.

My (now) wife and I started attending in the summer of 2018, and discovered Cress was "on a summer break" and there were guest ministers filling his place. I had just proposed to my wife, and we were looking for a place for our ceremony and 2NDPC seemed to fit the bill. After Cress got back, we watched one or two of his sermons before we signed the paperwork, but gradually became more disenchanted with him.

When it came time for our first marriage counseling, he tried swapping our meeting time on us by email just an hour before we were scheduled to meet, and we had already made the drive downtown. He didn't wait for confirmation that the new time would work for us, he just didn't show. When he finally arrived, he seemed to have no idea who we were, despite having previously talked with him numerous times by name, and had no idea what we were there for. When he finally got settled, his excuse for being late was that he was "out at the stables riding horses with his daughter since she is home from boarding school." None of that seemed very minister-ly to us. The marriage counseling itself was very aggressive, and was not conducive to communication as he continued to make not-so-subtle hints as to how much money he and his family had/came from (apparently his daughters are "sick of Paris" because they've been there so many times already). 

When the 1 month mark hit for us to get married, we got a surprise email from Cress stating he was bailing on our wedding, and had arranged for a replacement for us. We were initially caught off guard, but eventually got over it and wound up liking the stand-in more than Cress, so it was a blessing in disguise.

I'm not sure if he blew us off because our attendance began to wane as time went on - a direct product of my work schedule with the Navy being very inflexible and covering over service hours. Overall, we never established the kind of connection we were hoping to over the 6ish months we attended before our wedding.
Was not able to go inside or attend a service but the graveyard was open and was very beautiful and peaceful. The adjacent park is a nice shady spot to rest.
A lovely, welcoming house of God.

The Second Presbyterian Church in downtown Charleston is a historic site in the wraggbrough neighborhood. Reverend Cress Darwin is a excellent example of a true Charlestonion. Very active in the community
Wonderful place for weddings. And they have great church services on Sunday's
This is a beautiful piece of architecture and there is a historic graveyard behind it.

This is chess production studio.  Its almost still in its original shape.  Home of the blues.  Lots of famous artists recorded here and they still do record here.  Its said that when the architect built the studio, the walls werenot quite square producing a ine of a kind sound that you cant find anywhere else.  The money you pay to tour here goes back into the community.

A wealth of history, memorabilia and information about the Chicago Blues scene and Chess Records. Close to the Cermak Green Line and extremely affordable for the information, access, and history you will learn,see, and hear. Great, friendly, knowledgeable staff. Wonderful gift shop.
