If you are lover of music from the 60’s and 70’s the Blues Heaven Foundation tour of Chess Records is a must. A “ring doorbell” for tour greets you at this unexpected location. While they have scheduled tour times, they welcomed my daughter and me in between tours.

It was really cool to stand in the spot that the Stones and many blues artists performed.

Interesting place to visit. It is a working educational facility that offers insight and advice for those interested in going into the recording/music business.
Also museum of Chess Studios with lots of artifacts on display.
Do partake in the tour, otherwise it would be a lost opportunity to gain insight and info.
Free concerts provided next door in garden on certain days.
Lots of history and mojo.
Tried to go today, 12/28. Website said tue were open but got there and they were closed.
Beautiful place to live amazing down town view
very nice apartments and great views
Epic venue! Awesome view of the city! Great for enjoying live music!
Beautiful view of the city, and a good place to see a concert, as long as it's nice outside.

A wonderful place to walk or bike. The tranquility makes you feel like you are in the middle of nowhere though you can see the beautiful skyline of Chicago in the distant.  The city is restoring the place to its original prairie habitat. It used to be an airfield which was used by executives of downtown companies and one night the mayor had it bulldozed. 

In the summer all the prairie wild flowers are blooming.  Birds and butterflies are attracted to the place. The trail connects with the bike trail which goes up and down the lake front.
Love Northerly Island! Great place to see a show!
Forget about observation decks, this might have the most beautiful view of Chicago :) and it's free!

The first through third time I was there I got the meatball sub. I'd probably have to go there a dozen more times before I'll try anything else because I loved it so much. Everything looks good but I can't help it - The meatball subs are incredibly fresh with a unique, incredible taste-profile I can't explain. I smother them with extra marinara. I wish they had a bigger selection of beverages but appreciate their classic Italian deli market feel. Being in Chicago there is limited space, so if they're busy you may find yourself stuffing your face walking down the sidewalk, but well worth it!

One of our favorite parts about being in the South Loop is Panozzo's.  The owners are so personable and friendly - and make us feel welcome every time we are there.  The food is fantastic.  We love to get a few different sandwiches to share.  An all-time favorite is the meatball sub.  And we love the italian as well.  We are lucky to have this place in the South Loop.

Panozzo's is an awesome neighborhood market in the South Loop that really cares about where their food is sourced from.  With some authentic Italian dishes, it's really great for lunch!

Also, make sure you get into one of their dinner events!  The chef used to work for Alinea, so you will be surprised with the flavors and presentations!

Service:  There is normally a line, but it's worth the wait!

Ambience:  It's very casual and friendly!

Food:  Definitely get the porkette sandwich if they have it!  And the freshly made mozzarella with olive oil and sea salt!
My wife and I dropped in for lunch, good was great and service was better.  The staff helped us plan out the rest of our trip!  Thanks guys!

Panozzo's has wonderful selection of prepared Italian specialties.   There are sandwiches, salads, and soups on the menu, as well as prepared items to go.  The porchetta is fantastic, as were the other sammies and soup we tried.   
Definitely some of the best pork specialties I have ever had.    Seating is limited, but if it's a nice day you can grab something to go for a picnic.   Worth a stop in the south loop.

Amazing chicken sandwich, sweet potato fries, and their burgers aren't bad either. Haven't tried much but what I have it's really, really good. And don't be fooled by the name, they actually have a lot of seating. It's a fair sized restaurant with a lot of sports memorabilia.
Good prices, sports diner atmosphere, and really good food. The grilled chicken taste very fresh and they have good healthy options.

You know you love a place when you haven't had it in awhile but you're up at 1230 a.m. thinking about it! 
Been going here on and off for over 20 years. Great food, not expensive at all. Real friendly staff. Wide variety on the menu.Cool place and nice atmosphere in Printers Row. 
Can't wait to go back again!
The Cajun chicken sandwich is the best
Willis gives it Thumbs Up.

I had been looking forward to trying this place out for some time now. After waiting about 35-40 min to be seated (which is no problem) my friend and I sat and perused the menu. We really wanted to try some pancakes but were unsure if we would have room so ordered our normal savory fair first. My eggs Benedict was very delicious..that’s for sure. After finishing our plates we saw the table next to us receive a single pretzel pancake and we decided we had to try it. We asked the waitress for one and she replied that she thought there was an hour wait and needed to check if we could order that. My friend and I looked at each other with confusion. When she returned to the table she stated...”actually it’s an hour and a half wait and the kitchen is behind so I will not be able to put that in for you.”

It was the weirdest thing that ever happened. To be a customer in a restaurant...seated at a table and be denied something for any reason other than the ingredients being unavailable was insane. Wait aside, guests should always be served. 

One star because the eggs Benedict was good. 
I certainly will not return.

Excellent food and service! Prices commensurate with quality and quantity. Very loud like many places so it's not a place for quiet conversation. First time diner, will definitely go back!
P. S. Excellent chorizo!

After getting brunch here multiple times, I have yet to be even remotely disappointed. The food is absolutely delicious and priced very fairly (especially for being in the heart of Wicker Park). Be aware that there is most always a wait during brunch hours. The wait is 100% worth it. If you have a sweet tooth I highly recommend the White Chocolate and Caramel Pretzel Pancakes!

Honestly i think this place doesn’t get enough attention like it should. I love sweets. I’m a huge fan of the red velvet pancakes but i get undecided with the pretzel pancake. HOW DID THEY DO IT? It’s small, cozy. And great for a breakfast date. mimosas are perfect. Try them out and don’t forget to ask for the breakfast potatoes and cheese please!

Reliably consistent & delicious - sweet or savory, but I think their sweet items are significantly better than anywhere else. Multiple different drink options. Recommend the potatoes with white cheddar as a side & any pancake with their homemade sauces 😍 their chorizo is very rich in flavor
Loved the lighting. My pet-peeve is harsh lights. Large vegan menu= cool! Good chips! Fast service. Good guacamole.

La Cantina is a very low key boutique style restaurant with an upclose dining experience. Great drinks and specials, ask for Lady Lin to make your margaritas. The prices are well worth the visit and tipping.. Plan a visit soon.. Peace
The food was delicious, good proportions and accommodating to food allergies. It looked very nice inside too kind of like a fancy mexican place but with good prices. I recommend coming here
The food and service here is EXCELLENT! It was actually really busy on the last Thursday night I was in--makes sense, the food is so good--but something to be aware of. Get the chimichanga!

I really like the food here. Love the Chimichangas! It's a good atmosphere, but it is way to small inside. I would come more often but the confined feeling in the dining room is an issue for me. If you are in the aisles seat, your chair constantly gets bumped.  It's a squeeze by aisle, not a walk through.

While the space is amazing decorated and an South loop.... friend and attentive staff and there's never a wait... but in my opinion the sushi is less than desirable. For 12 you expect $12-14 worth of sushi. We received rolls that had more rice that other ingredients... the salmon and other ingredients in my Popper were so small I couldn't taste them... perhaps they will reconsider quantities. I love sushi and have been here before. Maybe it was a bust for me because I went there on a Friday night at 11pm. But heck there were only 3 other tables with people so one would expect great food to go with the great service...

It’s great to have a good sushi spot on the south side. The quality of the sushi is good and the prices are reasonable. The specialty rolls are what stand out the most. The service is always friendly...though orders can sometimes take a little while to arrive. An added bonus is that it is byob (think there may be a nominal cork fee)...though it only says so in the restaurant, and not anywhere online. Another bonus is there is a free parking lot for the restaurant across the street as well.
Relaxing atmosphere. Friendly staff. And the food was excellent!

They have the best sushi in the South Loop at reasonable prices.

I strongly recommend the super white appetizer and the special tuna sashimi for the night, both of which melt in your mouth.  I also recommend the mackerel sashimi.  I do not like the seaweed appetizer, but I love the sauces that come with it.

For cooked entrees, I recommend the sea scallops (appetizer), and the Sea Bass prepared in butter; it is a little rich, but very good.  They also have a good ribeye if you prefer.

They have a nice selection of sake, which I highly recommend to go with the sushi.

The sushi chefs at the sushi bar are very friendly, and accommodate special requests if someone in your party is allergic to anything.  There is also a drink bar with a good selection of Japanese beers, sake and other liquors, but I've never ordered mixed drinks there.

Overall, it is a great sushi restaurant.

My favorite sushi spot! Their hot foods are really good as well. Always fresh, always delicious. Dark, chill environment, really good for dates. Same time it's mildly kid friendly-(they have high chairs). Love their tempura seaweed and the ginger sauce it comes with is delicious. King coast crab is 🔥🔥🔥

Atmosphere is delightful and food is excellent. The salsa is beyond compare and the chicken tacos/enchiladas are superb. Be careful with the customer service; waiters tend to ignore you or they try to rush you out with the bill. Another good food place that should focus more on customer service in order to complete the restaurant experience.

delicious food, fun ambiance, great service, this place has it all. the staff gave us knowledgeable and delectable suggestions that we couldn't have been happier with. if we could have eaten more, we would have. i hear there will be a lovely outdoor seating area when the weather warms up too. i can't wait to come back here!

We popped in here with a group of ten the other day and had a great time at the bar.  The drinks were great, service awesome and the guacamole very agreeable to all!  A nice neighborhood place with great ambiance.

Zapatista offers Mexican food with a little bit of a modern twist, but overall I found it to be fairly average. The menu was alright, but nothing seemed to stand out as something you couldn't find somewhere else. The prices were reasonable, and the food was good but not great. The atmosphere is kind of cool, but that alone doesn't make it worth the trip.

Place gets busy on the weekends in the evenings, so be sure to call ahead to make reservations. 
But the patio seating is great on  cool weekend. Last time I checked, they don't accept reservations for the patio. 

Good food.. A tad overpriced though ...

I've eaten here once, and it's a charming space with wonderful food. There wine was good and the service was friendly. It is on the expensive side. In a town loaded with good Italian, it's now always way to stand out, but Gioco is pretty special.

Was visiting the City for the night and we happen to stumble upon this restaurant. The staff are very friendly and responsive. They make sure your glass is always filled with water. The food was amazing! Definitely would come here again on my next visit to the City.

I love Gioco! Their pastas are not only great for the South Loop, but they'd stack up among the best in the city. If you like thin crust pizza, definitely try theirs out.  Very yummy.  The manager and waitstaff are really personable, too.
South Loop residents for 7 years - this is a neighborhood gem. Service has consistently been outstanding each time. Christian and Jose are the best! Fantastic food (ask for the buratta)

Gioco used to be my favorite Italian restaurant and I used to bring all my out of town visitors here. I am not sure what happened, but the quality just aren't as good as it used to. And it is not busy there anymore either. The restaurant used to always have a wait even during the week, but now it is pretty empty even on the weekends. I still really liked their risotto this time, but the pork chop was somewhat disappointing. Their wait staffs are still extremely friendly and knowledgeable though.

Nice small museum in Greek town. There are 3 floors. The 1st floor has a store and a small exhibition on the migrants arriving by boats on Greek territory with pictures of camps. Second floor shows the work of a Greek immigrant artist and was very beautiful. Third floor explains  the war of Independence and the departure of many Greeks to the United States. This exhibition was interesting but sometimes a bit confusing.

They place is huge very empty. I wish I would've seen old Greek ruins or something along the area. Parking we used some pizza joint in the corner. Some pieces were very interesting. Pictures below. Is what I found interesting.

A great reminder of our heritage and so glad they are here. Espousing all things derivative from the ancient heritage of democracy and freedom applicable to today's social and cultural issues with topical speakers and other events, Greek or not. All are welcome and a beautiful facility able to host parties and other private events. I've been a part of both sides and had great experiences all around.
Wow! We took our 5th and 6th graders on a field trip and the program was amazing! The kids analyzed mock artifacts and made ancient Greek toys.

Small museum that can be done in a matter of 2 hours that avoids standing/walking for hours on end. Exhibits constantly rotating (check website to see what exhibits are on display). Plenty of places to sit throughout the museum and there are several Greek restaurants within walking distance of the museum to eat afterwards.

One of the best high schools in state. But the price per child is astounding! Scholarship offered but you will never get a straight answer on applying for scholarship. The sports programs are ok but if you have a great athlete another catholic school may be better choice. Track, soccer, and tennis programs competitive...

Daughter graduated in June 2018, SICP provides a very solid academic foundation for college and instills in their students a sense of responsibility towards the community.  As parents we found the school to be a great investment towards our daughter's future.  BTW, many of her grammar school friends attended Jones, Whitney Young and Latin and those too are excellent schools.
Alum Class of 1998. I loved my time here!

I attended Ignatius my freshman year of highschool (2011-2012) and I have to say that I do love this school. Rigorous academic, tons of courses to choose from, dozens of clubs for students to join, the list can go on and on. The school has transitioned to being an all iPad school, and while I cannot personally speak about how it works with the school as a whole, there is generally positive feedback about the transition. Aside from that, the location of the school is also superb. Right beside Taylor street which, if you don't know, is full of a ton of Italian restaurants. It's definitely a nice experience and everyone who has ever attended this school has definitely fallen in love with it.
Cool stufff happens at tgat school
Fantastic space, I love their roster and the the Gupta editions bookstore

I brought them a poster a friend bought for me from an art museum in Mexico City. It came out great. The poster was also rolled up & wrinkled beforehand and they smoothed it out. The wide selection of wood they have is nice, I really liked the suggestion they made.
The best frame store in town. Very nice people
They now offer printing services! Up to 60" wide and 144" long. You can send them the files and they print frame and even install. The best price on printing to canvas and then stretched onto bars.
Great experience! I'm extremely happy with the quality of work, large loft print framed, delivered and installed in two weeks. Installation was perfectly done. I'll definitely be back!

I was amazed viewing some of the pieces framed at Supreme Picture Frame!!! The quality and excellent service were an extra bonus! The pricing was great and I look forward to taking future pieces there!!!!

Mr Greek Gyros has amazing food. Great prices. The staff that helped us was very nice and the cooks preparing the food were friendly and fast. The only thing is you have to find parking and pay to park which can be difficult but the food was worth it! We will be back for lunch soon!

Great service, awesome Gyros, the best ever, and the fruit is awesome too, very sweet and tasty. You know when someone gives Mr. Greek a one star, they are lying. No way in hell they would ever deserve one star. The place is awesome, the best. Sherrie Christian seems to keep giving one star reviews and returning. Sherrie must be a competitor.

ALL PRAISES TOO THE MOST HIGH GOD!!! . 
Very Good Food, And Great Service.
😔STAYING PRAYERFUL!!!
The gyros platter is the best with salad and rice. It's also enough food for 3 or 4 people.  I  always pay for a side of feta and extra pita too.
Being a foodie, I never let go of good food serving places. How could I let this one go? This is an amazing place that lets you enjoy the best food along with the highest comfort level.

Mr Greek Gyros has amazing food. Great prices. The staff that helped us was very nice and the cooks preparing the food were friendly and fast. The only thing is you have to find parking and pay to park which can be difficult but the food was worth it! We will be back for lunch soon!

Great service, awesome Gyros, the best ever, and the fruit is awesome too, very sweet and tasty. You know when someone gives Mr. Greek a one star, they are lying. No way in hell they would ever deserve one star. The place is awesome, the best. Sherrie Christian seems to keep giving one star reviews and returning. Sherrie must be a competitor.

ALL PRAISES TOO THE MOST HIGH GOD!!! . 
Very Good Food, And Great Service.
😔STAYING PRAYERFUL!!!
The gyros platter is the best with salad and rice. It's also enough food for 3 or 4 people.  I  always pay for a side of feta and extra pita too.
Being a foodie, I never let go of good food serving places. How could I let this one go? This is an amazing place that lets you enjoy the best food along with the highest comfort level.

I absolutely love this place! My favorites are the porkchop sandwich, the fish sandwich, and the polish is just WOW. Very good prices too. Most sandwiches are under $6 some under $5 and every sandwich order includes fries, which are such tasty fries. And the sport peppers they have there are the most delicious peppers i have ever had in my life! They are actually a bit spicy, which amazes me. The grilled onions they use on the sandwiches are the cherry on top. The service is super quick too. Faster than any big chain fast food restaurant! The only thing that sucks is the parking situation since its right next to the lame university but even then still 5 stars squared. I have seriously driven an hour coming from the suburbs, crossed the dangerous city traffic, just to come get this food.This place is atomic bomb!

The food is always as expected. No order ever takes too long before done. Amazing, the 100 percent beef polish with all the onion. The French fries are always great and you eat them without ketchup, long lines at night, but not in the evening. I visit with my daughter, she enjoys the polish as well.

Had a hot dog and honestly it was average but I tried a bite of my husband's polish sausage dog and it was delicious!  What makes this place stand out is there fries, in my opinion.  They come free with every sandwich you order and they are crispy and full of flavor.  I like the guys who work there too- true Chicagoans!  Overall, I'd say it was worth the trip and I'd go again if I'm ever passing through so I can try some of their other sandwiches.

Great place to get their famous "Maxwell Street Style Polish" or a pork chop sandwich. Service is quick and the prices are reasonable. They are always open. No parking lot available, but you can always find street parking. People come and go all the time.

Just the best... Greatest memories I had there were shared with my father  .. we'd go there every weekend and every weekend would  share Polish sausage with only mustard grilled onions and sport peppers it was a greatest and walk around old Jew town as it was known back in the early nineties and mid eighties at least for me when I was a young kid, and walk around and shop for tools or special buys you'd get great cheap deals... When we would get hungry we would walk down Maxwell head right to Jim's. It was the best you all must go there and share the Polish sausage with your family  and  go to Jim's original  it's the best. Thanks Jim's

We found White Palace Grill on google! We were looking for a place close to our hotel because it was raining, and this restaurant was only a block away. Great place to eat on a Monday night. The service was efficient, the place was clean and the food was good. I had a hard time deciding what to order from their extensive menu and finally decided on the Cobb Salad. I was not disappointed...it was delicious!

Good food but price was a little higher then I thought. There is little parking for the restaurant cause the lot is for other businesses. We pared on the street which you have to pay the meter. The deco is very nice like an old time diner. Our waitress was very good.

Good diner fare, no complaints here! 😀 I chose the mushroom burger w/cheese and crinkle cut fries. Then decided to indulge in the lemon cream pie for dessert... Great choice. Guy Fierre was correct, great choice for lunch and I will visit again!

This has been my first time eating at White Palace grill. The customer service was awesome and the food was good too. I thank the waitress for her smile and service. She was an example of service. She enjoys what she does.

They held out and didn't sell to the home depots of the world.  Old school diner.  Never had a bad meal and usually good to great.  Love the quality and you don't go home or to work hungry.  Great staff.  Many have been there for a decade.  Brought my kids there and they love it too.

Absolutely wonderful!!! Love the owners and atmosphere!!! Food was spectacular!! Very rarely do i go out to eat & i will definitely make it a point to eat here with my family or just me and my husband.... Thank you for a wonderful dinner!!!

This place is AMAZING. Anna has taken great care to always make it beautiful and welcoming with beautiful fresh flowers every time we have been there. She pampers us with complimentary new things to try. We always go here for special occasions and birthdays because we are never disappointed in the quality or freshness of the food. Thank you guys!!! So blessed to have you in Anacortes.
Absolutely delicious. Amazing all around, and finally found good baklava!
Had the special, Greek Ribs. AMAZING!  Excellent food, family run, authentic.
Yummy food!  Generous portions!  Friendly staff!

Absolutely wonderful place.  The staff was amazing I felt like I was their family.  The food was wonderful.  Reasonably priced meals.  Great atmosphere.  If I lived closer I would eat here again and again until I knew everyone by name.  Loved it!
Great Greek restaurant with delicious food and a small bar. I've been back several times and the service has never wavered a bit. This restaurant is truly excellent!
Good bye old pal. We'll miss you!

I was here over 10 years ago and couldn't remember the name. Today I found the receipt from Aug. 12, 2007. I've remembered about this restaurant and was hoping to find it whenever I returned to Chicago. I ordered a lamb dish and plan on ordering it again in addition to trying something else.
My favorite place to go in Greektown! George is a great waiter and I always ask for him.

I really love Conte, every ingredient they use are always fresh. Been eating here for about eighteen years. They have the best submarine sandwiches around this area. Friendly service and great prices to go along with their great tasting subs.
Well-priced. Tasty. Fair service. Not a sightly place, and parking can be difficult, but overall enjoyable.
great spot.. sandwiches, and the italian sausage and sauces to go are real good. Bonus points for the history (1966 playboy on the wall with a full feature photo of the shop)

It's an Italian grocery store, but the main attraction is their selection of made-to-order sandwiches!  Make sure to take a number at the counter when you first walk in (that's the line).  Oil on the sandwich is a good choice.
Mike and company are the best. Been going there since I was a kid. Great food....

The entire wait staff were great. Teddy, our waiter, was both humorous and informative. We ordered the pomegranate martini which was recommeded by Teddy. We also had the soup of the sea, scallops for appetizers, and a dinner salad and they were all amazing! Hats off to the chef. This was my third visit and it just gets better.
Simply amazing. Food was fresh and hot. Made my wife a meal not on there menu anymore. Staff was very friendly. We will be back with guests for sure!!!

Fantastic Italian formal restaurant in the heart of Little Italy.  The meatball appetizer is a must and don't forget to save room for dessert here!  Nice small bar as well in case you are in the mood for a few cocktails before dinner.

Beautiful, clean, serene set up!!!  Friendly staff, from the moment you walk through the door.  Everyone is Impressively knowledgeable about CULINARY ART and its CULTURE!!!

Love it, enjoying it, will recommend to friends and family,  will become a returning patron for sure!!!  Our hostess, Racheal, is super amazing - extremely personable, you feel like you're getting served like you're at your own ancestral home!!!

Sitting here, with a veteran patron since 1984.  So, it is 35 years and counting...  the first impression in my realm, and a respectfully repeating homage experience of our table of 9's head person - are blending in, complimenting perspectives of decades long experience - the flame lit in patrons meeting the fame of the patronizing - dictionary definition of the complimentary entities!!!

Visited this placed last year and I am still wanting some of that veal! This is probably the best italian that I think I've ever had ! The atmosphere of this place was that of like a scene out of the godfather in a good way! From what I can remember the staff was fantastic and very friendly! This will be one of my go to's when I am in the Windy City! 10/10 would recommend.

My husband and I had our wedding reception on the patio in July of 2018. Working with Sarah-Jane, Gord and crew was an absolute dream. She created a beautiful, thoughtful menu and wine pairings that exceeded our wildest expectations. The picturesque patio setting was out of a literal travel magazine with the cascading wisteria and gorgeous furnishings. The staff was cheerful and accommodating. The best dining experience we could have hoped for.
Amazing pizzas!!! Love their mussels! Great with our young kids!
My favourite patio in summer. The pizzas are top notch! Recommend to anyone who visits Bowen Island.

The Ambience is amazing. Went there last night with a couple of friends. They ordered salmon pizza..Pizza arrived with 
Out the salmon..Then they took back the pizza added salmon on it.. I ordered a vegetarian spaghetti qty was less for the price paid. The dish was average in taste. Moreover the waitress was not happy that I tipped her less than 10%. Don't think will visit again..
The food is amazing, especially the authentic oven baked pizza. Service was great - a lovely atmosphere. Highly recommend!

love and recommend the sausage! But please be noticed that the Sunday brunch is different from other days. So when I came here, I cannot find anything from the other reviews, which includes the foods I really want! But anyway, recommend the sausage

Awesome brunch at The Publican. I was looking for a good mix of lunch and breakfast and they hit the spot with their schnitzel. The flavors were so well put together and it was just the right amount of food to make me full but not stuffed. The coffee was also top notch. I’ve heard great things about their dinner selection and after this brunch I’ll be going back to try that as well.

Chuck e Cheese without parking.
It is as loud as Chuck e Cheese. I valet parked, which was great cause parking was scarce. 

Saturday brunch Portions were small, which is great if you're also drinking your calories along as an alcoholic beverage.

Food did taste good, thank God for that. Remember to order a side as the main entrees will leave you hungry. Check the online menu also, personally I found choices very restrictive.

Went for dinner and had an amazing time. Got the chef's selection dinner to share with 2 other people, everything was cooked and seasoned perfectly. It included plates of meats, seafood, and vegetables, along with dessert. We also ordered the chef's selection of 12 oysters, they were DELICIOUS, and fried pork skins, also DELICIOUS. Decent cocktail list, I decided to order a whiskey sour instead and was not disappointed at all. Huge beer selection. And after we were full and couldn't possibly eat another bite, without even asking, we were brought a hot mint and honey tea. Service was great the whole time, everyone who worked there was extremely nice. It was a great experience, I would definitely return!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The food is amazing.  The beer selection is second to none (and they will suggest beer pairings if you ask).  Don't be fooled by their love of swine.... while their pork offerings are plentiful and delicious, they surprisingly have some of the best seafood in the city.  It is consistently fresh and always served in new and innovative ways.  Don't forget about the pig either though.

Celebrated my oldest son birthday and my future daughter in law here so glad of choice....very good food! I had pork shoulder with grits and dish was delicious. Caramelized plantains, guacamole and fresh chips👍non alcohol drink 👍 Andrew and another male waiter were fab. The decor and vibe of Carnivals is great. I hope to go back soon.....until then I hope others enjoy too..

I liked this place with a good view overlooking the expressway. The menu has a decent variety. I had a roasted chicken dish that was good. The other guests enjoyed their food. The atmosphere is festive. I suggest accessing Carnivale's menu online to get more information on meal choices.

This restaurant has an absolutely amazing atmosphere! It's primarily a Latin themed venue, with very colorful scenery and very high ceilings. They have so many different shows and activities on different nights. They even have dance nights. It's very nice for groups or private parties. The food is good, although not amazing. Uncommon selection of desserts and chocolate bar. The main attraction is the scenery, atmosphere and music. The drinks are also good, and although not cheap, they're not over the top for the Fulton Market District. A great place to explore for a night.
Excellent food, including gluten free, and awesome drink selection. Try the flight of rum. Big place, good for groups too. Tasty quality food. Service is tops!
Excellent place to eat something when in a hurry. The customer service is quick, prices are affordable, awesome mood. I highly recommend this spot.

Always a pleasure to see the amazingly creative custom builds and outstanding service work coming out of Federal. These guys are pros. The winter motorcycle storage option they have is pretty dope too. Federal Moto is such a great asset to the Chicago motorcycle community.

PS - Pictured below is their Two Scoops build. It's awesome and for sale, or so I heard.

These guys are the best in town...from small odd job, storage, service, etc. all the way to a custom build. I worked closely with Mike to add just enough custom touches to a stock 2015 Yamaha SR400. Couldn’t be happier. And the service since has been impeccable.

Such an incredible shop with the coolest dudes running it. Brought my cb750 in wanting to swap my forks out for a more modern look. Complete honesty and transparency through the entire process. Ended up getting new wheels built and a rear brake conversion, and man does this bike start to look sick. Always going to attend their events from now on. I walk out of that shop feeling like a badass. You too. Can feel like a badass.

I brought my 2014 Triumph Bonneville in for a new set of break pads and got so much more. Mike, the owner and lead builder, not only ran out to another store on my behalf to grab a set of Triumph break pads because it would be quicker than ordering, but also went through the entire bike to spruce it up where he could. He texted me the key updates and upon pickup my bike was running better than the first day I got it (from a dealer). On top of that, the price was remarkably fair.

Mike and his team know their stuff, consistently produce beautiful bikes, and have secured my business for years to come.

I can’t say enough positive things about these guys! The overall feel of Federal is family. This is your one stop shop for a custom build, storage, maintenance, fabrication etc. They have partnered with several locally owned Chicagoland businesses to make the fabric of the company even stronger. Don’t forget to try their coffee!  

Long live Federal Moto!

You wrote a review for DANK Haus German American Cultural Center	22 hours ago
5.0 star rating 8/2/2018
We just had our wedding there, and it was amazing.  I'm so thrilled with our decision!  After we got engaged, we naturally started looking at venues.  We had reached out to a few, but hadn't heard anything back after a few days.  A friend recommended Dank Haus to us, and I'm so glad.  We called, Monika answered and said we could come right over and check it out.  We live about a 10 min walk from there, so went right over.  We liked it right away.  The venue itself was beautiful.  We wanted something different than the traditional banquet room, and this fit the bill.  We also felt very comfortable with Monika.  They were also very flexible.  We could use any caterer and could even provide our own liquor, to save money.  We decided then and there to go with their ballroom.  The venue cost was pretty reasonable, from what we'd seen. Throughout the process, Monika was great.  Any questions we had, she was always quickly to respond and helpful.  I really appreciated that!  We were able to load stuff in a few days before the wedding, and had help getting it in.  The day of, everything seemed to run smoothly as well.  Afterwards, we were also able to get help picking stuff up.  I highly recommend this place.  The price is decent, they are very helpful, and above all else the venue is beautiful.

We had our wedding reception a few weeks ago at the Dank Haus ballroom on the 5th floor  and couldn't be happier with the venue.  Monica was always responsive and helpful.  We were happy the venue doesn't resrict catering options.  The venue provided and set up all of the tables and chairs over 24 hours in advance since there was not an event the night before.  We were able to get in to decorate without stress.  The space is beautiful and we loved the arched windows.  Bonus with multiple German themed bars.  Great value for the cost - I would recommend for any large event!

Had my wedding here on may 25th 2018 and it was wonderful!! Our ceremony was at the skyline lounge terrace which has a beautiful view of the city. The room that the reception was in was on the same floor, so it was very convenient for everyone. Parking was available at the MB financial bank just a stones throw away from the building. There is elevator access for elderly or disabled people. Nice big kitchen (but no stove) as well as a nice big bar. The walls are cream colored with art deco gold trim and leafy design which went beautifully with our light pink, peach, cream, and forest green decorations/flowers. There were already nails and hooks on both sides of the long rectangular windows (about 4 on each side facing east and west) for us to hang our floral garlands and string lights. Monica is the event coordinator for the venue (she also got married at dank) and answered our many annoying questions thoroughly and with enthusiasm! She's truly a wonderful person. If you're looking for a spot to get married at, definitely check this place out!

I've been going to DANK events for the past 8 years and have always had a good time there.  I've always been impressed with their programming - they offer everything from German language classes, cooking classes, and art installations and tours.  I attended a German comedian performance there a few years ago that I still quote lines from because he was so funny!  In the summer, the DANK balcony view of the city is the perfect place to meet friends, enjoy quality German beer, and admire the city. Best of all, I'm excited for the Maifest which is always a great time.
Superior place for the event! Lovely staff can make your wish come true! I especially appreciate special requests being accommodated by staff for our event. Great job! Thank you.

Many a schoolmates , BROTHERS ,FRIENDS AND FAMILY RESTING FOR AWHILE HERE, if you want to be extremely wealthy here in Chicago own Cemetery or a funeral home.
We have lots of unnecessary DEATH FROM DRUGS AND GANGLAND STYLE WARFARE...WHILE ENJOYING THE SERENITY OF THIS MAJESTIC PLACE YOU WILL SEE DEER, HAWKS,CROW..MAYBE A FOX OR TWO...FISHING IS PROHIBITED IN THE POND HERE...BUT EXPLORE THE NEW CONSERVATION AREA ON THE WESTERN EDGE.,...🇺🇸🌎🌏🌍🇺🇸

We were not looking for cemetery and we've never heard of this place before. All of sudden,  we received their "invitation" for a promotion of their cemetery.   It's disturbing - we have never provided our info to them.  It's insensitive for a cemetery to actively promote their services.  It's also stupid to do that - even if in the future we would like to start planning, we probably would never consider them.

This the place everyone is dying to get into, it's nicely manicured and huuuge, there is a lot of history in this place and the occasional ghostly apparitions from some good sources that I know who have experienced them. Good place to go for a jog or walk and you'll keep the residents there entertained
Google the 24-hr exit on N. Bowmanville Ave., if ur locked in after hours.

Between 2005 and 2008 I can not get grave located. O.K in 2009 I went to the cemetery. And some one WAS SO MAD. That I came from California. I was told from someone that for me to get the grave located I had to go to the cemetery for the information.
Well yes it was my dad that was buried there. And I did not went anyone in the family to have a hard time getting to the grave. I got  photos of family grave. ( About 22 ). I have people go to the cemetery 2 to 3 times a years to check the graves.
Lots of choices.  Had a cracking burger.  They also deliver

Ordered from here for work sporadically when the team wants, always been lovely service and selection however today I was charged for a coworkers sandwich which never came and was told there was no record of, the person on the other end of the phone was very curt and did not provide a solution. Unfortunately we won’t be returning.
Very friendly. Had a full english breakfast which was excellent. Good value too.

DIRTY! i only ordered 3 sandwhiches and 2 were different from what was requested ! Didnt think that would be too hard for them but i was proven wrong. I asked for a replacement and in all credit I got them swapped ... for mouldy bread and stale ingredients. AVOID !!!

The breakfasts here are above average and the location and view from the indoor and outdoor seating areas is pleasant. The business is clearly family run and the chef in particular is friendly and keen to please.

Food is good! Parking limited and the door lady doesn’t keep up with who should be seated and what order unless she deliberately sat us last after we kept asking why wouldn’t be seated. I could have saved the trip! Customer service wasn’t too hot! Old faithful just became if it’s convenient
Great food and service. Showed up around 12:40 thinking they closed at 2am. Turns out they close at 1am. Still got great service and no rush to finish my food.
The atmosphere was great and cozy. I went to celebrate my dad's birthday. They sang happy birthday to him. We got to bring our own cake too! Awesome place for celebrations or just a night out!!

There's a reason this place has such strong reviews. Generally good Mexican food. Great big restaurant. Perfect for groups. Nice in the summertime to have a light meal and some margaritas. Friendly staff. Quick food service and it's always busy.
This Mexican food is overall pretty good. The best thing I've tried is the tortilla soup by far. I also like the ambiance.

Good Thai home cooking with authentic flavors. We were introduced by our Thai friends and were amazed by the flavors. Try the different curries and the appetizers. Expect quick no frills service, street parking and public parking lot are both available.

Might well be best Thai restaurant in the city or burbs. If not, one of the best. Quality and delicious recipes are what make this worth thr trip everytime. Panang is awesome as is the fried chicken. Soups also are killer, esp Tom Yum. Prices are very low for quality snd quantity you receive. Benn going here for over 35 years and never been disappointed.
Crispy catfish with sweet chili are a must dish to order. Has not failed me yet since 1988...

My wife and I had been wanting to try this place since we stumbled across it a few months ago and it didn't let us down. Both of our meals were very good and you couldn't beat the price. I recommend if you are in the mood for Thai!
Super Pad Thai! Didn’t disappoint.

The mixed grill provided very generous portions of well-seasoned proteins, flanked by rice and grilled green pepper, onion, and tomato.  We split an appetizer salad which was lightly dressed (a good thing!) and, again, generously portioned.  Come hungry or take half home for tomorrow!  (You know it's good - delivery people showed up regularly!)

It's just ok. It's been years since we've come here and according to other reviews it looks like there was a change in ownership. The food has changed. We were given store bought pita instead of fresh flat bread. The whole place smelled like cleaning solution when it should have smelled like onions and spices. They had one server on a Saturday night, and she did her best. All the patrons were Caucasian...should have been my first clue. Reasonable prices. Nothing special.
Amazing food! The staff is super friendly. It's one of my favorite go-to places in the neighborhood.

The best place to eat on the entire street. Someone who has been living here past few years, This street is populated one after another with middle eastern restaurants. I love the flavors and like how give is not used too often in enormous amounts. I like how it's small and cozy, and wish this place had parking. That's is my only major gripe abt this restaurant.

It looks pretty upscale and won't  be ashamed to bringing guests to impress. I Would love if the restaurant not copy their competitors, and develop their own foods/flavor.

Good food I have had in 3 years, new unique taste and flavors
very good food, generous portions, great service

I have always loved their desserts but tonight I was blown away by dinner service. First, our server was outstanding in every regard. I tried the short rib special and it truly was amazing. The best dinner I've had in recent memory. Whoever came up with this dish deserves major accolades. Apps were awesome, nice edited wine list and the world's best Black Forest cake punctuated a perfect meal. I had a fabulous meal.
Nice cafe with friendly staff. Coffee drinks are good, desserts are just okay. The food looks amazing though, will be back to try.
Delightful place. Corned beef hash was delicious. Coffee excellent. It's in the square, if you are walking, even better! Parking can be frustrating. Depends what time you go.
Delicious lunch followed by even tastier dessert, with great service? Count me in every time! I will be back many times!

Longtime neighborhood gem. Baked goods in the front, restaurant in the back, and very nice outdoor eating when the weather permits. 

Everything is solid and they have a very nice and friendly staff. It's also a good place for dinner and drinks are available.

This place has awesome chicken wings. You should get the spicy version (not that hot), but there is also non spicy. 
The hot and spicy shrimp has a nice slightly crispy texture. The sauce on there is also a bit sweet. I kept eating them even after I was full.
The service was really friendly today! (it didn't used to be).

I love this inspired, adventurous yet respectful update of traditional Chinese fare. As a part of a group of six I was lucky to be able to try many more dishes than if we'd been two. Only one out of maybe 10 dishes underwhelmed me, and that may have been due to personal preference.  I also loved the space, the decor and location. I am looking forward to returning with fewer people so that I can really focus on nuances.

This place has some of the best chicken wings in the city you will not be disappointed. I have yet to find competition for chicken wings. Ambience is a nah I always take it to go and save the tip money. But the wings take this place to a gold medal in my book. Highly recommend
Giving 4 stars for their chicken wings. A hot and sweet sauce. A little too sweet for me. But very tasty.  Their lunch specials are worthy of 2 stars.

I hope with the move across the street they will do some serious renovations!!! Dinnerware not authentic and bland!!! Needs a traditional element. Also, the rice sucks. No flavor and just horrible!! Try the rice at wu's house in Orland park on 143 and you will taste an extreme notable difference!!! The staff can barely speak English. Kind of pathetic really. No decor and filthy settings. Honestly they should not be in operation until the new location is open. Also!!! The signature yellow logo sign should be transferred to the new across the street location, not some pathetic computerized image of their signature dish!!! Perhaps way to converse money!! Don't be cheap!! Stand out and recreate yourselves. And work on that rice it has no aroma or taste and doesn't naturally have that look!! You need strong evaluators to really improve your business!!! Don't be cheap and just dispense old rice to customers!! And don't be so cheap with the sauce for the customers!! And for heavens sake get more vibrant cutlery and dishware!!! Not some white cheap dishes that are small in size!!! I hope your new location will have clean and functional bathrooms, nice decor and overall improvement!!! You guys have a lot to work on!!!! A LOT!!!

An amazing array of sandwiches. Gluten free options too. Service is a little slow, but just fine if you're not in a hurry. Sit at the bar for faster service. Great family place to eat right in the middle of Lincoln Square.

My dad and I stopped in here for lunch on a whim and it was an excellent choice! I ordered the regular grilled cheese with mashed potatoes and pickled vegetables. I had to ask for another serving of the veggies because they were that good. My dad got the Cobb salad and he loved it. He let me take a bite and it was very fresh and tasty.

OH MY GOODNESS GRACIOUS, Me oh my this place. I've never had a sandwich that once I've eaten it, I can't stop thinking about. I want Jerry's Sandra O sandwich all the time, I think about it on the reg, no joke. Every weekend I ask my boyfriend if we can go back. That sandwich. That sandwich! 

THE sandwich of all sandwiches!

My brother brought us here on our first meal in town. Must say I was blown away by everything. The decor, the food, the drinks, the atmosphere, all a pleasant relaxation after travelling the last 28 hours. I can understand why my brother is a regular here! Hopefully can stop by again before our trip in the city is through. [Pictured: the Sandra O korean bbq chicken sandwich. Absolutely delicious!]
This is our new Sunday lunch spot. Amazing food and drinks! We had a great experience with the staff as well. Our waitress was sweet and made great conversation with us.
This spot simply knows how to please their clients. Always with a kind approach. The food is conveniently priced, always delightful and clean.

A hidden gem in the north park- Peterson park area. Small only 9 tables but have a floor sit down area for over 5 people parties, giving you the full experience of a Japanese restaurant. The waitresses are dressed as geishas, a very nice touch to the experience. The food might take a few extra minutes when the restaurant is busy but it is worth it. Only thing I didn't like was the soup that is served before the main course like, I think they used tofu instead of meat, which resulted in a very weird taste of the soup. It is reasonably priced and family friendly. Definitely recommend if you're in the area looking for good food.

Midori's Japanese Restaurant is a nice sushi place in a small neighborhood setting. The Roberto's Special Creations is what was great,  which makes Midori my favorite sushi place at least for the past year.  Even though on this night the service was slower than expected, our table enjoyed the meal. Will repeat visit, but hope service is better next time.

Authentic Japanese sushi restaurant. Great sushi at an affordable price. Pay with cash and get a 5% discount. If you pay with a credit card it is suggested that you leave your tip in cash. All in all a cozy dining experience.
Omg omg just amazing sushi and the Roberts special its AMAZING definitely recommend this place👌. I wish i didn't live so far from this place .Ill be there at least once a week 😉
korean food here - excellent. Do yourself a favor and try this place. I had a brother come into town and he asked me to go back here. The bill was well within reason for the quality.
Deliciousness all around! I have come to this location a couple of times. I've tried the Beef Short Rib Bento box (my favorite), Pork Bento box,  and the Dumpling Sampler.
Great food, convenient location (right next to Korean supermarket), friendly staff and next to no waiting time. One minor point is the plastic spoon to eat with..

Chicken bento box was delicious and fresh. It was ready in about 5 minutes during the lunch hour. Lots of choices between this restaurant stand and the sushi stand next to it. There's a coffee bar and bakery in the lobby too.
This place is inside of H Mart. They have SGD Tofu near loop!  the taste about the same as the one in the burbs. They only give you two side dishes, kimchi and oh deng (fish cake)

Came here with a group of 4 early around 6pm on a Sunday. I definitely say come here with a party of 2 is the best. We were the first group waiting on the list, and it took a while to get a table. The venue has limited seating, and the service is on the slow side. That said, the food is good. I got the seafood bibimbap. There is plenty of seafood and it is a pretty good portion for a good price, which is hard to find on the east coast :).
The food was amazing! Came with 4 other people and everyone was satisfied. The place was very clean and the staff was very friendly with attention to detail. Will definitely come back for more.

I stumbled upon this place after an event nearby. It was an arctic day in Chicago and it was perfect. We ordered the mandu, custard for apps and did the bulgogi soup and the spicy beef soup. It was a lot of food! This place is definitely authentic and perfect for some home cooking. The owner is super nice and service is great. There were many Koreans inside so a great sign! Would definitely return again! Wish it was close for me in River North
Nice cozy place. Good food  and We liked the korean wine. Great service.

Came here for the first time after seeing so many good reviews. 
And those reviews were right. My picky grandma ate all her portion and all of my fam loved it!
If you are around the city def come and try this place the food is amazing the real home food
Sadly closed now. Absolutely my favorite German restaurant in the city. The best liver dumpling soup. Beat Rubens, duck, white fish etc....entertainment was top shelf. A lost treasure in Chicago.

WHERE GERMAN FOOD LIVES.
Didn't really dig the dish I chose but it was still good eats. Want to go back to try something different. They have good beer and everything for a nice price. The dinning room is really dark but very old world. I went for a late lunch so missed the authentic music during dinner.

Being of German descent I tend to be more critical than I normally am as I have been eating authentic German food all my life. I was served the best pork shank I have ever eaten in a restaurant. All of our dinners were cooked to perfection. I highly recommend Chicago Brauhaus to all. Keep up the great work. See you again soon.

One of my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Amazing food, great atmosphere, the staff are friendly.

The food is fantastic. From the first bite of Nancy's famous meat loaf, I've known I will have to come back again and again. Topped with live music. It's amazing!
It is a fantastic representation of a German Brauhaus. Sadly this location will be closing in the next week or so. I suggest you run and enjoy it before it's gone.

reviews.author_name: Keisy Mabel Valdez De La Cruz

reviews.text: This is my favorite place in Chicago. I just feel at home. I particularly enjoy the different programs the museum offers. As well as the collections, of course. I have seen the permanent collection countless times but visit it every chance I get. A must see is the Day of the Dead exhibit along w the festivities for the occassion. It is a great way to learn about this holiday.
Free and open to the public with rotating exhibits and an amazing permanent exhibit. Kid and pet friendly. Free coat/bag check. Nice gift shop
This place was amazing! A hidden gem! Truly some amazing art. Even though it's not that big, there's a lot to appreciate about this place. Plus it's free! I highly recommend this museum. :)

The art was enjoyable but the building was confusing to navigate. Local street vendors selling authentic mexican food out front was a perfect ending to our visit. I would suggest capitalizing on that market a little better by providing outdoor seating.

This museum is ahhhhmazing! The curation of artists - including the visiting collections - is top notch. Some of the art is political ... how could it not be? And, some is just downright stunning and inspired. Highly recommend. We made the trip from Wisconsin, and it was worth the drive. The gift shop is the BOMB too!
A very blessed place to be💖😌🙌

Most beautiful and old church on south side of Chicago.
Targeted for close and  quclkly as other churches
Archidieces need money's for law suits!.
Heavenly!

Visited it as a part of Open House Chicago. Beautiful inside and out. Was surprised to learn that is was funded by Polish Immigrants who lived in this neighborhood. All the stained glass window represent Polish Saints and are labeled in Polish.

This church was built by my great-grandparents along with their neighbors at the time and the interior has been modeled after st. Paul's Basilica in Rome which looks identical to the interior of st. Adalbert not to mention that I was baptized in that church and served My First Holy Communion in the church and in 1977 I was confirmed by Cardinal John Cody in that church as well

This is one of the nicest venues I have ever visited. The show I was at was seated and the chairs were very comfortable. It is a medium sized venue but it felt very intimate. Chicago music fans are some of the best in the country. The show was stripped down and you could have heard a pin drop except for the applause points.

This historical building needs some work but the beauty is still there.  There are restaurants and bars in the building and we didn't need to brave the Chicago cold to be entertained.  Loved our time here and I hope to learn more about the history of this intriguing building
It was AMAZING!! saw Tobe Nwigwe. It's a very clean intimate space. The DJ was excellent and the show was absolutely wonderful. Hope to visit another good artist there soon.

Awesome venue. Dual level, so you can sit up top if you need to, or be down in the pit. Lots of bars and friendly staff. We didn't even have to wait for beer.
It's the top floor above a restaurant and a bar, so it's easy to show up early and have dinner/drinks before the show. 
Cool variety of bands, solid beer choices, and a great sound setup/vibe in the actual venue.
Nice little venue. Clean and plentiful bathrooms. Neighborhood has come a long way. Folding chairs for the show we comfortable. Bar prices were reasonable and bartenders were friendly.
Renegade Art Fair was fun. Full of hipsters and hippies. Good stuff for sale.

Been coming here with my family since I was a young girl. So to me, this place is awesome. Carnitas are always fantastic.  It has a very simple but clean interior. Salsas are not spicy and good. If you want an extra spice kick they also have pickled jalapenos.

It is a delightfully delicious place to eat. It is always very busy and a little cramped but it is definitely worth it. The staff was extremely polite and very friendly. I went to this place with my friends to celebrate one of my friend's birthday. Everybody at this place was so happy and it was all a joyous evening. Another time when I visited this place, the experience was equally good. So, I can say that the place maintains its standards. This time I ordered three dishes and all the three were too good. The taste was amazing, the quality was good, it was absolutely fresh. I’m really happy with the place.

This place is the best for Carnitas. I live an hour away and I make the trip to come here whenever I have the need for some, really that should tell you everything you need to know 😀. The place is super small but the food and friendly people are excellent. The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 star is because again they are small and never have I had the opportunity to dine in. I guess it could happen one day but I would probably have to wait a long time for a seat.

Small and a little cramped but well worth it. Carnitas and chicharrones were amazing, split a pound of each with my wife for an early lunch. Can also order by the taco but tortillas are also served when ordering by the pound. If you are in the area this place is a must! Staff was very courteous/helpful

Man, what can I say? Carnitas to die for! For under $10 you'll eat so much you might have to sneak the pants button undone. This is a no frills very limited menu kind of place. They do one thing CARNITAS and they do it well. One of my old school Chicago favorites!
It had the best pan pizza. There was a little wait, but it was worth it. The customer service is on point, and your burgers and also 10/10. Be glad to come back here any day.
Pizza has no taste fries are cold. atmosphere is really bad .food. Was not warm at all and my friend order a Italian beef wasn’t really a good sandwich .

Their customer service is the worst I have ever experienced, on the phone and in person. they have high school kids working the phones and inside the pizzeria. It's neighborhood pizza, it's pretty good.
Good cheap pizza , great prices , friendly staff
I'm a truck driver. I'm sitting here at Chicago Market. I called order my food. They delivere it fast. Very good food. I will be back. Thank you.
What an awesome little joint! A true gem.

Amazing local business!!! I will recommend this place to everyone because it’s very secretive but I want to see it thrive! Food is at good price and this is as authentic Mexican food can get!! So delicious!
Just awesome hidden gem
The steak was too tough and not good. The sauce was very runny. I should’ve just went to Taco Burrito King

Adorable little taco shop with 5 counter seats. The food is cooked right in front of you by one woman who runs the whole business. The food and service are both excellent. This is a hidden gem and i would love to see this local business thrive!

Tonight was probably the 6th or 7th time I’ve been to La Vaca and I hate to write this review BUT honestly their service is the worst Ive ever had in Chicago and it’s consistently the WORST. Let’s start with the hostesses: they don’t know how to seat people. Period. They should really be trained again. I arrived at 7:58, asked for the time it would take, they say 40 min. Okay that’s fine. 1 hour and 10 min later we still have no table but 2 other parties that came after us (I know this because I watched them put their names and phone numbers in & same number in their parties) get seated. I had to remind them 3 different times we were still waiting. We finally get seated and it takes the waiter 10/15 min to get to our table. This wouldn’t be an issue but we’re verging on an hour and a half at this point. When he finally comes by all he says is “do you know what you want” short and to the point, fine. But COME ON not “Can I get you guys started with drinks” or anything to that nature that servers usually start with. The food is great but the service makes this place a terrible experience. End of story.
One of the best taco places I've ever tried. I liked the blend between bar and restaurant. I recommend this place as perfect place to take your date. Worked for me :)

Visited this bar during the middle of March for lunch. Honestly food was very good. Had the shrimp cocktail and the flautas. Shrimp cocktail had some spice on it but it was welcomed. The flautas were stuffed with chicken! I mean filled to the rim! Plus the toppings were perfectly balanced. The only downside was I wish it was nice outside so we could enjoy the patio but that just means I’ll be coming back in the summer!
Awesome staff! Great drinks and atmosphere! Won't be disappointed. Definitely stop by!
Mole chicken enchiladas. Good price for amount of food. The wait was way too long, the reason for four stars.

The BBQ here is amazing and the ambiance is great too. Low lighting and great smells here. The parking situation around here is pretty iffy though. As far as I know, there is only street parking, which generally seems like it has no spots. Gotta try the bacon candy and the ribs, expect $15+
My go-to! Love this place. Delicious food and friendly staff. Please get their smoked chicken wings and peach cobbler! You won’t regret!

When I go there it's mainly to see live bands such as TGA, but there is more to this venue besides great music. They also have excellent house drinks and delicious appetizers. The staff is very accommodating whether you have a small or large party.

Friendly service on a Friday night. Live music with no cover. BBQ and drinks came out quickly.  Legit greens and cornbread.  Hot link was tasty. Brisket was above average but nothing worth standing in line for.  Very good by Chicago standards.  I will be back for sure.

Never can go wrong with Honky Tonk. My favorite is the candied bacon strip atop the beer. I absolutley love coming on Wednesdays and Sundays when the big fat babies perform! They take you back to the 20's.  Food is amazing!

Good setting in a fun neighborhood. Food was great, flavors authentic. Don't go to the bathroom when its below zero, as it is essentially outdoors. Ordered the Chicken Mole enchilada, which did not disappoint with the crepe wrap. Chips and salsa were homemade and superb.

Recommended by a family friend who lives nearby. Went with my Mom. Sonia is very welcoming and made us feel at home. Huge portions with fair pricing for fantastic food. Definitely save room for the desserts!
Great place for lunch or morning coffee! They have awesome pastries & cookies from the bakery plus really delicious food. I can't get enough of their pozole verde 😍 Sweet staff too!
The chilaquiles were fantastic! Such a wonderful restaurant with friendly staff! I will definitely be back again
I love, love this place! Even the chips and salsa are awesome. Both are freshly made 😍

You'd be hard pressed to find better food in Atlanta.  Farm to table fresh, inventive creations from the chef, service polished to near perfection, and a lovely setting make it an excellent destination.   Yet, there's something that feels formulaic--the spontaneity and uniqueness of dining here is lessened from the Bacchanalia of old.  Still, it's very worthwhile for that special occasion or for any evening when you're okay to drop a few pennies.

Went to Bacchanalia a few years ago with my wife and it was really good, but we felt like it feel a little short of all the hype. Fast forward to this month, we went again to try out their new home on the Westside, and we were blown away. I sincerely could not have asked for a better experience or food. The service was impeccable. The food was perfectly portioned and prepared. I had a hard time choosing what to order because everything on the menu, within each course, sounded so good. I'll be back very soon and highly recommend Bacchanalia. It was once the restaurant in Atlanta that received top honors every year, and if they haven't regained that title, they certainly deserve to.

Amazing service and attention to detail. The staff was incredibly considerate and made every aspect of the evening enjoyable. Unquestionably the food was amazing and the atmosphere was perfect. I couldn't recommend a restaurant more.

Bacchanalia was very professional and tasty, but lacked a few things necessary for me to rate 5 stars at this price point. The location is great and avoids local road traffic in the area. I also really appreciated the self-parking. The dining room wasn't too loud and had a neat feeling, but there were a few quirks (e.g. the tables that lock you in to the bench seats and lights dimmed every time the bar dishwasher turned on). All the food was very tasty, but didn't quite blow our minds the way I would expect for a $250+ dinner. The only true disappointment was the beer list. I ordered the best IPA on tap (Wicked Weed Freak of Nature), but was informed it had already tapped out...at 6:15pm. There wasn't anything else comparable to replace it.  I wish restaurants (especially at this level) would update their beer list to reflect what is actually available.

The service was top-notch, but lacked warmth. We had everything we needed (and never thought about water), but there was no personal connection. Maybe that's their operating model?

Overall, we felt like One Midtown Kitchen (now closed) and Local Three offer more creative/impressive dishes and friendlier service at a better price point compared to Bacchanalia.

Absolutely amazing restaurant! The staff is responsive and professional and my glass was never empty. The food was fabulous and we’ll portioned. I recommend business casual attire with a jacket no tie.

The best traditional Italian food in Chicago for sure. You must try the great food and ... desserts. Seafood to lamb chops are perfectly served every time. Great owners.
And there is more... great cocktails. Low key place with amazing food.
Bruna's is my favorite among the delicious dining options in Chicago's Heart of Chicago mini-hood. You can't go wrong on South Oakley Av, but I love the simple, but delicious, spaghetti bolognese.

Food was absolutely delicious. In from out of town and took a chance based on other reviews and they didn't disappoint! Scallops alla Christina were superb and my husband could only eat half his serving of Veal Parmigiana with Angel Hair which he said he hated to stop eating. We highly recommend.

Wow - best Italian restaurant in the city in an unassuming location. Traditional menu you won't find elsewhere, with incomparable quality and service. Old-school type restaurant where the servers actually know the menu and can make suggestions.
Cozy yet elegant atmosphere. Food was delicious and service good. I had the lobster ravioli, one of the specials, and it was exquisite. Chocolate mouse cake also great. Definitely recommend
The hospitality was great. I had minestrone soup for the first time and they did it justice. Super fresh and tasty. The lasagna Bolognese was magnificent. Nice sized portions.

Delicious and fresh. The restaurant  is so cozy and the staff is so polite and attentative. Had wine  fresh warm bread, the ceasar salad, the calimari, and the baked artichokes. Everything was delicious.
I love their stuffed shells and their artichoke!

Our family came here for Easter. We have vegetarian and gluten free eaters. They
 found plenty on the menu. Very much a family owned and run environment. We loved the pasta dishes and appetizers. I will be back.
Delicious food. Warm and inviting
This is an amazing example of Frank Lloyd's Wright work. Great venue for weddings and corporate meetings
Beautifully maintained FLW property. Knowledgeable docent took her time guiding through the property.

Emil Bach House is a fantastic piece of architectural history. Fortunately, a 2004 renovation restored the house to its original style. The tour was great, and it's neat to see how Wright used elements of the prairie style as his career progressed beyond it.

This house designed by Frank Llyod Wright is goregous! I was impressed at how progressive his design was. The floor plan is very open, and inviting. The shape is so different, and modern. He was way ahead of his time as an architech in the turn of the century.
Great venue for yoga and a wellness event. The gardens outshine the house.
Very fun! But much bigger than I expected, it's tough to take it all in quickly. Take your time, fill yourself with knowledge, and enjoy

Kinky place. The galleries are quite amazing and the old art work of the Chicago gay community is quite impressive. Etienne was an amazing artist. I want to see more. Also a great venue to host events.

So glad this place exists! For a culture that doesn't have a lot of written text it was very educational to explore and experience this museum. I definitely enjoyed it and recommend it to anyone who is interested in learning more about the kinky side of life.
Fun educational place to go and the employees there are really nice

This place is amazing and I'm so glad it exists. For a culture that exists almost exclusively as an experience, without a lot of written text, it's so awesome to get to come here and see parts of where the leather culture began. I have been here twice as part of a discussion group and I look forward very much to going back again. Thank you LA&M! -a local titleholder-

I love this park, there was a foot of snow on the ground and we still had an AMAZING time here. The entire play area is made of wood so it wasn't slippery like most play grounds. In the summer there are sprinklers and benches a pond and ski many fun areas to relax with the kids.
Good place to take my kids for some outdoor activities.

We go here all the time. They have a huge playground, lots of open fields, a pond, a nature area, a field house that hosts special events, and a large outdoor sprinkler for the kid's to play in during the hot summer. They also have all kinds of special events, like dances and dramas in the park.

This is a great park with winding paths that interconnect for a good workout . 

Parking can be ify but usually within half a block away. 

Public restroom. 

There used to a be a zoo here that is defunct. Of course the alderman doesn't tear it down......WHY???????? Because he gets tax money to maintain it so there is a paid for zoo with no animals. 

Family oriented 
Lots of green space. 
Lots of benches that could use updating but the money goes to zoo animals that dont exist.
Amazing place to be close to, love that place and being there it just wonderful

Tasty vegetable curries and sweet snacks. 
The food is vegetarian. The restaurant is good at serving meals that are ready to go.
Street food for the hungry vegetarian .
The place is always busy. 
Parking is difficult because of the limited parking space. 
Make sure to pay for the parking meter or you will get a parking ticket!
Good luck finding a parking space.

Place is a little chaotic and probably could use some stronger management. Everything was swimming in oil and was less than appetizing. The two dishes I got today tasted of nothing but oil... and I was less than pleased. My experiences here in the past have been very good... but today was pretty terrible. I don’t think I would go here again... especially with all of the competition in the area.
Good food and reasonable! Would be nice to have tables for groups larger than four though

Ohh my goodness. This was the best Place to have Indian fast food. Four of us thoroughly enjoyed each and every dish. The best part of entire Chicago trip. Definitely a must do if you are in Chicago for a trip and want to have Indian fast food. Hands down, no competition.
Cheap and good food. We were 3 people and we all ate in under $50 with more than 9 different dishes. The food was decent and will sure return back here.

Very tasty pastries, very reasonably priced. They also sell house-baked bread, which looks amazing. And, as a lover of Russian and Eastern European food, I was delighted to see they sell frozen pelmeni/пельмени and vereniki/вареники - looking forward to trying those next! The space is quite casual and small (only a couple tables for seating), but clean and cozy, and you can see the huge brick oven. The service is very helpful and hospitable.
A nice cozy bakery with great service and quality freshly baked items.

I love this place! They have amazing Georgian flat bread - lavash, pastries especially hachapuri(cheese pastry), homemade dumplings, churchhella(Georgian sweets made of nuts covered by thickened grape juice). Last time I was there they had two types of cake - Napoleon and Mishka. Both were so good I still think about them. My only wish is that this place would not be 2 hours away from my house so I can go there more often
Good place and friendly casher
This place is fantastic! Really good pastries, especially the khachapuri. They're always been very fresh whenever I stopped by.

Best on the Northside Hands down!!! They have been around forever and have the best, least expensive,  fresh food and baked goods period!!
I wish they sold jerk fish ♡
Outstanding savory patties...veggie, chicken curry, beef and cheese, etc.  Great authentic pastries and beverages too, plus super friendly!
1 of the best Jamaican bakery/restaurant in Chicago been eating there for over 35years
They have the best Pies and Bread.
Delicious Jerk Chicken,  tasty baked goods,  friendly customer service

This place is fantastic  of you love Indian  food  plus the vegan dishes.
It's not a fancy place so just letting you  know.
It's a mix involvement. 
Food is very good spices and aromas! You going to be suprise you will enjoy!
Prices are good 1 dish you can combine with extra person.bring your containers because  you going to wish bring some leftovers  home.

I love this place. It is my go to to Indian/Pakistani food fix. I’ve been coming here for about four years now and have never had a bad experience. The only reason I’m giving it four stars is because my girlfriend can’t really eat here. They only use chicken legs and thighs or the meat from legs and thighs. She won’t eat chicken that’s not white meat, so she ends up eating all the sauce of the butter chicken and a bunch of bread. I would be willing to pay a little extra for some white meat just so she can eat here with me, but I don’t think that is ever going to happen. And unfortunately, the veggie dishes are too spicy for her. 😢

I first discovered this when i was spending a summer in Chicago with a friend of mine and we go to various eateries. He took me here and said you will not forget this place and to this date (after 17 years) the place is still the same with same value and quality of food. Although they have an extensive menu, but just stick to their Biryani. That is what they were most known for. The portion is very generous and with good chunks of meat. As I said I had it 17 years ago and been there many time since then (every time I visit Chicago) and never been disappointed.
24/7 best Indian food for the best price! $20 feeds my hubs and I for dinner, then lunch the next day. if you haven't been here yet, I strongly suggest you do!

I started coming to eat here about 19 years ago and even though I don’t live anywhere near the city I still take the time to drive way out my way just for the food. The prices have gone up since but it’s still reasonable and the chicken biriyani is still the same original recipe i remember. Everything I’ve tried has all been good. I seen they have added a lot more to their menu since my last visit years ago so I will definitely be going back soon to try something different. This is my go to for Indian food. I hope they keep the recipe the same for more years to come.

Stopped in earlier today as a stage in our ongoing quest to discover the ultimate Chicago hot dog and burger.  It seems to be well known that such a quest could in no way be meaningful without a visit to Wolfy's.  That's very true!  The West Ridge institution has a deeply Chicago vibe.  It is clean, cheerful, welcoming, and family friendly.  The service is exceptionally good: Caring, efficient, and perfectly accurate.   We had polish sausage with everything, burgers, and fries.  The polish at Wolfy's is a little unorthodox compared to most of the top-tier Chicago hot dog places in that it has fried onions rather than finely chopped raw onions, little or no relish, no sport peppers, no celery salt, and pickle slices rather than wedges.  Also, the sausage is sort of hotdog-like, not as thick and tough as most polish.  But the whole thing works brilliantly and is delicious!  One family member who got a cheeseburger with everything is not a fan of fried onions, so she removed them and proceeded to experience what she called the best burger she ever ate.  Lesson: Specify exactly how you want your order.  Overall, Wolfy's absolutely lives up to its reputation.
