Food was alright for lack of a better word. I’ve been here a long time ago and it used to be real good. Service was good. Don’t get me wrong it’s not bad I just had better.
This place is worth a try. They have big portions for convenient rates. Consistently neat and with great character. Will come back again.

It's a hot dog place that sells other friend food. The hot dog's are pretty good. They use premium hot dog meat and buns and you can taste the difference. I usually get the gyro and it's always been heavy on the meat and the sauce and bread are good. Food quality has been consistent and the prices are pretty standard.
The cheeseburger was amazing, and the fries also! It was my first time going, good deal for two. I would definitely go again.

Another great place for non vegetarians food in Devon. Very spacious inside but lack of parking space. This restaurant is right on corner of Devon Ave and western Ave. So your vehicle must be parked somewhere and walked to reach this place.
One of the best BBQ on devon. Can never go wrong here
Boti Kabab and Murg chole are must try and I would definetely recommend going to Khan Barbeque. This place is not so expensive and offer wide variety of barbeque items. Usually there is no waiting.
Not bad for middle eastern b.b.q....naan was exceptional
Rude owner, food unhygienic - hounds multiple hair in multiple dishes - save your money and go somewhere else
We  eat here a lot since I work in the area. I love how their customer service is always fantastic and they keep the place neat consistently. Prices are convenient and they serve large portions.

Extremely Overrated. Ordered Nihari and Frontier chicken per the recommendation of our server. Food was served in less than 5 minutes. Nihari was warm but not hot and frontier chicken appeared dry , pre-heated and didn't taste good. Had to ask three different waiters to cancel the item before it was finally picked up from our table. Taste of Nihari was average and I did not understand all the hype behind it. May be its just the brand name hype because it brings back many childhood memories of eating an authentic and delicious Nihari back in Pakistan. I also ordered 1 regular Nan and 1 garlic Nan. The regular Nan was good but Garlic Nan was extremely oily. Why did they put million layers of oil on top of a Garlic nan that made the whole Nan soggy is beyond my 
thoughts.
Anyways,  from the time we started eating no server came to our table and asked us if we needed anything. It appeared to be a fine dining restaurant but the customer service was horrible and no where near to what i would consider a fine dining experience.

Great restaurant. Lots of amazing food options. The mixed grill is fantastic value, and the karahi chicken is the best in Devon in my opinion.

They also have extremely generous portions. They fill their serving dishes to the very top.

 Highly recommend!

I am only giving three stars because of the food. Restaurant was really crowded on Saturday night. Parking is really hard to find on weekends. Try to park in back alleys of restaurant. Food is good. But tables are shoved in too closer. I felt a complete lack of privacy. You can hear whatever the person on the next table is discussing. No kids appropriate meals on the menu. I saw a dustbin placed next to clean plates and dishes.
Wow!!! Walked into this amazing place on my trip to Chicago. It looked real nice from outside so I had to try it. Very clean place, top notch staff and the food OMG you have to try it.

Very good vegetarian place, relatively good and quick service when you compare with other restaurants. Staff are very friendly. Food was tasty and good but dessert can be better that why a 4 rating else everything was good.
Great, home style South Indian food. All vegetarian. Dosas are made to order. Great quality and friendly staff. Definitely ask for daily specials.

Good food and great service - we had the Channa Bhatura, the spicy chili cheese dosa and the bisibele Bhath. The dosa and the bisibele were really good, while the channa was a bit too tomato-ey. Their service was really good, as they were quick and attentive.
Food is really good. Their masala dosa and paper dosa are very tasty. But the price is very expensive. Otherwise they deserve 4 stars.
Excellent place for South Indian food. They also have food choices for all North dishes. Great service and popular too, large crowds.

So salty and spicy I can’t finish my overpriced meal. The “lamb” tasted old too. I am usually very forgiving about stuff like this, but not today, and they use microwaves.  Next day: I was pooping water all day and now I’m dehydrated.

First time after countless walk by’s. Honestly a bit underwhelmed by the front ( as mentioned by others the bathroom sink totally caught me off guard but at least it has somewhere to wash up 😆) clearly is labeled that everything is self serve and hey that’s not for everyone. I ordered for three to go and the dishes were great, spicy is advertised not correctly it’s on a volcanic level! The chicken was great and the lamb even better and the samosas were wonderful (as well as the accompaniments) without a doubt I will return to try different entrees ( but I won’t be dinning in). Than you Luzzat for a good experience in Rogers Park!
Cute storefront restaurant that serves great Indian food. When they say spicy, they mean spicy! Very homey feeling.

The food is tasty. Great breads. You can never be sure when they will be open. You have to order at the counter and pick up your entre at the counter, it used to be table service. Water from styrofoam cups. About half their original menu is redacted from the printed menu with opaque tape. So, yummy but not a great environment. At least it is clean.

Really high quality food in very basic surroundings. Do if you seek very good northern Indian food you will find it. But unless you take it home, you will be eating on styrofoam plates with plastic silverware. 
The adventure of going there and having the food hot and fresh is worth it at least once. 
We will return there for sure. A jewel in the rough in Jarvis in Roger's Park. I recommend it!

We have visited Ethiopian Diamond several times. We typically have a vegetarian plate for two. The servings are generous. The place is BYOB. So plan in advance. The service is always fast and friendly.

First time diner, was celebrating my son's birthday with his sister. Food was plentiful and different, but well prepared and tasteful. Had mild and spicy dishes combo. Will probably go back. Atmosphere was cool large open space. Seating was good. They don't have a liquor license yet, but you can byob.
I encourage you to try the samplers rather than a single dish. Half the joy of this place is trying all the flavors. You can't go wrong with anything that has potatoes, carrots, lentils, or cabbage.

Never had Ethiopian food before. I wasn't quite sure what to get at first, but my girlfriend and I ended up sharing a sampler. SO much food. All of it was very very good. Great first experience with this cuisine. And I will definitely be back.

The food was really good. Loved the Ethiopian tea as well and ended with a combination dessert.  
Can improve customer service.  Also, would be good if the customer is asked whether they know the menu or as a proactive measure,  can advise the customer about the menu.
I was fortunate to have a chance to visit this Chicago institution before it closed. Tomorrow (12/31/2018) is its last day after 42 years as a headquarters for good people and progressive politics.

This place was almost full for breakfast on the weekend, and I can ONLY imagine that it is because it is overhyped (vegan) and trendy!
Wood was on the verge of being terrible and cooking time was extremely long.
I ordered pancakes  (they only have wheat and buckwheat)  - wheat  and my wife ordered buckwheat. It took 40! minutes to cook! and then they bring me 2 blackened, thin and hard "pancakes". They charged me 75 cents for a spoon of sour cream to make them at least a little moist.
It might be healthy, but it tasted like a cardboard. In the end even my dog, who loves pancakes, did not want immediately  to eat it! 
The prices are extremely high also. 
I understand that this is trendy and is in run-down neighborhood, so there are no other places to eat, but try to avoid it if you can. 
I am sure it is not healthy to eat tasteless food!
I've been frequenting The Heartland for over 20+ years.  They are the special kind of unique store/cafe/restaurant nestled within the community....a true gem!! #AnHistoricLandmark

The only redeeming quality of my meal was the cocktail. Service was terrible; I wasn’t greeted while standing confused in the middle of the room (because there is no signage that this is a seat-yourself place) even though the same waitress passed by me twice, and I waited over 20 minutes to be noticed and given a menu once I sat down. When the menu finally arrived it was completely different than what’s published online. I ordered the fish and chips, which specifically states on the menu that it comes with tartar sauce. Not only did it not come with any sauce, when I asked if they had tartar sauce I was told no. The food was totally forgettable and wasn’t at all worth the cost. I’m extremely disappointed with my experience here and will not be returning. Don’t be fooled by the cute atmosphere.
I came across this place on a walk one night and my friend and I decided to go in for some food. It was great! We loved it and want to go back soon. Great space and awesome food.

Great local Thai place. Great versions of Thai classics and new creations all rock. Women who work there are all very nice and Sue the owner makes you feel very welcome. Love the pork skewers with sticky rice and dynamite scallop. Right under Granville el stop. Never let down eating here ever.

While recovering from a pretty bad stomach ache, I was looking for places near me that had a nice chicken soup. Luckily, Summer Noodles was there! I went there and was greeted by a very comfortable and cozy atmosphere, and very nice employees. The chicken soup was hearty and flavorful, without being too strong for my then-weak stomach. I will definitely tell friends about the place, and try more dishes later!

We recently dined here for the first time, with friends who had previously dined at the restaurant. We also had  two visiting Monks with our party. The young lady who assisted us, was so helpful and patient. She went above and beyond to help accommodate our honored guests. Even taking pictures during the blessing. We will definitely be back!

Ordered chive dumplings & house fried rice from them. The dumplings were soggy & RAW on the inside, completely oily & inedible. I asked for the fried rice to be spicy (my mistake) it was overwhelming & I could barely taste the actual food. I returned the food & asked for a refund, they only refunded me on 1 of the items. Horrible experience, will never order from them again👎🏽🚮😷
Still AMAZING! Kept it simple with chicken and shrimp stir fried hand Summer Noodles & Rice and I'll tell you it's STILL worth the trip from the Bronx!

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

A unique look into the fascinating history and culture of Lithuania. The bottom floor is filled with artifacts documenting the history and culture. The upper floor is a more contemporary account of the lives of Lithuanian, and other Baltic state, immigrants and the effects of World Wars one and two. Well worth your time if you are at all interested in the history of the region, American immigration or the World Wars.

This museum rocks!!! So much interesting and valuable information on Lithuania before and during the 2 great world wars Staff was extremely helpful and nice even got to meet the guy who started it all!! Very nice guy! Totally recommend this place to anyone!!!
It was great the peple that work there good sence of humor and very helpful, the store was also good very interesting things

The staff are helpful and social, I had pleasant conversations with many of them while walking through the exhibits. If you are interested in Baltic history, WII, or the Cold War, this museum offers a great perspective.

As a descendant of Lithuanians, I have long been fascinated by Lithuanian culture and traditions. Keeping alive the many histories: the early tribes, medieval Lithuania, Vilnius as a Jewish center of scholarship, the Napolean era, the Nazis and the Soviets, and the often tough life Lithuanians faced if they emigrated - this is critical. After 20 years of interest in Lithuania, I was fortunate to be able to visit this important museum, the only one of its kind in North America.
Besides exhibits on all the eras of Lithuania history, there is a large collection of art and a great children's museum. They also have the largest genealogical library outside of Lithuania.

Repository for UK historical documents, photos, maps. Lovely place just to drop in with library, cafe etc. Study the rules for obtaining and handling documents first. You should also understand how searching the catalogue works. There are Research Guides online for most areas of study. Marvelous resource if you have prepared first.

A national treasure- not what you would expect. Modernised, digital & historic, professional staff and service- drop-in welcome. Great coffee and surprisingly wine! Book shop and great exhibitions. Just attended Dame Stella Rimmington evening lecture, ex head MI5- riveting, one-off my heroines. Check it out.

An extremely interesting place to visit. Really very helpful, pleasant staff. I have just requested a non-naturalisation letter regarding my deceased relative and this has promptly been mailed to me. A wonderful service. Thank you so much for all your help!
Very helpful staff, the cafeteria there has amazing breakfast and Lunch Buffets.
TNA has adminstrative records dating back a thousand years.

Trinity Church very beautiful on the inside plenty of parking very professional and courteous receptions will greet you no it is not my church home I know many family and friends that do attended as a church home that's my review
Welcoming my spirital need. Fixed my soulful need at home and at work. When I need my family close and hold me their there in spirit I

Absolutely wonderful services as always! Refreshing  reminder that there are still wonderful, loving, concerned people in this society and the world at large. Unapologetic about who they are and whose they are! Will be back next Sunday!
The set up is amazing  differnt areas to seperate viewing.
Love this church they welcome all ppl

A unique Mexican cuisine experience, everything is authentic, delicious and fresh and the tortillas and hot sauce are also home made! It was my boyfriend and I’s first time dining here, the customer service was Superb shout out to Norma and Jackie! We
highly recommend!
Really good tacos. Hand made tortillas. Goat meat only. Staff was really nice. Family owned small production great food.

The food was good but the service was horrid! Will never come back there again. They should teach there waitress that if someone says it’s the first time eating here that she should give a great first time service. She said everything to make sure we did not want to come back there again. She might as well told us the food sucked. It’s cramped as it’s a very small place but my husband is 6’5 tall and we ordered plenty food that we had no room on our table so we asked if it was possible to move to a bigger table that clearly was not being occupied and she went on to say that table is reserved for three or more customers and offered no accommodations! Those tables were unoccupied the entire time we were there! Very unexceptional as customers we should not leave upset the way I did. Lastly the waitress never came back to check on us obviously knowing that we were upset with her service, but still not giving any type of service let alone alone good service. Very highly priced food if you ask me but if the service would have been good I would not have a problem spending my money there! DO NOT RECOMMEND IF YOU LIKE GOOD SERVICE!!!

I wish that I took pictures when we went here; it was FANTASTIC! The minute that we walked in we were greeted in a very small but very familial setting.  The smells were great but didn't do the food justice. I had the large goat with extra broth and it didn't disappoint.  The flavors combined with service and hospitality will bring me back here again.  Find a way to make it this way- you won't regret it!

Excellent food. Only meat is goat. Handmade tortillas.  Goat broth is excellent. Coffee with cinnamon was great. Almost always crowded. Sit at counter and watch the tortillas being made and the goat being prepared. Parking is tough. Worth the trip. Zagat rated.

When it comes to Cecina meat this is the place. From their fried quesadillas to skirt steak everything is good and served fresh!! Salsa on point staff friendly to. All and all I would definitely recommend this place!!
Food is great. Almost as if it was actually made in Mexico. But service was a little slow .
Good food. They need to work on their phone system. I called for half an hour since they didn't answer. Had to go in personally to place my order.
Love it best mexican restaurant in the area
Good food .nice and cozy, great ambience .
It's fresh delicious. Definitely recommend el gazpacho

Love this place. Every time I come here I know what I want, but the abundance of options always makes me change my mind once I'm here. Best Fresas con Crema and Mangoneadas in the city of Chicago. I've tried so many other places but Razpacho's always has the best of....... Well, everything.

One of the best ice cream / fruit stops in Chicago.  The custom paletas they make are one of a kind.  If you are looking for an avocado paleta, then look no further, this will utterly surprise.  Always be on the lookout for new flavors to try for they are always experimenting.  A definite must go to spot for your sweet tooth.
Furthermore, the gazpacho moreleano is the perfect blend of fruits, spice, and juice that is a must for any first time visitor to this place.
Super fresh!  Yummy and unique flavors like the Mazapan ice cream.
Food and quality is high quality. I'd recommend if you live nearby

Love the selection of different breads! The Lithuanian rye is my favorite. Polish rye is very good! Latvian is another one to try. Bacon buns are amazing!  So many pastries & variety of baked goodies. And the deli in there - One Stop Shopping! I love it!  The soup, fresh made food ready to heat at home and so much more! Daily food items & soups, lunch meat, cheese, and salads. Imported candles also available. Also frozen pierogi. Best of all open 7 days a week!

Their various European Rye Breads are ' the Bee's Knees '. I currently have a loaf of wonderfully dense Latvian Rye. I've had their Polish & Lithuanian Rye Breads in the past. All are authentic, like you'd find in Eastern Europe. Prices are reasonable, too.
Super delicious hot foods and bakery items.  I drive an hour to go there and it is always worth the trip!
I drove out to my old neighborhood to get kolaczki.  Spouse loved them.  Only problem is I don't think the staff is that knowledgeable about their products
Great place to buy eastern European traditional foods - Lithuanian sausage, z polish cabbage rolls etc. Plus bakery goods like puncki. I love a trip here.
Great joint! Had the Italian Beef special... dipped. Great service and the owners are very cool. I'll definitely stop again.

We always make it a point to stop here while we’re in town. Drool-worthy gyros, Italian beef, burgers and dogs. Family owned and run restaurant by folks who take pride in their high quality food. Prices are fantastic!
Food is good. Workers are always very friendly. I enjoy going here.

Amazing service! You always feel welcomed when coming to Windy City Hotdogs! AMAZING food! I have been coming here since I was 15. There is do much food to choose from, and in my opinion, the prices are AMAZING! They also accept call in orders, and are fairly quick on having it ready on time! This spot used to be cash only (although they still have an ATM handy inside), the even better news, they now accept credit/debit cards 😁. I will be going more often now that I know they accept cards! Keep up the great job!

I loved going here, the food and prices are great. We moved, but will try to stop by since it's worth it. And the customer service is great. The people there are always happy to help and make sure the order is correct.
Amazing. The red beet soup is rich and creamy. The potato pancakes and goulash was phenomenal. The bread and coffee worth the trip alone. Would highly recommend. Foodie 10/10.
Mabenka has very good home cooked food at a reasonable price. Waitresses are always polite. They have slots here too if you like that also.

I took my wife here cause she loves polish food. 
We experienced the worst customer service! Other people who came in after us were attended and seated first, they just stared at us without asking if we can be helped. They were 2. we were 2. Finally seated but she acted like she was doing us a favor. I will never go back!
The food is authentic polish.  We love the beet soup.The menu is extensive. Service is always good. Prices are reasonable and portions are a great value. Mabenka is a treasure on the south side.
This has to be the poorest excuse for and worst tasting hot roast beef plate I've ever had. Doesn't even live up to its title because it was served cold. I wouldn't feed this to a starving dog....
Beenc closed down

Hands down one of the best and longest running studios in the City of Chicago.. The staff at Essanay are incredible and the space is very accommodating with multiple productions in and out throughout each day ♡
Lights camera 🎥 action. Great space to rent for all your creative visual needs. Friendly staff and top of the line equipment.
Top of the line professional lighting/grip gear and production/stage space... love everyone who works here
Always great.  Wayne & Jules run a great company.  Best video studio in Chicago!!!
Super nice guys, helped me at closing time, and just for a roll of Gaf tape, definitely not a money making sale, and the guy treated me like I was renting 20 lights... great service.
Do good work and excellent place for Japanese American culture in Chicago
Helping our committee by helping others 😀

I come here for Quaker meeting every Sunday since Northside Friends Meeting borrows the space. It's a very nice space, and based on posters that I see, it seems that they have events going on all the time as well.
Great cultural experiences with their awesome free Japanese events.
Visit their website. They offer so much to the community!

We were greeted by an super friendly and helpful lady at the front desk. The exhibits and their descriptions were very well built and maintained. It amazes me how well the space was used to convey a story that dates back a 100 years or so. Thank you for the hospitality!!

Surprisingly extensive permanent exhibits. The bottom gallery rotates exhibits and bring in some very impressive artists and pieces. Was great to read all about the famous American brands that were started by Swedes! Kids museum and play area is fantastic, lots too keep the little ones entertained.
Great museum to learn Bout Swedish heritage and historically important dates.
great, cheap and lots of information about swedish culture and scandinavians.

This is a great facility.  I was there for a book reading, which took place in the main gallery.  The current exhibit includes some terrific large paintings, art that I look forward to revisiting.

The museum offers some lively activities, targeted to both kids and adults.  While many have a Swedish theme, others have a broader focus.  

I'm looking forward to becoming more actively engaged in the museum - and to seeing more of what is offered.

One of the best places for Bun Bo Hue, a favorite Vietnamese soup containing rice vermicelli and beef in Chicago. The broth was authentically made with simmered beef and pork bones for many hours and lemongrass. The bowl included thin slices of marinated and boiled beef shank, chunks of oxtail, pig's knuckles, and cubes of congealed pig blood, which has a color between dark brown and maroon, and a texture resembling firm tofu. The restaurant had plenty of space inside, and the service is fine. I usually found free parking spots on the roads nearby.

After having tried many spots on Argyle over the years, this is best place.  The service is attentive.  The food authentic. The portions substantial. The prices reasonable.  It's a large place, so it may not seem crowed; but the customer flow is very steady and discerning.  The only drawback is that the menu is a bit limited - mostly pho/soup and rice dishes. Not a lot of simple stir fry. But . . . it's the best.
Vietnamese food, super tasty. visited fri evening i think. the bill was decent for the quality.

vietnamese food and the feeling here is excellent. i give this place double thumbs up. i think i might become a regular. the bill was appropriate. menu is similar to a restaurant in jacksonville i loved.

I just randomly walked in and like a zombie, ordered some random food but when I tasted the food that I was indeed well pleased didn't make me rate this restaurant 4 starts, I am because I'm remembering how each time I looked up, they were there ready to serve and making sure that I'm happy. It was well worth the buy.

The food was good.
I was upset because the waiter who served our table was so rude.

I ordered the waiter and he disgraced me in front of the other guests because he could not understand my English.

Who will be served by whom?

If you are going to a restaurant here, please go to someone who speaks good English.
Or just a who speaks Chinese.
So much food to choose from! Love that they have dim sum all the time. Everything I picked out was great. Very easy to walk in and find "your eyes are bigger than your stomach "!

It's not free parking and they did not have certain foods and said they were out. Come on really out of chicken! Explained to staff that the website said free parking but there was poor understanding on there half to get my point across. Been to way better Dim Sum not impressed at all. Not worth the drive better off going to Chinatown. Communication is a number one reason for good customer service and I did not receive that here.

Service was ok. The first three course came out ridiculously fast. Almost too fast. We felt our each plate was taken away after someone noticed a last bite because another new dish would be placed in front of us so quickly. I felt the value of the 7 courses was fair but then again, I wasn't terribly hungry coming into this. Friend was disappointed overall with the meal but other friend thought it was a 'better than fine' meal for him. I was glad to have finally tried out Furama Restaurant and it was a wonderful way to end my first evening in Chicago with two of my best friends.

My favorite place for dim sum in the city. It might be partially nostalgia, since I have been coming here for over 20 years, but nothing beats it, especially for the price. I love the wide open feeling of the upstairs section when it's open.
Outstanding location for Vietnamese food. Got there near six, it wasn't packed at all. The service here is friendly.
I've been here multiple times! And keep coming again and again! Love this place
Tried this because my friends recommended and they love Vietnamese food. The noodles soup was pretty good, just a little more fatty than I wanted!

I will never go back. Absolutely, ridiculously terrible service. Super slow to take our order, very rude and dismissive attitude, drinks didn't come out until the end of the meal even though they were ordered first. Staff just sitting around doing nothing. Food was fine but I've had better pho at many other restaurants, including others right there on argyle. Save yourself the aggravation and check out one of the other many options Argyle has to offer.

Bumbled into this place simply because I had parked across the street. To say the food was awesome is an understatement. 

I ordered the Bun Bo Hue and managed to let a friend talk me into ordering the Bun Rieu via Facebook messenger. Oh well, guess I'll have lunch tomorrow

Absolutely phenomenal! Best duck ever. Brought home food which was fantastic. Exceptional service and food was served quick and hot. Will be there again for other items on the menu that looked simply yummy. Don't think about it, just go eat there! My reviews are for the best of the best. Like & Share.

This place is always worth it! 
I do have to say it's sad they no longer give tea at the tables.
The BBQ duck is melt in your mouth delish and cooked wonderfully. Try the scallops, you won't regret it for sure!
Amazing food and an amazing value. Call in early and get the duck, it's as good as you've heard. Drinks are also incredibly well priced. Will definitely be back again and again.

I've celebrated several special occasions here, and usually go for the duck feast (make sure you call ahead 24 hours & let them know you'll be ordering it if you want to ensure they have one for you). Last time I went I had the roast piglet and it was amazing.

So much more interesting than the typical Chinese restaurant. Roast duck is delicious, cut into odd chunks with the skin attached. Eggplant with garlic sauce wasn't very flavorful but the eggplant was perfectly cooked. I will return for more duck, Mike's fried chicken, etc., etc. This place can get very, very busy but we were there mid-afternoon when there was no wait. 4 instead of 5 stars because the place could use a good scrubbing. An easy walk from the Argyle Red Line stop: walk west, turn north onto Broadway.

Incredibly kind staff. Excellent food! 

There are only a handful of places in this area that are as treasured as this. The atmosphere is peaceful Zen. Highly recommended.

Ordered coconut pineapple smoothies.. WORST smoothies ever! Couldn't even finish a third of it. They have this extremely weird aftertaste but then also has a ton of sugar that I honestly felt like I'd get a diabetic shock if I did finish it. So if that wasn't enough, they are expensive as hell at $6.95. I am normally not stingy but when it tastes horrible and it's expensive -  that will have me not returning.
The dishes were too small. Had to order two entrees just for myself to feel satisfied. It is really too bad! This used to be one of my favorite places for Thai food.

I ordered more than $60 delivery. Apparently the entrees don't come with rice. That is an extra charge. Extremely overpriced for not a lot of food. When I called to ask about the rice they were rude, and then they called me back to tell me the exact same thing they told me in the first call. Huge waste of money. Very disappointing. And why would a curry just come with meat and sauce and NO RICE? Awful experience.
Very friendly staff. I have had meals here countless times. Very delicious food and they have very friendly prices.
Yummy

Visited Chicago for the first time and ate this delightful and delicious mom and pop restaurant. Meet the owner and his children that work there too.  The owner Welcomed us like a family.  Pizza was great and whole experience was one of the best I had for years.

Easily one of the top gems of Chicago! Prices are great, pizza is even better!!!! I’ve been coming here since I was a kid. If you haven’t tried it, you have to give it a chance! The thin crust pizza is phenomenal! Definitely a Chicago classic.

My kid only eats cheese  pizza( very picky). When were in the uptown area. He always asking me can we stop by Gigio's.  For Ten dollar 12" cheese pizza, can't beat the price. Plus it's really good pizza, perfect amount of cheese and sauce, crust is good little thick, but still good.
Stopped by late Saturday night. Picked up 3 slices for $11.50. They hot and tasty! Highly recommended if your in the area.

DO NOT ORDER ONLINE. IT'S WAY MORE EXPENSIVE.
Website doesn't say anything about this, but it's clear when you look at the menu in the restaurant, and the woman I spoke to when I got my take out order confirmed this. I had tried calling twice before ordering online, but both times it rang once, then hung up.  
Decent pizza. Garlic cheese bread is made on a sandwich roll.
Great customer service! Best Ghanaian restaurant in Chicago! I had the Omotuo and palm nut soup and it was amazing!!
Good food and it cost little
The Kontimire is quite good, but the fufu was sticky, like fufu made from a box. The jollof was dry and dull. The red red was equally bland. The plantain however, was good.

My twins & I stopped in this evening. I wanted to try this place because I'm usually always eating Nigerian Cuisine. However the young woman was so rude first of all. She was on the phone. Didn't acknowledge me & my children. So I asked if we could sit down. She shook her head yeah finally. When she came over I asked her what does she recommend we try? She was so nasty with her disposition & the way her face looked as if she drinks vinegar. She made my son's very uncomfortable!! So I just told her forget it & we left. No wonder this place was empty!!! SMH NEVER AGAIN!
Great and nice food

We've only had a few deliveries from here until today and the place did not disappoint. Food is great (we knew that from their deliveries and their packaging) and service was friendly and prompt. Will definitely come back (or get delivery) for sure.
Best bi bim bop in town! Come with a large group and get the scallion pancakes and fried dumplings they are the best ever!!!

Perfect place for date night. Korean comfort food meets date night restaurant. I’ve been to many Korean restaurants in the city and this is my favorite spot. Staff is friendly and helpful, especially if aren’t familiar. Banchan portions could be a little bigger, but overall atmosphere and offerings make up for it.
Jin Jin is one of our favorite restaurants in Chicago. We’ve never had a dish here that wasn’t fantastic. Favorites are pajun and the chap chae. Service is great and the atmosphere is so pleasant.
One of our favorite Korean restaurants. Check out those appetizers- fried chicken, savory pancake, tempura maki rolls, mandoo dumplings,etc. Entrees are equally satisfying.

The wait staff was super friendly, quick and accommodating. I got there at noon but my friend was running late, so i was told to sit at the bar to wait for her while they still took my name. I had their bloody Mary which was pretty decent. I chuckled when I asked for all the spice offered and the bartender warned me it would be "very" spicy. Being Latina, that has a different meaning for me. It had a good kick :)
When my friend finally arrived we were seated within minutes despite it having gotten busier. Our waiter was there right away, and our food came out fast. I had the biscuits and gravy.  The only thing preventing this from being 5 stars is that I would have liked a little more sausage in my gravy.  I wouldn't have minded waiting a few more minutes to allow the gravy to soak a little into the biscuits either. Having said that, it was still pretty good and my friend enjoyed her eggs Benedict very much. I also love that they immediately serve you small cake slices when they seat you. Today's choice was chocolate chip cake and it was very delicious. I would definitely come back.
Love this place. Friendly staff amazing food and atmosphere. Can't go wrong here. Large menu and lively atmosphere. Definitely go to Tweet.

I've been here many times and have not been disappointed. Great food, all made fresh. The coffee is the best and neverending. The atmosphere is bustling, especially on the weekend, but I've always received excellent service. You get a small piece of coffee cake when you sit down. All meals come with a cup of fresh fruit. Those extras go a long way to making breakfast at Tweets memorable.
Fantastic breakfast.  I always try to come here when in Chicago.  The food is really great but the vibe inside is also awesome.

Tweet is our favorite brunch place in the city! Everyone who works there is so kind and friendly! Especially when we bring our baby. They always offer her free banana slices and a toy basket. There are so many food options that I've been here more than 10 times and still never eaten the same thing twice. All of the food is expertly crafted and delicious.
It's OK. But imo not as tasty as traditional Indian
Great Food

A quirky reminder that Chicago isn't all glitzy skyscrapers, baseball, and craft beer. It's definitely worth a walkthrough if you're in the neighborhood, especially since some of the art on display seems not to have been changed out since before I was born. It's free, which is a bonus.
Full disclosure, my wife rents a space here. The FAB is a great space that provides affordable space to artists--it's really cool to walk through and see what people are working on!
One of the last truly cool places in Wicker Park. Fortress Weird. Get lost in this charming maze. One of a kind experience.
Smells weird on the 2nd floor...like someone is smoking cigarettes when they aren't supposed to be.  The cover up makes it smell even worse.
have done many things in this building including an escape room and poetry ready
Nice but very simple. Good tour with a deacon!
Nice looking cathedral.

Although it's clearly free for people to walk the grounds of this church, I was approached and escorted to a ticket office by a staff member. The office asked for 200birr! I told them I didn't want to go inside the cathedral and they said I still had to pay or I had to leave. The place had dozens of people walking the grounds who I highly doubt paid 200birr. Still I left the grounds. Even after exiting I was reprimanded by a guard for standing on the street near the cathedral. I'm used to getting foreigner prices,  but this is ridiculous.
Must visit in Addis. Better with guide for more interesting stories
Amazing design and painted windows, great hospitality

Wonderful exhibits and staff.  Lira music event absolutely delightful. Songs were deeply meaningful and soothing to hear.
The event catering meal was delicious.

History , stories and religious icons richly presented for all ages and beliefs in the displays.
I want to return and see more!

It is full of beautiful Polish art and history, and those working there know all about all of it. I had a great experience there, and I very much recommend people, (especially those with Polish lineage,) visit this museum.
Great place with a piece of polish history. Worth visiting at least once.
Very nice museum, you can have some give you a tour for free!
Wow, this was much better than I expected from looking at the building on the outside.  We had a great and knowledgeable tour guide.   Lots of good art to look at.  Very convenient location.
The greatest church!
Beautiful Church from both inside and outside
The cathedral is gorgeous and their liturgies are awesome. What more can one ask for?
Amazing
Amazing acoustics!
Came here for an art exhibition. Very nice venue for this event. Local non profits need more patronage. Come visit and enjoy the art and ambiance. 😄
Didn't come at their time of special exhibition. Only two galleries. Nothing significant.

Went here for Open House Chicago 2017 and was blown away. There were two separate exhibits; one featured work from a Puerto Rican artist, and the other showcased pieces made by inpatient mentally ill individuals. Both were incredible and powerful in different ways. The person working said that they switch out collections pretty regularly, so I'm sure they have more great artwork now!
Nice, well kept and the two shows I have seen here were nicely curated.
Cool place and free- check it out!

What an awesome bakery. Whether you are looking just for dessert after dinner, to take home for a few nights that week, or to get a custom cake for a birthday party or other event, Alliance is an amazing place to get your sweets.
This was one of the first bakeries that we went to when we moved to Chicago, and it is still one of the best bakeries that we have been to in Chicago six years later. We just got our birthday cake for our son's birthday, and it was beyond anything that we could have expected. I took a screenshot on my phone and they perfectly replicated it onto his cake.
Oh, any other things that they make that aren't sweet are delicious and so is there coffee. All around this place is great.

I came in on a Thursday and only had a vague idea that I wanted a cake based on the comic Heart and Brain. They took it and ran with it. The cake was incredible and delicious and delivered by Sunday morning at a reasonable price. Truly a neighborhood gem, I could not recommend more!
Gave them a design to follow and they met it and surpassed expectations! Was informative and worked with me with all the details from the beginning to the end. Would 10/10 come back!!
Great little spot in the heart of downtown Chicago. Small place with lots of character. Good selection of donuts. Solid coffee.

This hole-in-the-wall bakery is a nice little shelter for a cold winter morning in Chicago. The almond croissants and the chocolate croissants were nothing special, but the chocolate and peanut butter vegan cupcakes were out-of-this-world. Seriously incredible light and fluffy peanut butter frosting. Wow. Unfortunately, their little lounge area is a few doors down, but pretty nice. A good mood. The employees were competent, but not overly friendly. Overall, good vibe. Between the tasty pastries and the stack of newspapers, it seems like a great place to be a regular.

Kasia's is great. Have a delicious European meal. I usually stop there for a nice lunch plate that they will heat up if requested.
Its deli style. There's a few tables but most carryout. Very reasonably priced especially for the quality of food.

I've never been disappointed with their food OR service. Their chicken noodle soup is clean and everything you want when you're sick. Brings back memories of Campbell's soup only better and without all the chemicals. Haha SO GOOD

Always serving home cook meals such as Ukrainian soups and polish soups and German soups I love their sauerkraut with sausage. They make a decent mushroom pierogies, are portobello stuffed mushrooms with spinach. Their prices are affordable with you provided the food that you're purchasing.
Awesome deli with great service! Food was delicious!
Excellent customer service. Catered Thanksgiving through them this year and it was not only amazing but very affordable!  So delicious!

Excellent fast Mexican food. Great lengua tacos. No attitude, no wait, clean place. Just got an expansion. Really good taco dinner meal and a fair price. 

Friendly professional staff. 

Could be open later on the weekend.

My friend talked about this place for hours until I finally gave in and went. Best tacos in the city hands down. They give you a lot of meat and its packed with flavor. Not to mention it's super juice. I will definitely be going back soon.

Steak is tender and full of flavor. Keep it simple onion, cheese and cilantro on a steak burrito is all you need. Service is always quick and friendly. My only issue is the tiny door way. I was hard getting through both doors a stroller.

I’ve been coming to this place for over 15 years, and over the years, the price has been going up, and the quality of food down. The receptionists are always friendly, it’s just the quality of food and the price that don’t correlate.
Great Neighborhood spot. Good food, friendly service and affordable. Recommended...

The guy who runs this place is hilarious. We sat down and he told us we needed to have a few "authentic polish" dishes to share and let him order for us. He then gave the exact same speech and brought the same food to every other table that sat down. Food was great but it's really funny watching this guy run the bill up and make people feel special over the exact same speech every ten minutes.
Awesome ethnic food! The owner was really cool and ordered us his favorite dishes as kind of tasting menu. BYOB and fair pricing.

I love this place. I've been going there for 20 years and the food is always great. My favorite is their cabbage soup. I always buy at least 2 to go, usually 3, though. All the food is homemade. The perogies are so good...I always over order. 
There's nothing fancy and pretentious here. It's just a large, kinda dark room with a bar (not a booze bar) packed with newspapers. It's in a convenient location right by the blue line, Ashland bus, and division bus. 
I really wish they'd stay there forever and won't let gentrification run them off. I think the owners own the whole building, so... :D
Love Podhalanka. Great Polish food, awesome prices, historic. BYOB and cash only.
Authentic Polish food. Very good and the little lady in there was very sweet. The soup was delicious

When we can’t make it to the Chicago Diner (our fave vegan restaurant), this place is a great place to go. Plus, it feels “healthier” than Chicago Diner and I don’t leave feeling over-full. The menu is always changing and they add great seasonally-focused specials. Never been disappointed by their wide array of unique options!
Love, love, LOVE this location in particular! Food is ALWAYS on point! Staff is super friendly! I go here probably too often!
BBQ Brisket burger was amazing. The potato salad paired nicely to cut the spice down a bit.

I gave it 4 stars. Because I think that the customer service needs to be a top priority in any establishment where your survival is the customers.  My first time here I came in to the register, the cashier never acknowledged me I came up to place my order she walked off, didn't say a word, only when she came back to take my oder. An once my food was prepared, a to go order the waitress just place my food on the table an walked off again not a word spoken.  But I can say that the food was really tasty being a vegan burger I had the bbq brisket sandwich.  An I loved it coming from a meatlover.
Food is exquisite. Even my very carnivorous boyfriend is always excited to come here
I thought this was an absolutely fantastic place to work and relax. It's quite cozy

Love this place!! Super spacious seating area and delicious, affordable menu. It's the best place to work in Wicker Park. The best seats are by the windows in the front; toward the back it can be pretty dark. There are a few drink items I wish they had, but their iced coffee is good and their breakfast sandwiches are excellent.

Filter has a great atmosphere, good coffee and tea, and decent food options. Their art displays are almost always interesting. They also play good music. Staff is usually overworked and on edge, but they tend to be very friendly. Busy place with few good seating options usually by mid afternoon. Would definitely recommend getting in early if you can. Also, a good place for studying.

Filter has a great environment; plenty of comfortable and homey seating, surprisingly delicious food, and nice staff! The place can easily get crowded, but is still a open and relaxing environment to talk, work, eat, or get coffee. I go there a lot at night when I have to work. There are never more than a handful of people after 7pm or later so it can be a perfect place to knock out a couple hours of reading or work!
Very relaxing vibe, plenty of seating and a wide variety on the menu. I'm not a local but I can tell this place is the locals choice. Everything is good in a coffee shop.
Average sushi at best... A couple unique dishes and solid service, but the sushi quality (we had tuna, salmon and king crab) average to below average on a Friday night.

The owner was horrible. He and the karaoke manager tried to get over my guest and I because we  didn't drink. It was sad that he was not willing to talk to us and listen to us. and to make matters worst he completely disrespected myself and over 20 guest that we had come to his restaurant for my 23rd bday. Never in my life have i seen anyone get mad at group of people in their 20s because they didn't want to buy alcohol. We offered to buy soft drinks and give $5 donations but that wasn't good enough. I will never go back to this place . The owner tried to intimidate us, and we didn't get any apologies.
Good sushi option in Wicker Park.  Favorite dish is the pan seared scallops.  Sushi always tastes fresh and staff is always professional and friendly.
Service, sushi, drinks - pretty standard. Large space and good for groups.
Must try the house crunch and the chili spicy tuna!

Stumbled by this place on accident on our way to another sushi spot. Lemme start by telling you that from the moment we walked in, the gentleman that served us was kind as can be; made us feel right at home. The food is outstanding and even had 2 select rolls of the month for half price. The ambiance is very unique, having artwork that fuses old Japan with the new. Overall, really cool place. Thank you V for being so patient and kind to us even when we were tired and practically senile. Hahaha. We cant wait to tell everyone about this place. ;)
Great customer service. Great music. Alot of variety in the menu. The food was great.
Their sushi is incredible also try their hot bowls. It comes with delicious bacon or beef and hot rice if you’re hungrier than sushi 🍣 🥩

We came late mid-week, ambiance was like a chilled bar with house music in the background. Service was friendly and welcoming. Food was fresh and delicious. Portions were generous and good value. Will come back whenever in Chicago.

Hands down the best sushi in Chicago! U got to dine in and check out this place. Staff is uber friendly and service is excellent. And they even have anime and house music to create an urban, ultra trendy crossover of Chicago and Japan. If u want to lounge out, relax and enjoy great food u got to check out Sushi X!

I could talk forever on how great Coal Fire pizza is. The food is amazing!! Cooked to perfection with fresh ingredients. The service is outstanding, you'll very seldom have to ask for something. The servers are always close by to address your needs. 
We live south of Chicago but will take the trip North to eat here. Actually, we can drive 45 miles. Or pizza, eat dinner and drive home, quicker than staying home and going to a pizza place. They greet you at the door and you feel at home. 
If you like thin pizza, with tons of freshness. Then there is none better than Coal Fire pizza!!!
Not at all the typical Chicago deep dish... And was excellent... Wood stove made great thin crust, nice light sauce and cheese. And kids loved too

Local pizza place open by two awesome guys. (David & Bill)    It comes as no surprise that this pizza has been awarded one of Chicago's Best by Chicago magazine. And I have also seen two different Pizza tour trucks making a stop here as I grabbed one to go on my way home. Fresh ingredients like fresh mozzarella, basil spinach with homemade sauce ,homemade crust done in a coal-fired oven. You can make your own  pie  or choose one of their delicious specialties  pizzas . so delicious just talking about it is making me hungry.
            The very first time I went  they made me feel like I was a regular. Everyone from the server's, cashier's, Cooks and the owners the whole staff  makes you feel like a VIP  or a member of the family . 
         Grab one of the many delicious salads thén move on to your choice of pie. order one for yourself take the rest home. it'll be a nice snack later when you're wishing you had more you'll have it:-) :-) and then grab a delicious dessert provided by local merchants. They won me over with  the pizza  I kept me coming back because of the great service . One of my favorite Chicago spots doing the light modern thin crust worthy of Mama Nona. It's also a great place to grab grub on your way to a concert or sporting events as they are conveniently located less than 5 minutes away.
These pizzas are so good and so light is hard not to over eat. The variety is great. Service is super fast and friendly.

Excellent thin crust pie with loads of options available. We were greeted immediately. I can't comment too much on the service since we went early on a Saturday afternoon and there was hardly anyone there. I would definitely recommend this place if you didn't want a traditional deep dish pizza.

This place is awesome!!  Pizza is amazing and beer selection great as well.  The specialty honey butter fried chicken pizza was really different and delicious.  You will probably have to wait a bit but there are options for drinks close by.

CHICAGO! Piece Brewery and Pizza! 
Owner Billy Jacobs blew me away with his " New Haven " style Pizza!! The Flavor of the crust alone is off the charts and there is also the perfect balance between crunch with a little chew. Order The New Haven Traditional Pizza as soon as you walk in! It is made with their red sauce, no mozzarella. Topped with garlic, Parmesan and finished with olive oil. It is awesome! Oh and the Beer! The Head Brewer Jonathan Cutler has won so many Beer medals I lost count! Order The Weight, It is one of the best beers I have ever had! They are located at 1927 W North Ave, Chicago, IL 60622 Get there now! To see the video we shot there go to my You Tube page A Biker Dude

Pizza is a thin crust style and it comes on a sheet pan--a large will feed three adult drunk men with zero leftovers. The beer list is robust. My only issue is the place is incredibly crowded, and they really pack in the people (a good issue to have for a business I guess!). Definitely will go again--I really like the big opaque window ceiling thing they have.

Best pizza in Wicker! A very fresh take with great beer and even better thin crust pizza. Enjoyable spot to go with family, friends, on a date, and especially to watch a game. Also great for takeout. If you’re in the area, you don’t wanna miss this place. Try the beer flights!

Great pizza got a medium honey butter fried chicken, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Unique taste, super thin crust. Medium pizza easily served two people. Recommend Piece Brewery if you enjoy thin crust pizza.

Been here a couple times and the food, drinks and atmosphere are really good. It is a bit pricier, and it is not an "authentic" style Mexican restaurant. It is meant to be a little more unique. You can taste that everything is made fresh, even the tortillas, which in my opinion is what makes the whole taco at this place. My wife from California says Big Star is the closest thing that reminds her of home.

Came here with my brother on Valentine's Day just for a quick bite. We expected the place to be crowded and moving slow due to the holiday. Our experience was the complete opposite! Amazing service, fast, fresh, and a fun staff. At a point my brother and I order tacos and counted down from 30 to see of the service would stay the same. The tacos arrived by the time we hit the last 10 seconds.
Really enjoyed the tacos and queso at Big Star! Super fast service and good customer service. Definitely one of the better taco spots to check out!
Solid tacos excellent drink list. I like cocktails here. Fast services when sit at the bar. Pretty hard to find the parking on weekends.

On one hand, this place offers very good food, great in taste and and high in quality. Service was good, considering that Saturday afternoon during our visit the place was packed, yet we didn’t have to wait for the table. Fish tacos are a must try, they were pretty amazing. On the other, they lack a verity of beer, considering that there is a full bar. Overall, I’d say that it’s a little bit overpriced for the quantity of food, but I am likely to go back.
